loans.use: To buy furniture to improve the comfort of and service to her clients.

loans.name: Asiah's Group

texts.en: My name is Asiah L.. I was married eleven years ago and have four kids: three boys and one girl. All of my kids attend school except my daughter who is not yet of school-going age. I have enrolled my kids in school so that they do not have to do menial jobs like my husband and I and can earn a decent living for themselves. My husband sells milk while I make zippers. We need a loan to expand our milk business by buying a dairy cow. My loan group includes: Kishwer B.( her husband drives a horse cart), Kubra B. (who embroiders clothes) and Parween A. (who runs a tea stall).

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Chheangmeng

texts.en:
Mr Chheangmeng M. and his wife (pictured together) were married in 1995 and have two sons, both of whom are in school. His wife stays at home to take care of the children. The family lives along National Road number 6 about 15kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr Chheangmeng has been working in a flywood factory located in his village as a lathe operator for 15 years. He has one brother who is a blacksmith in Kampong Cham province about 150km from Phnom Pehn. His brother needs some blacksmith materials to operate his own business and lacks money.

Mr Chheangmeng is requesting a loan of US$700 to purchase blacksmith material for his brother’s business.

loans.use: To purchase blacksmith materials for his brother's business.

loans.name: Luu Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Luu Thi G., 26 years old, has been with TYM since joining the group in 2006. After marriage, she work with her husband parent in their home mechanical services. In her first loan cycle, the money she borrowed was solely used to upgrade the store. Their daily routine is creating the products in the morning and selling it to customers during the rest of the day. Aside from the main job, her husband also earns money by carrying things for people. To be able to increase production and profit, she would like to borrow 9 more million VND in this loan cycle from TYM. Currently, her family monthly income is about 3 million vnd.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Lưu Thị Gái năm nay 26 tuổi. Sau khi kết hôn chị sống cùng bố mẹ chồng, hai vợ chồng chị đều tham gia sản xuất tại cơ sở sản xuất cơ khí riêng của gia đình nhà chồng. Chị Gái tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2006.Vòng vốn đầu chị vay để đầu tư vào xưởng cơ khí của gia đình. Hàng ngày chồng chị cùng gia đình sản xuất hàng hóa sau đó chị đem bán tại các chợ cho người tiêu dùng vì thế thu nhập của gia đình chị rất ổn định. Ngoài thời gian sản xuất hàng cơ khí cho vợ bán, chồng chị còn đi chở hàng thuê cho người dân địa phương khi họ có nhu cầu vì thế kinh tế gia đình chị ngày càng phát triển. . Để có vốn mở rộng sản xuất kinh doanh và đầu tư máy móc, vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay thêm 9.000.000đ từ nguồn vốn của Quỹ. Hiện nay thu nhập của gia đình chị đạt 3.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Services

loans.name: Yazmin Arely

texts.es:
Yazmín started her business because she liked working and having her own money to buy herself things as well as contributing to the household expenses to relieve some of the burden from her husband. She began her business selling tamales more than 2 years ago and initially only sold to close family. Gradually, she sold to more people, usually working on request so that her tamales didn’t sit unsold and so that she didn’t end up with a bad investment that could be very difficult to recover later.

She needs a $300 loan, which she will repay in six months, to purchase ingredients and put out requests for events and ultimately provide her customers with good service.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

Yazmín inició el negocio porque le gusta trabajar y tener su propio dinero para comprarme sus cosas, además de que también coopera con los gastos de la casa para que a su esposo no se le haga pesado. Comenzó su negocio de venta de tamales hace mas de dos años y en un inicio solo vendía a sus familiares cercanos, pero poco a poco fue vendiendo a mas personas, por lo general trabaja sobre pedido para que no se queden sin vender y que no resulte una mala inversión porque después es muy difícil recuperar.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 6 meses el cual le servirá para comprar materia prima y poder sacar varios pedidos para eventos y hay que darles un buen servicio a sus clientes.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients.

loans.name: Suraiya's Group

texts.en:
Suraiya baji is the wife of M.A. G.. She lives in the small city of Kasur,Pakistan, famous for its sweetmeat and shoes. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the last 28 years. Suraiya is the mother of four children: one son and three daughters. Her son works in a cloth factory where he maintains power loom machines. Her first two daughters make decorative embroidered dresses and sell them in the market. Suraiya baji's husband works in a clothing factory and he also takes care of the power loom machines. Suraiya baji is a housewife and also makes thread to order. She is the only woman who is an expert in thread making in her community. She successfully completed her two loans from Asasah (a Pakistan microfinance institute). Now she is applying for a loan to buy a thread making machine which will make her effort less and increase her profit.

Suraiya baji is joined in her loan group by four other members. Rehana baji wants a loan to buy cloth to resell. Azizan baji wants a loan to buy fruits to resell. Bilquis baji wants a loan to buy thread for her embroidery business. Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy material (thread, cloth) for her embroidery business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
Jorge Alberto es un comerciante de 33 años de edad del Rancho La Reforma, comunidad localizada en Montemorelos Nuevo León.

Jorge Alberto inicó su negocio hace 5 años, en un principio se dedicó a la venta de pacas para ganado, es importante señalar que su surgimiento como microempresario se dio derivado de la necesidad por autoemplearse y contar con una fuente de ingresos para atender las necesidades de su familia. La familia de Jorge Alberto se compone por su esposa e hija de 6 años de edad.

Actualmente, solicita un préstamo por US $350 a un plazo de 4 meses para la compra de semillas y fertilizantes, lo cual ayudaría a contar con un mayor surtido en su negocios. ¡Los invito a que apoyemos a Jorge Alberto y así ayudemos a las actividades del campo mexicano!
texts.en:
Jorge Alberto is a 33-year-old merchant from the ranch La Reforma, a community in Montemorelos Nuevo León. He currently asks for a 320 USD loan for four months for the purchase of seeds and fertilizers, a purchase that would allow him to diversify his businesses. Jorge Alberto began working here five years ago; he began selling a rodent called a paca in the livestock market, He lives with his wife and his 6 year old daughter. I invite you to support Jorge Alberto and thus help the activities of Mexican agriculture!

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de semillas y fertilizante

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
La Sra. Raquel tiene ya más de 10 años con su negocio de publicidad por las callas de Nuevo Laredo esté negocio es la fuente de ingresos de su familia ya que es madre soltera y tiene una hija que está estudiando la universidad en la carrera de ciencias en la comunicación (Conductora de radio o televisión y periodismo).

Al negocio de la Sra. Raquel le está haciendo falta un nuevo equipo de publicidad más moderno y que tenga más potencia de sonido.

Para así poder anunciar mejor los productos de sus clientes que solicitan del perifoneo por las colonias.

Raquel a tenido ya un crédito con Fvp el cual lo pago puntualmente ahora está solicitando un préstamo de $500.00 por medio de Kiva para comprar un equipo de sonido nuevo.
texts.en:
Raquel has more than 10 years experience at her publicity business. The business is her family's sole source of income, seeing Raquel is a single mother and has a daughter who is studying at university in communications (radio or television broadcasting and journalism). Raquel's business needs a new, modern megaphone speaker system with more amplification power. Raquel has had one loan with FVP, which she paid back on time. She is requesting a loan of US $500 from Kiva to purchase new sound equipment.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a new megaphone speaker system

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia es madre soltera, tiene 40 años, vive con sus 4 hijos: Luzdelia de 23, Fredy de 18, Susana de 15 y Maria de 12. Se dedica a la producción y venta de chompas, hace ya 17 años, gustándole mucho su trabajo, ya que si algo sabe hacer muy bien Julia es el tejer, labor que aprendió de su madre, la cual desde muy pequeña la motivó para que aprendiera este oficio, que hoy en día es su principal fuente de ingresos. A Julia se le hace muy rentable su negocio, ya que por cada chompa cobra un aproximado de 25 soles y produce en gran cantidad, trabaja durante casi todo el día, siendo lo más difícil de su trabajo el no disponer de tiempo para realizar otro tipo de actividades, pero a Julia que esta acostumbrada al trabajo duro esto se le hace un problema mínimo, ya que lucha por un motivo muy grande....su familia. Este es su primer préstamo en microfinanzas PRISMA. Con el dinero que solicita prestado ella comprará mayor cantidad de lana para aumentar la producción de chompas y por ende, generar mayores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Julia is a single mother, she is 40-years old and lives with her 4 children: Luzdelia is 23, Fredy is 18, Susana is 15 and Maria is 12. She is dedicated to the production and sales of sweaters and has enjoyed this job for that past 17-years as it is something she knows how to do well. Julia learned to knit from her mother, when she was little she was motivated to learn this trade, which today it is her main source of income.

For Julia this is a very profitable business, as each sweater costs approximately 25 soles which she produces in large quantity. Sometimes she will work all day and feels that it is very difficult work to complete things timely when she has other activities to do. Despite this, Julia is accustomed to working hard to minimize problems as she fights for a great cause – her family. With this first loan from microfinanzaz PRISMA, she will purchase a large supply of wool to produce sweaters to generate more profits.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more wool for her shop.

loans.name: Set

texts.en: Mrs. Set B. is a 45-year-old and lives in Angk village in Kandal Province. She and her husband, Mr. Muong Samai, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. On this plantation, they face some problems because they do not have enough rice seed to cultivate. Therefore, Mrs. Set B. decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seeds to cultivate, and she would use the rest of the money to purchase fertilizers and fuel to make her crop more productive. Mrs. Set B. has five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory, while the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds, fertilizers, and fuel to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Modesta Alicia

texts.es:
La señora Modesta Alicia S. tiene la edad de 76 años, su estado civil es viuda, Doña Modesta tiene 1 hijo de la edad de 40 años y trabaja por cuenta propia y además le ayuda a su Mama en la venta, sus propósitos son de incrementar su negocio y mantenerlo de forma activa, los deseos son de mantener su negocio activo para generar mas ingresos a su familia, sus sueños son de seguir con vida para seguir adelante con su negocio y darle a su casa las respectivas mejoras para vivir como ella desea.


La actividad económica es la elaboración de cosa de horno, prisionero y queques, la ubicación de su negocio es en la siguiente dirección barrio el calvarito tenis 75 varas arriba, el tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de 24 años, ella inicia este negocio por cuenta propia ya que su Mama le había enseñado a elaborar este tipo de oficio ya que ellas no vivían en león ya que a los 15 años de edad decide venirse a vivir en león y para poder sobrevivir instala una panadería y que este le pudiera generar ingresos para su familia y es así como su negocio obtiene fama en su cuadra por las riquísimas cosas de hornos que ella misma preparaba  ya que además de elaborar la cosa de horno también podía realizar prisionero y quesadilla pero debido a la edad  que tiene actualmente ya no pudo continuar realizando los prisioneros y las quesadillas por lo que decide solo vender las cosas de hornos, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que tiene que realizar las compras de materia prima ya que ella tiene que comprar al por mayor para que este le resulte mas favorable como seria la compra de: harina, azúcar, huevo y queso entre otros.
texts.en:
Modesta Alicia S. is 76 years old and a widow. Modesta has a 40 year old son who is self-employed and helps his mother with sales. Her goal is to increase her business and keep active in it; her wish is to keep the business going so that she can generate more income for her family and her dream is to better her life through her business and make the home improvements she wishes to make. She has been in business for 24 years, selling baked goods such as cakes in the neighbourhood known as " el calvarito tenis 75 varas arriba". She opened the business herself as her mother had taught her this trade before they lived in León. She moved to León at the age of 15 and opened a bakery in order to make ends meet. With this business, she was able to make enough money to support her family and as her business became well known in her neighbourhood because of the delicious baked goods she made herself. In addition to baking, she realized she could also prepare foods such as quesadillas. Due to her age, she finds herself unable to continue making quesadillas and so has decided to sell only baked goods. The loan is for working capital which she will use to buy raw materials in bulk to maximize her profits, products such as: flour, sugar, eggs and cheese among others.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Fortaleza Group

texts.es: El grupo "Fortaleza" esta representada por la señora Cathy e integrada por 14 miembros los cuales son dinámicos y con ganas D. progresar en su trabajo. En su mayoría el grupo se dedica a actividades comerciales como la venta D. comida, cosméticos, zapatos y algunos a la prestación D. sevicias D. construcción D. vivienda y a la venta D. abarrotes en tiendas D. barrio. Dentro del ámbito laboral en especial el comercial existe gran competencia dentro del mercado por lo que le obliga a los miembros a mejorar la calida D. sus productos para poder luchar contra la competencia. El destino del financiamiento es para el incremento D. capital y a la compra D. insumos y materiales para mejorar sus productos puestos a la venta. En general el grupo no tienen experiencia en grupos solidarios pero aseguran ser gente responsable y con gran calidad humana por lo que la fundación agrocapital les brinda la oportunidad D. incrementar sus ingresos y D. mejorar la calidad D. vida D. sus familias.
texts.en:
The “Fortaleza” group is represented by Señora Cathy and consists of 14 members who are dynamic and willing to progress in their work. The majority of the group dedicate themselves to commercial activities such as selling food, cosmetics and shoes and some are in housing construction and grocery sales in neighborhood stalls.

In the labor market, especially within the commercial sector, there is great competition in the market which forces the members to improve the quality of their products in order to fight the competition. The loan’s destiny is to increase their capital and also to purchase components and material to improve the products they sell.

In general, the group does not have any experience of working in a sympathetic group like this but they guarantee that they are responsible people with great human qualities and as such the Fundacion Agrocapital offers them the opportunity to increase their revenue and better their families’ quality of life.


Translated from Spanish by Ines Teles, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational capital

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie M. grows rice in her farm. She is 25 years old and has only one child. Jimry M., her husband, is also a farmer. Together, they till the land, which they inherited from their parents. They do not mind the labor but happily touch the loam, wet soil, feel the heat of the sun to ensure that there is enough food to share on their table.

Rosalie is requesting a loan from CEVI of 9,000 pesos. Her loan will be used to buy fertilizers and herbicides. She believes that her loan will bring her more harvest. For her, fertilizers will definitely increase her yield. Aside from farming, she is also considering seeking some other line of business to help her address the needs of her family.

CEVI provides their clients not just the credit assistance that they need, but also training in their businesses and insurance coverage to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers, herbicides.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: Elsie is 40 years old, has been married for twenty-one years and has seven children, all of whom are going to school. Her husband is a mini-bus (jeepney) driver. Elsie used her savings to start a business in food vending. She manages it by cooking delicacies in front of their house. She sells around the area. She is also employed in vegetable vending for additional income. Elsie dreams of having a stall for her growing business. She wants her children to finish their studies and live in comfortable house.

loans.use: purchase additional ingredients used in food vending

loans.name: Sang

texts.en: Mrs. Sang S. is 55 years old and she lives in Sophy village in Takeo province. She is a pig breeder. Since her pigs are growing bigger, she needs money to buy pig meal to support her business. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan for this  purpose. She would use the rest of the money to buy two cows for breeding to earn more income. Her husband, Mr. Chea Saroeun, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. He also is a palm juice collector. Mrs. Sang S. has three children, two of whom work in a garment factory while the other attends the local school. Her husband is on the left in the picture.

loans.use: To buy pig meal for her pigs, and to buy two cows for breeding to earn more income.

loans.name: Maria Marlene

texts.es:
La señora Maria Marlene P. V. tiene 53 años vive en el distrito de Paijan,  provincia de Ascope, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió secundaria completa, no continuo estudiando debido a que se caso y tuvo que dedicarse a su hogar. Tiene 04 hijos de los cuales ninguno depende económicamente de ella.
María tiene una bodega, inicio su negocio vendiendo gaseosa y cerveza, con el tiempo fue ampliando su negocio con la venta de abarrotes y ahora tiene una bodega muy surtida, también se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza desde hace 6 años con las ganancias que a obtenido a podido comprar una vitrina y andamios para su bodega, negocio que desarrolla en su propio domicilio. 
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Manos Unidas”, lo invirtió en la compra de gaseosas y golosinas.
Con el crédito de 1000 soles, que será cancelado en  6 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra de cerveza y abarrotes para su bodega.
María sueña con construir su casa y tener un restaurante.
texts.en:
Señora María Marlene P. V. is 53 and lives in the district of Paijan, in the province of Ascope, in the department of La Libertad in Perú. She studied through high school and didn't continue studying because she got married and had to take care of her home. She has 4 children, none of whom still depend on her financially. María has a grocery store and started her business selling soft drinks and beer. With time, she expanded her business by selling groceries and now has a store with a lot of variety. She also has sold beauty products for 6 years. With her profits she has been able to buy a display case and shelves for her store, a business that she has in her own home. With her first loan of 300 PEN, which she received from her communal bank, "Manos Unidas" (United Hands), she invested in the purchase of soft drinks and candy. With this credit of 1,000 PEN, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will invest in the purchase of beer and groceries for her store. María dreams about building her own home and having a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beer and groceries for her store

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles O. is a 26-year-old father of one child, age 4. He sells new clothes and particularly enjoys selling suits in the Nyamasaria slum. He is always looking for business, including from this interviewer. He wants to buy more clothes because he believes with more options, more customers will come to his shop. He is asking for 10,000 KSH to build out his stall to accommodate more stock.

Charles recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW he will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of his community who are sick with a variety of illnesses. His work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin-enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: buying more new clothing for re-sale

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario P. is 51 years old and married to Noli P. who is a laborer. They live in the village of Magsaysay, Naguillian, Isabela. They are blessed with four children; Charlon is 18 years old and is presently studying in college, Chester is 17 years old and is also studying in college, Noli P. Jr. is 13 years old and is studying in secondary school, and their youngest, Noli Rose, is 11 years old and is studying in primary school. Rosario is thankful because they still can manage to eat three times a day. 

She hopes that she can have the PHP 10,000 loan she is requesting. She will use the loan for her poultry business. This is an important business for her family because it helps pay for a large portion of her children’s education. She has been in business for two years and feels that she is ready to expand her business and increase her income. Especially now that two of her children are studying in college, their school costs are getting higher and an increase in income would be very helpful. She is trying to be more diligent in her work to help her husband support their daily needs.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Norita

texts.es:
La señora Norita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Hilmer Torres”, vive en el Jr. Alfonso Ugarte, Distrito D. Morales, Provincia San Martin, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 57 años, 04 hijos todos ellos ya independientes y formando sus propias  familias.

Norita, a su edad aun se siente con fuerzas para seguir trabajando, ella se dedica a la venta D. bebidas gasificadas. Manifiesta que con el negocio que ejerce se siente muy tranquila y contenta, es ella quien administra su negocio. Se siente muy capaz y responsable con las cuotas que debe pagar mensualmente al Banco Comunal.

Actualmente continúa con el mismo negocio,  es conocida en el barrio; ya que sus gaseosas las venD. bien heladitas al gusto del cliente.
Con este préstamo D. S/ 1,000.00, desea invertirlo comprando mas bebidas gaseosas D. diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas. Así como agua mineral con gas y sin gas.
 
Se siente orgullosa por haber logrado implementar su negocio, y asegurarse una vejez tranquila. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por haberla ayudado a superarse y a otras mujeres que quieren salir adelante y a defenderse como mujeres.
texts.en:
Norita belongs to the "Hilmer Torres" Community Bank and lives on Alfonso Ugarte Street, in Morales District, San Martin Province and Department. She is married, 57 years old, and has 4 children, all of whom are now independent, with families of their own. At her age, Norita still has energy to keep working. She sells carbonated beverages. She says that with her business she feels very secure and content. She is responsible for administering the business. She feels responsible to the Community Bank and able to make her monthly payments. She currently is working in the same business and is well known in the neighborhood because she sells her sodas well-chilled as her clients like them. With this loan of 1000 PEN she wants to invest in buying sodas of different flavors, sizes and brands, as well as mineral water, both carbonated and still. She is proud of herself for having been able to start this business, guaranteeing herself a secure old age. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for having helped her and other women to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Kamsvaag, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sodas to augment the products she sells

loans.name: Aide

texts.es:
Aide es socia del Banco Comunal Los Claveles.
Aide es casada, tiene 37 años y 4 hijos, Aide tiene un multiservicios en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, artículos de librería, bebidas, golosinas, ropa, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además Aide brinda el servicio de preparación de comidas para diferentes eventos.
Aide necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra detergentes, jabones, bebidas y lapiceros.
Los sueños de Aide son que sus hijos culminen sus estudios profesionales, comprar una fotocopiadora y un carro.
texts.en:
Aide is a member of the community bank “Los Claveles”. She is 37 years old, married and has 4 children. She has a business at her house selling groceries, office and school supplies items, beverages, candy and clothes; activity in which she works every day. Aide provides catering services, preparing meals for different events. Aide is asking for a loan of $350 that will be invested in the purchase of detergents, soaps, drinks and pens. Aide’s dreams are that her children finish their professional education and to buy a copy machine and a car.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
El señor Arturo Z. es padre de familia y quiere lo mejor para ellos.
Tiene poco que adquirió su vivienda por medio de un crédito gubernamental, pero le está haciendo falta algunos arreglos y desean empezar en poner el vitropiso y poco a poco otros detalles.
 Pero en esté momento no cuanta con el dinero necesario para comprar el material  y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de poner el vitropiso, es por eso que esta solicitando un préstamo y así su familia este más cómoda en su casa.
  Don Arturo trabaja en el aria de despachador en una compaña de transportes, este el ingreso que genera para su familia y con el cual una parte será para pagar el crédito.
  Cuando se realizo la visita a la vivienda del señor Arturo el se encontraba trabajando y quien nos atendió fue su esposa la señora Carmela Francisco Clemente quien es la persona de la foto.
texts.en:
Mr. Arturo Z. is a father and wants the best for his family. He recently rented his home through a government loan, but it needs some repairs and they want to put in a tile floor and little by little add other details. At the moment he doesn’t have the money necessary for the materials and labor to install the floor, so he is seeking a loan so his family may be more comfortable in their home. Arturo works as a dispatcher for a transportation company. This income is for his family and a part of it will be used to pay the loan. When a visit was made to Arturo’s home he was working and it was his wife, Mrs. Carmela Francisco Clemente, who greeted us and appears in the photo.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install a tile floor

loans.name: Cheoun

texts.en:
Cheoun C., age 49, is married and has 6 children. Five of his children are students and another one is employed at a local garment factory. He lives with his wife (pictured) in Phnom Penh City. He and his wife work together in the grocery business. This earns them collectively an income of US$ 10 per day.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, C. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, C. is seeking to increase his income and improve his business. He is asking for a loan of US$ 500 to purchase more various kinds of groceries to sell because this business is the primary source of income for his family.

loans.use: purchasing more groceries

loans.name: Kazeem

texts.en: Kazeem is 35 years old and married with 2 children. He sells sarongs. Kazeem lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. He is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell.  He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Damali's Group

texts.en:
N. Damali is the leader of her lending group in Lugazi. She is 30 years old and married with four children ages 13, 9, 3 and 2 years. She also takes care of other siblings, all in primary school. 

Damali has had a business selling agricultural produce like tomatoes, onions, green bananas, sweet potatoes and so on at the Lugazi Central market for three years. She started slowly with very limited capital but now her business has grown and her major challenge is that at times the produce is so scarce hence affecting business. Due to her quality goods, she now has many customers.

She would like to become a supplier to others in the agricultural produce business, and she would also liketo build a residential house for her family. Her profit is 60,000UGX a week and she would need a loan to be able to add more capital to her business since the profits help her to pay school fees for her children. Damali is such a hard-working lady and with more capital, the sky is the limit for her success.

loans.use: Buying more agricultural products like tomatoes, onions, green bananas and more for her business.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie M. is from the village of Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 28 years old. Rosalie is married and has two infant children. To make a living, Rosalie owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafood products  including fish and shrimp in the local community. Rosalie has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rosalie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalie is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rosalie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 50 year old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, southern suburbs of Lebanon with his wife and his four children. Ahmad has been selling shoes for twenty four years. He requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to buy merchandise for work. Ahmad has been a microcredit client for eight years now and has always paid on time. 
Ahmad took out his loans to improve his quality of life by buying goods and get profits because when he started learning the business, he faced difficulties in having capitA. to own a shop. His clients are his friends and neighbors as well as people in region. In the future, Ahmad plans on improving and enlarging his work.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for work.

loans.name: Pia

texts.en:
Pia V. is from the village of Inobulan, Salay, Misamis Oriental. She is 63 years old. Pia is single. To make a living, Pia runs a "sari-sari" (variety) retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the community. Pia has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Pia joined HSPFI in order to gain access to financial services that could help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be Pia's 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchasing additional products to sell

loans.name: Procopio

texts.en:
Procopio E. is from the village of Pan-ay, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 79 years old, is married, and has five adult children.

Procopio owns and operates a business planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over twenty years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Procopio joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase land on which to raise additional crops. This loan will be his first from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve fund for future emergencies.


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase land on which to raise additional crops

loans.name: Alfred Mwakoi

texts.en:
Alfred Mwakoi M. is a single 23-year old man who was introduced to KADET by the coordinator in his group. He has been in the farming business for one year and also runs an agrivert (composting) shop in Chakama-Malindi.

His clients are mainly farmers in the same area of Chakama-Malindi. With this loan, he plans to buy farming supplies for his shop and boost his farming activities. He gets a monthly profit of 4,500 Kenyan shillings (KES) from his shop, and with the proceeds from this loan he hopes to establish a savings plan and be able to pay his loan back in full and on time.

Alfred describes himself as hardworking and very determined to improve his life. His ambition is to support fellow citizens through education and employment.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To hire labor and to buy seeds, petrol, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Rin

texts.en:
Mrs. Rin L., 53, is a widow with one son and five daughters. Three of them are married and live outside the family home. One daughter is a garment factory worker, and the other children assist their mother in the farming business. They are living along national road number one about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Rin has been a farmer for thirty years. She doesn’t have enough capital to maintain her farm, so she is asking for her first loan of $350 to pay for plowing fees and to purchase fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.use: To pay for plowing fees and to buy fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Ergashboy

texts.en:
Y. Ergashboy is 43 years old. He is married with two adorable children. Ergashboy has always opted to make his life on his land, work hard, and grow with it. That is how he decided to raise cattle and dedicate himself to agriculture. Ergashboy has been doing this kind of work for a very long time for he comes from a family with an entirely agricultural background. Today he wishes to increase the number of his animals and for this reason, he would like to buy cattle with the hope of increasing his income and the well-being of his home with the innumerable benefits that these special animals provide him. That’s why he is requesting a loan of 5,000 Somoni. Extend your solidarity to Ergashboy so that he can move forth successfully and accomplish all his goals.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more cattle

loans.name: Waji

texts.en: C. was born in 1958, and is happily married with six children, of whom none is below 15 years of age. Being a very hardworking woman with a large family, she has faced some challenges in life such as ill health, poor harvests and school dropouts because of inadequate finances when she is not able to pay her children’s school fees. In 2001, because of all these challenges, C. saw GHAPE as a source of relief. In that same year C. received her first loan and has received seven other loans since for which repayments were made promptly. With the loan of 200,000 FRS, she plans to buy firewood for 70,000 FRS, wood for timber for 80,000FRS, and pay for transportation of the wood and timber costing 50,000 FRS. C. will start repayment from the fourth month after the day of disbursement. The success of the business is guaranteed because she has experience in the business and has a ready market for the goods. Because of the progress of the business she plans to use the profit to pay school fees for her children, give good medical attention to her family, and also provide good food. C. prefers to receive her loans from GHAPE as opposed to other organizations because she is a member of GHAPE and also, GHAPE has taught her how to manage the loan and the method of repayment is comfortable. About GHAPE The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profit and loss, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy firewood and timber for her business

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok S., 29, lives in the Takeo province with her husband and one young child. She is a silk scarf weaver who is able to make about $2 each day, while her husband is a garment factory worker and makes $2 a day as well. To earn more money, Sok S. is asking for a loan of $900 to purchase silk and other materials for weaving more scarves.

loans.use: To purchase silk and other materials for weaving scarves.

loans.name: Anas

texts.en: Anas is a 20-year-old young man who lives in Gaza, Palestine.  Anas is a motivated university student who is working in his gift shop to be able to continue his studies. He needs a loan of $3,000 to increase the stock in his shop.  He started his business in 2008, and he is hoping he will have a secure income at least until he graduates from the university.

loans.use: To increase the stock in his shop

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en: Mary Grace just started planting rice crops at her 1.5 hectare field.  She said the farm still lacks inputs and the crops she already planted need to be nourished.  A married woman with three children, she gives her best to help her husband provide for the growing needs in their household.  One of her priorities is her children’s education.  A new member of CEVI, she is grateful to get into its loan program. She is asking for a loan of Php4,000.  Mary Grace will use this loan to buy farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan R. is currently in the business of selling used clothes at the market and is requesting a loan to stock sandals and more clothes to sell. Juan is 38 years old and is married with a husband that is a businessman. She has 3 children, and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs, as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock sandals and more clothes to sell

loans.name: Fatima Del Rosario

texts.es: Perfil del Cliente 	Este cliente es originario de la comarca los cocos, jurisdicción de telica , casada y trabaja en el mined telica desempeñándose como asesora pedagógica
texts.en:
This client is from the Los Cocos community, Telica jurisdiction. She's married and is employed as an Educational Advisor by Telica's Ministry of Education.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay off a department store debt.

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet is a widowed woman with two boys, who are aged 18 and five. Her younger son attends school and her older son is getting married and expecting a child. Linet sold charcoal for two years but had to stop because the prices rose too high.

To make a living, she worked at a company that exports clothes but she wants to use her ksh. 20,000 loan to buy charcoal and start her business again, selling from home to neighbors, hotels, kiosks and restaurants. Linet describes herself as hardworking and hopes to start another business selling cows (she already has one) and to build a house in the future. Recently, she broke her arm but she is excited that she will soon be a grandmother!

loans.use: To buy charcoal to sell

loans.name: Fathma

texts.fr: Madame Fathma S. âgée de 46 ans est veuve en charge de ses enfants. Elle gère son propre commerce depuis 15 ans en aménageant une petite boutique chez elle. Son activité consiste à vendre des denrées alimentaires, produits de lessive et tout produits qui entre dans la marche quotiedienne des femmes ménagères. Elle sollicite un prêt de 200 000 FCFA pour renforcer la boutique.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fathma S. is 46 years old and a widow who supports her children. She has been managing her own business for the past 15 years in a little shop she fitted out in her home. Her activity is the sale of foodstuffs, washing products and all other products which housewives are likely to buy. She is requesting a loan of 200,000FCFA to strengthen her shop.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To get fresh supplies of goods

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan Q. is a housewife and a mother of three sons. Her husband Raed is a Palestinian National Authority employee and the only one who supports the family, so Raed installed a small coop in the backyard of their house and started breeding chicken for sale.

Susan watched her husband's small project working well and she wanted to help him develop it. Susan came to FATEN and took a $1500 loan which her husband Raed will be using to expand his project by buying more chickens and using the whole space of their backyard to breed a larger number of chickens.

Raed appears in the picture above in FATEN's office as Susan is a conservative woman and doesn't like having her picture published online.

loans.use: To buy more chickens and improve a poultry coop

loans.name: Adeline Dorothee

texts.fr: Commercante agee de 44 ans,celibataire et mere de 3 ans dont l'age varie entre 14 et 3 ans.Elle s'est lancee dans cette activite depuis 1992,elle gere une chambre froide ou l'on trouve les differents produits dont ses clients ont besoin,ce commerce lui permet de prendre en charge sa famille et toute la scolarite des ses enfants.Avec le financement qu'elle va recevoir elle compte satisfaire les besoins de ses potentiels clients, s'approvisionner en produits  de  qualite comme la viande fraiche, les differentes varietes de poulets frais et fumes, saucissons et poissons qui sont tres demandes par ceux ci.Pour elargissement de son activite, elle fait preuve d'une bonne gestion et tres rigoureuse dans ses choix ,pour ses perspectives d'avenir , elle pense etre grossiste un jour, importer plus pour faire des grandes benefices .Tres entreprenante, avec un fort esprit d'initiative elle pense aller loin tout en ameliorant les conditions de vie de sa famille .
texts.en:
This lady, 44, is a businesswoman, single and the mother of three children whose ages vary from 14 to 3 years old. She got into this business in 1992 and runs a "cold store" where her customers find various products they need. This business allows her to support her family and pay school fees for her children. With the loan she expects to receive, she hopes to satisfy the needs of her clientele by stocking up on quality products such as fresh meat, various sorts of smoked and fresh chickens, sausages and fish which are much sought after by her customers. To expand her business, she demonstrates good management principles and is rigorous in her choices. As for her future, she intends to be a wholesaler and import more to make more profit. Very enterprising and with a strong spirit of initiative, she expects to go far while at the same time improving living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cartons of fresh meat, chicken, and fish

loans.name: Yasmeen Akhtar's Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen akhtar’s husband has a timber shop in Borewala, a city of shrines in Pakistan. She lives there with her family of four people, two children and herself with her husband. 

Both of her children are getting an education. Yasmeen akhtar wants them to finish their education for which she works very hard. She makes and sells artificial flowers to pay their school fees. 

Yasmeen’s husband wants to buy more timber for his shop because he has received big order to fill. She has applied for a loan from Asasah for that purpose. She hopes that fulfillment of this order will bring good profit to her husband.

loans.use: Purchase timbers for selling

loans.name: Gantumur

texts.en:
Gantumur J. is 36 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Arhangai province of central Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Both of Gantumur’s children attend a local middle school while his wife helps him out with his business. 

Gantumur operates a dairy product retail business in his town at the local market. He started his business in 2006 with the working capital of 100,000 MNT and since then, it has reached 600,000 MNT. Gantumur attributes his business success to his knowledge of local market demands. He is requesting a 650,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more dairy products to sell in his business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara is a talented musician with extensive experience in leading a choir. Due to life circumstances, she had to leave that pursuit in order to obtain a more stable income. Today, Tamara is an enthusiastic and lively entrepreneur selling women’s clothing and shoes at the open market in Berdyansk city.

With certainty and hard-work, she has been able to develop her business and see it prosper over the last 10 years. Tamara has 30,000 UAH invested in products; her monthly income comes to around 6,000 UAH.

Today, Tamara is excited about the opportunity to replenish her stock with seasonal summer items and has requested a loan of 10,000 UAH. She believes this investment will help her meet the needs of her customers and encourage them to return and shop with her again.

loans.use: To increase the stock selection.

loans.name: Patty Lorenza

texts.es:
Patty es una madre de familia de 32 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en el distrito de Nueva Arica, un distrito agrícola caracterizado por presentar una geografía accidentada, dada su cercanía a la sierra del país, en encuentra ubicado a hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de cinco años a la preparación y venta de alimentos, ella vende salchipollo (plato originario del país consistente en pollo frito con papas fritas y salchichas) por las tardes en una carreta especialmente acondicionada para realizar esta acción. Este negocio es una fuente muy importante de ingresos para su familia ya que con ellos ayuda a su esposo, que trabaja como albañil, con los gastos familiares.

Patty desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas insumos de modo que pueda preparar mas platos y así percibir mayores ingresos con su venta , para lograr su meta ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Patty tiene como meta seguir trabajando hasta poder tener un restaurante, en la zona donde vive las personas que la conocen la consideran una mujer tranquila, trabajadora y entregada a su familia.
texts.en:
Patty is a Mom and she is 32 years of age. She lives together with her husband and their two children in the district of Nueva Arica. This is an agricultural region with a mountainous geography, given their proximity to the country's mountain ranges. This village is located about 90 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For more than 5 years she has been selling prepared foods. She sells 'salchipollo'. It is a popular national dish of fried chicken, friend potatoes, and sausages. She sells the food in the afternoons along a very well traveled road, a road especially managed for this type of business. Her business is a very important source of income for their family. She is able to contribute to the household expenses with her husband who works as a construction worker. Patty wishes to expand her business and to purchase more ingredients and more plates, so that she will see an increase in her sales. To reach her goal she has approached Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles. Patty's goal is to keep working until she is able to set up a restaurant. In the region where she is known to be a decent, hard working woman who is dedicated to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy has a mixed farm in Murang'a town, Central Kenya, which produces coffee. She has been farming for the last 10 years and sells her coffee to the local market. She also earns income from her hotel business in the same area.

Mercy is 44 years old. She is married and has been blessed with 5 children who are now between the ages of 11 and 33. Two of the children attend school.

She has requested this loan of 26,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that this loan will increase her income from the sale of milk. Her biggest challenge has been lack of a good market for her products. In five years' time, she hopes that she will have improved her dairy cows to a pure breed producing over 26 litres daily.

She hopes to grow wealthy through Juhudi Kilimo.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Matilde Agripina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KAROLL WOKTILA”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Matilde, tiene 34 años de edad, ella es casada y tiene 3 hijos, ella administra una empresa de transportes en el terminal terrestres, desde hace 9 años, La socia junto a otros amigos decidieron tomar parte de este banco para poder incrementar sus negocios y tener otro ingreso extra . La socia requiere el dinero para invertirlo en la educación de sus hijos en el colegio y jardín.

La socia agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “KAROLL WOKTILA”. This bank is located in the district of Huanchac in the province and department of Cusco. Matilde is 34 years old, married and has three children. For the last 9 years she has managed a transport company in the bus terminal. Along with her friends, she decided to take part in this bank in order to grow her business and have some extra income. She needs the money to invest in the education of her children in elementary school and kindergarten. She is thankful for the loan through this medium and similarly commits herself to making her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Jacqueline Demeranville, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To educate her children

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn B. is a 41-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating both a general store and a livestock business. She lives in Purok 1, Barangay Mantuyop, Siaton, Negros Oriental. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard at her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of $210. 

Evelyn is now borrowing 15,000 PHP so that she can continue purchasing items like vitamins and other supplies to sell. This will be her 4th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 9,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Evelyn hopes to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more inventory to sell

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
la señora Juana F. G. tiene 55 años de edad, vive en el barrio El Jazmin de Agua Fria Nacaome Valle. tiene 21 años de vivir en dicho lugar, Juana se dedica a la venta de abarroteria como ser jabon, harina de maiz, manteca, aceite, pollos, carnes, refrescos y todo lo relacionado con la canasta basica familiar.
sus clientes son sus vecinos y familiares de la zona, Juana se dedica a este negocio desde hace 5 años,
recibe ademas ingresos de cuatro hijos que radican en los estados unidos. 
 
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para surtir mas su negocio. 
su mayor preocupacion es que sus hijos esten bien en los Estados Unidos.
texts.en:
Juana G. F. is 55-years-old and lives in the neighborhood of El Jazmin de Auga Fria Nacaome Valle. She has lived here for 21 years.  Jane sells groceries like: soap, cornmeal, butter, oil, chicken, meat, soft drinks, and everything related to a general family grocery bag for a living.  Her customers are her neighbors and her relatives.  Jane has been in this business for 5 years and also receives income from four children who live in the United States.
 
The loan will be used to purchase merchandise for her business.

His biggest concern is that her children are well in the United States.

loans.use: To buy cornmeal, rice, coffee, bread, cookies, soft drinks, beans, lard, oil, sardines, matches, candles,soap, salt, and spices.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan is a married man with two children, both of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are transport costs and food. Hassan has been running his fresh water sales business and boda boda (motorcycle) business for over four years. He faces the major challenge of seasonality. During the dry summer season, less water is available and the demand is high. Hassan hopes to be a big supplier of fresh water in the future. With this loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to purchase water pipes and water taps. He decided to join Yehu to get loans to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase water pipes and water taps

loans.name: David Samuel Techera

texts.en:
David Samuel Techera S. is a 42-year-old gentleman who services electronics for his customers for a fee.  He is married to Clemetina Asatali, and together they have four children ages 12, 8, 6, and 4. 

He runs his business in Lumakanda Eldoret, Kenya, and has been in this business for about six years.

David was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and has no history with any other MFI.  He is applying for a second loan of Kshs 40,000 from KADET LTD which he plans to use to purchase more spare parts like dozens of IC, transistors, wires, and nuts .

In the future, David wants to expand his business. His deeper desire is to see his children realize their goals in life through better education.

loans.use: To purchase parts for electronics repair business

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia E. is from the village of Kauswagan. She is 51 years old. Letecia is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Letecia owns & operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Letecia has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Letecia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Letecia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. Letecia is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Letecia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: 02.02.06-Hong Ky-Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Nien P. T. (38) is a 31-year-old female living in the town of 02.02.06-Hong Ky-Hoang Hoa. Nien is the group leader of an seven-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 02.02.06-Hong Ky-Hoang Hoa.

Nien is married with two school-aged children. To making a living, Nien operates a family member's business venture in the services sector, renting out  furniture to local community members. Nien has been engaged in this business for over twenty years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month.

In 2010, Nien joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services. She is requesting a loan of 3,079,800 VND which will be used to expand the business. The loan will be her first loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. 

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  N. T. Hang (39) is a 29-year-old female who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a tailoring business.

2.  D. T. Dai (40) is a 36-year-old female who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

3.  P. T. Ngoan (41) is a 38-year-old female who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

4.  P. T. Ly (42) is a 38-year-old female who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.

5.  P. T. Sau (43) is a 41-year-old female who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.

6.  T. T. Quy (44) is a 49-year-old female who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Nien P. T. (38) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố 02.02.06-Hong Ky-Hoang Hoa.  Nien là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 7 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 02.02.06-Hong Ky-Hoang Hoa (02.02.06-Hong Ky-Hoang Hoa).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ cho thuê trang T.ết bị cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Nien thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 20 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Nien kiếm được khoảng 2,000,000 VND.  Vào 2010, Nien đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  0    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 3,079,800 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  N. T. Hang (39) là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3,079,800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh may mặc.


2.  D. T. Dai (40) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3,079,800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  P. T. Ngoan (41) là 38 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3,079,800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  P. T. Ly (42) là 38 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3,079,800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


5.  P. T. Sau (43) là 41 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3,079,800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


6.  T. T. Quy (44) là 49 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3,079,800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  D. việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Willian Alexander

texts.es:
William, se dedica a la venta de minutas y de tortillas, tiene 33 años de edad y vive con su esposa quien se dedica a la preparación de tortillas para vender, residen en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, Don William tiene 4 años de dedicarse al negocio de minutas las vende en un carruaje móvil todos los días de la semana por las calles de El Transito, su esposa tiene el puesto de venta en El mercado municipal de esta misma ciudad.
Él solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en el negocio, comprando jaleas, miel, hielo y depósitos para la preparación y venta de las minutas, con esta ayuda realizara una buena inversión para mejorar la calidad de servicio a los clientes y satisfacer sus gustos.
La aspiración de William es fortalecer el negocio y aumentar las ventas para recibir mejores ingresos que le permitan cubrir sus necesidades.
texts.en:
William sells snacks and tortillas.  He is 33 years old, and he lives with his wife.  She makes tortillas to sell.  They live in El Transito in the San Miguel department.

William has had his snack business for four years.  He sells every day of the week from a mobile cart on the streets in El Transito.  His wife has a stall that she sells from in the municipal market in the same city.

He is requesting the loan to invest in his business by purchasing jelly, honey, ice, and food containers to prepare and sell the snacks.  With this help he will make a good investment in order to improve the quality of customer service.  He will also satisfy his customers’ tastes.

Williams’ aspiration is to strengthen the business and to increase sales.  He wants to do this to get better income, which will allow him to cover the necessities.

loans.use: To buy jelly, honey, ice, and food containers to prepare and sell  snacks

loans.name: Wilter

texts.en:
Wilter is 32 years old and married.  She has 6 children who all attend school.  Wilter has been practicing mixed farming for twelve years in Kisii, western Kenya.  Her farm produces tea, sugarcane, maize, and vegetables that she sells locally.  Her major challenges have been pests and diseases and low market prices for her products.

She requested a loan of 40,000 KES through Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow.  The extra income generated from this loan will help her pay the school fees for her children.  She plans to build a greenhouse in the next five years.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria S. is from the village of Kimanait, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 61 years old. Maria is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Maria runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods, beverages, detergents and toothpaste. Maria has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2007, Maria joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Maria is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like snack foods and canned goods. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Maria from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell, like snack foods and canned goods

loans.name: Nayzak

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 21 years old and lives with three family members. In 2007, Nayzak decided to open a barber shop, as he has good experience in this field. He is well known in his area and has a good reputation.

Nayzak is requesting a $1200 loan to redecorate his shop, put up a sign at the entrance, and buy a small generator. He aims to grow his business in the future and improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To redecorate his shop, put up a sign at the entrance and buy a small generator

loans.name: Sop Mame Diarra Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOP MAME DIARRA est créé le 30 décembre 2009. Il est composé de 15 femmes qui sont toutes du même village. Elle exercent comme activité principale le petit commerce. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de DIADIORDE

Madame Fatou S. (debout à droite sur la photo, emmitouflée d'une écharpe noire)est responsable du groupe. Elle est marié et mère de 05 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de 02 autres enfants qui lui sont confiés par des proches.

Elle fait un petit commerce de légumes. Elle s'approvisionne dans les villes environnants pour revendre dans son village. Elle pratique cette activité depuis plus de 5 ans

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de renforcer son activité en augmentant son niveau d'approvisionnement. 

Son objectif est de fructifier son argent afin de soutenir son mari et ses enfants dans leurs divers besoins.
texts.en:
The solidarity group SOP MAME DIARRA was created on December 30, 2009. It is made up of 15 women who all come from the same village. Their main revenue-generating activity is small business. The group is part of the Banc Villageois of DIADIORDE.

Mrs. Fatou S. (standing on the right in the photo, wearing a black scarf) is the group's leader. She is married and has five children. She is also responsible for two other children that have been placed into her care by relatives. 

She buys and sells legumes. She gets her stock from the surrounding towns and sells it in her village She has been doing this for more than five years. 

Her new loan will allow her to bolster her business by increasing her stock.

Her goal is to increase her profits so she can provide for her husband and children.

loans.use: Acheter des légumes à revendre

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
Don Wilfredo de 49 años de edad, reside en Jucuapa departamento de Usulután, vive con su madre de 68 años y una hermana 40 años de edad, él se dedica a un taller de sastrería, el oficio lo aprendió de su padre hace 20 años, no tiene un horario fijo para hacer sus trabajos ya que el taller lo tiene en su vivienda.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para comprar telas de diferentes colores y tipos, hilos de varios colores, ciper cortos y largos, botones y broches, esta compra le fortalecerá el taller, ya que tendrá todo lo que necesita para realizar los trabajos en relación a las prendas de vestir, espera con esta inversión realizar de una manera más eficiente y rápida los trabajos que demandan los clientes.
Don Wilfredo aspira en el corto plazo una sastrería con capacidades grandes para la elaboración de prendas de vestir, contar con un buen número de clientes y así mismo con mejores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is 49 years old and lives in Jucuapa, in Usulután department, with his 68 year-old mother and a 40 year-old sister.  Wilfredo has a tailor's workshop.  He learned the trade from his father 20 years ago.  He doesn't work regular hours since his workshop is located in his home.

Wilfredo is requesting a loan to buy different colors and types of fabrics, different colored threads, long and short zippers, buttons and fasteners.  This purchase will strengthen his workshop since it will mean he has everything he needs to carry out his work.  He hopes that this investment will enable him to carry out work for his customers more efficiently and quickly.

In the short term, Wilfredo hopes to own a tailor's shop where he can make a lot of clothes, have a large number of customers and, thereby, improve his family's income.

loans.use: To buy different colors and types of fabric, different colored threads, short and long zippers, buttons and fasteners.

loans.name: Debbie's Group

texts.en:
Debbie B. is from the village of Caliguian. She is 53 years old and the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Debbie B.'s Group.

Debbie is married and has 3 school-aged children. She owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Debbie has been engaged in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2006, Debbie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Debbie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase new items to expand product offering. Debbie is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 9th loan taken out by Debbie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Roy

texts.en:
Roy C. is from the village of Dalirig, Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. He is 40 years old. Roy is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Roy owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business is providing motorela or habal-habal transportation services to local community members.
