Roy has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 15000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Roy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase tools needed to provide his service. Roy is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will also be used to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the service. This loan will be the Roy's second from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the service

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en:
Jihad is a young man from Saffarein village close to Tulkarem city in the northern part of Palestine, Jihad is employed by a small agency in Saffarein that transports goods and items for commercial stores and shops inside Saffarein and between Tulkarem and Saffarein village.

Jihad took a loan from FATEN to repay relatives and friends as he had borrowed money from them while he was a student and now that he works and can take out a loan to repay only FATEN from his monthly salary.

Jihad appears in the picture here in FATEN's branch in Tulkarem.

loans.use: Pay back his relatives and friends who covered his college fees

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus M. M., aged 44, sells second-hand shoes at Pipeline Estate, which is densely populated. He is married to Jackline Mueni and together they have four children, Rhoda, aged 10 years; Kevin, aged eight years; Elijah and Elisha, both aged three months. He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by the credit officer in charge of the Eastlands office.

Justus’ business of nine years gives him a monthly income of KES 19,500. This loan of KES 50,000 is his fifth loan from KADET Ltd. and he plans to use the loan to buy ten bales of shoes for sale. If the loan boosts the business, Justus plans to invest back into the business.

Justus dreams of opening a shoe shop at Pipeline Estate. He describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: To buy ten bales of shoes for resale.

loans.name: Expresso Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “EXPRESSO” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Mercedes. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: compra de ladrillo, confección de sombreros, transporte público, venta de CD’s, trabajo de edredones, abarrotes, ropita de bebe.
 
La señora Mercedes,  indica que hace tres años que compone Pro Mujer  y que ingreso por preguntando a cerca de financieras. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de edredones, que viene trabajando hace dos años atrás aprendiendo el mismo de su tía..

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital de trabajo (compra de edredones), este material lo compra de la cuidad de Oruro y los vende a facilidad de.. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación
texts.en:
The “EXPRESSO” community bank will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer, as a part of the Villa Exaltación center. It is made up of eight members and is led by a board of directors headed by Mercedes. The community bank's members' businesses are varied. Among them we have: purchasing bricks, making hats. public transport, selling CD’s, and selling comforters, groceries, and baby clothes. 
 
Mercedes indicates that she has been in Pro Mujer for three years, and she entered by asking about financial institutions. At this time, she has a business selling comforters. She has been doing this for two years, learning from her aunt.   The loan that she will take out now is to increase her working capital by buying comforters. She buys them in the city of Oruro and sells them with easy payment plans. This work allows her to generate income to support her family. She is married and has four children.   

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, her answer is the trainings.

loans.use: to increase capital by buying comforters.

loans.name: Sixta Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda tiene 47  años de edad, ella es soltera, cuenta con casa propia.  Tiene 2 hijos  menores de edad, su domicilio está ubicado en un caserío llamado La Piedra, a  10 minutos de la ciudad de Mochumí. 

Yolanda se dedica a la elaboración y venta de chicha ( un producto oriundo del Perú  hecho a base de maíz , maní, etc.), ella se encarga de de prepararla y distribuirla en un caserío cercano llamado Punto cuatro y en otra zonas aledañas, para la elaboración de dicho producto ella emplea jora, azúcar y agua para elaborar su chicha. Adicionalmente ella cría y comercializa animales. Contando con mucho tiempo de experiencia ella ha obtenido clientela fidelizada a su producto.

Yolanda está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para que pueda comprar materia, prima (insumos) para la elaboración de su producto.

Yolanda es una persona bastante empeñosa y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para poder mejorar su  calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Yolanda tiene 47  años de edad, ella es soltera, cuenta con casa propia.  Tiene 2 hijos  menores de edad, su domicilio está ubicado en un caserío llamado La Piedra, a  10 minutos de la ciudad de Mochumí. 

Yolanda se dedica a la elaboración y venta de chicha ( un producto oriundo del Perú  hecho a base de maíz , maní, etc.), ella se encarga de de prepararla y distribuirla en un caserío cercano llamado Punto cuatro y en otra zonas aledañas, para la elaboración de dicho producto ella emplea jora, azúcar y agua para elaborar su chicha. Adicionalmente ella cría y comercializa animales. Contando con mucho tiempo de experiencia ella ha obtenido clientela fidelizada a su producto.

Yolanda está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para que pueda comprar materia, prima (insumos) para la elaboración de su producto.

Yolanda es una persona bastante empeñosa y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para poder mejorar su  calidad de vida.

loans.use: Compra de insumos para la preparacion de su productos.

loans.name: Erana

texts.en: Erana is 39 years old. She's currently in a business of selling tea. She is married to a businessman and they have no children. Her future goal is to extend her business.

loans.use: to stock more tea.

loans.name: Peweh Group

texts.en: Adama is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She was born in northern Sierra Leone 30 years ago. Adama is married and the couple has four children. She has been selling palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), rice, and fried cakes, for the past five years. She and her group members have applied for a loan of SLL 3,200,000 from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to further expand their respective businesses. Adama is going to buy palm-oil, rice, baking flour, etc. in a large quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy palm-oil, rice, baking flour, etc. in a large quantity to sell

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 39 years old and lives in the town of Ggaba in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is widowed and has seven children. One of her children is currently in school. 

For the past year, Hellen has had a business of a small retail shop that sells essential commodities like sugar. She also has rental houses.  

To help expand her business, Hellen has requested a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Hellen hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her child.  

In the future, Hellen hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, has five children and makes a living by selling vegetables. She has been in business for a year and is applying for a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more vegetables for sell to her customers. She is a new member of HSPFI, and hopes to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
Manuel, vive su esposa y tres hijos, es administrador de una venta de medicina natural, este negocio surgió por iniciativa de él y su esposa, quien lo apoya ahora con una venta de tortillas y de riguas, no tiene horario fijo para atender a sus clientes.
El necesita un préstamo para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de las tortillas y las riguas como lo es el maiz y la leña, esta compra le permitirá ampliar su negocio y ofrecerles más productos a sus clientes.
Su más anhelado sueño es tener su propio local de medicina natural y venta de especies y a través de las ganancias darles el estudio adecuado a sus hijos, también apoyar a su esposa con el negocio para que ella tambien pueda desarrollarse.
texts.en:
Manuel lives with his wife and three children. He runs a natural medicine shop that he began with his wife, who now helps him by selling tortillas and sweet corn pies. He does not have a fixed schedule for waiting on his customers.

He needs a loan to buy ingredients for making tortillas and sweet corn pies, such as corn and fire wood. Purchasing these items will let him expand his business and offer more products to his customers.

His greatest dream is to have his own natural medicine and spice shop and use his earnings to provide a good education for his children, and also to support his wife in her business so that she can grow.

loans.use: buy corn and firewood

loans.name: Enhtsetseg

texts.en:
Enhtsetseg is 49 years old and lives with her son in her apartment in the city of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her son attends a high school. She started to sell suits at the Dejiin Myanga market back in 1996. In 2002 she moved her business to the Narantuul market. Her business income is the sole income source for her family. She also has collected much business experience. Her total capital turnover is 4,000,000 MNT and her daily income is between 100,000 MNT to 200,000 MNT. 

Enhtsetseg is planning to expand her business activity. She is a diligent and hard-working woman who is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to buy more suits and to increase her capital turnover.

loans.use: To buy more suits.

loans.name: Alisen

texts.en: Alisen is a 31-year-old married man with three children living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His family goal is to build a commercial house and educate his children up to university level. He owns a store selling charcoal and has been in business for two years now. His major challenge has been lack of capital to buy enough sacks of charcoal for resale. Alisen needs the loan to pay school fees for his dependants.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his dependants.

loans.name: Fenesi Group

texts.en:
Sophia, who is in her early 30s, is married with two children who go to school. She has had a retail shop for three years now.  She works from 6 a.m to 10 p.m daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her 2nd motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. A motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania, given in the middle of the main loan term, that motivates borrowers with good credit ratings who pay back their loans smoothly, to receive half of the amount of the existing loan before their original loan term has ended. She used the previous loan to increase inventory levels for items she was running low on at the shop and has paid back her loan successfully. She wants a loan to increase her retail shop inventory.  Her dream is to be able to own a beauty salon one day.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Fenesi" which has a total of 9 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase her retail shop inventory.

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es: Juan Bautista tiene 56 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de taller de talabartería. Hace más de 42 años que se dedica a este medio de vida, el empeño que diariamente Juan realiza en su negocio es admirable pues el realizar este tipo de negocio no es fácil. Inicio con un pequeño negocio que lo aprendió de su padre, ya que anteriormente su papa era el dueño del taller. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de mecates, cuero, baquetas, espuelas, entre otros productos que son necesaR. para la elaboración de sus productos.
texts.en: Juan Bautista is 56 years old. He runs a harness-maker's workshop. He has been doing this for more than 42 years. The effort that Juan exhibits in his business on a daily basis is admirable as to carry out this kind of work is no easy thing. With what he learned from his father, he started out with a small business, in a workshop that had previously belonged to his father. The reason for the loan is to buy ropes, leather, calfskin, spurs and other items needed for the manufacture of his products.

loans.use: to buy ropes, leather, calfskin, spurs, and other products.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert used the previous loan to cultivate land. He planted maize and beans, resulting in a high yield. He decided to start up a food store dealing in the sale of cereals. The business has been profitable despite challenges in price fluctuations and an unsustainable supply from other farmers. He intends to use the loan to cultivate land in preparation for the next season.

loans.use: to cultivate land.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel Ángel, de veintitrés años de edad, reside en uno de los municipios mas populosos del país y por ende con mejores oportunidades para el comercio, junto a él viven dos hermanos: Claudia y Cristian, que dependen económicamente de él y ayudan en el negocio. Miguel posee en zona central un taller de reparación de Escapes y Radiadores de vehículos desde hace mas de 3 años. Es muy bien referenciado por sus clientes como honrado, trabajador y responsable, los trabajos que hace los garantiza y por ello sus clientes lo recomienda con otros y así su cartera de clientes a incrementado; Miguel desea cubrir la demanda que hacen y para ello necesita mayor cantidad de materia prima como estaño, pegamentos, pasta, aluminio, tinner y nuevo equipo de soldadura  ya que el que actualmente posee ya no funciona bien, espera contar con la ayuda de INTEGRAL para que su negocio siga adelante y poder seguir colaborando al sostenimiento y estudios de sus hermanos
texts.en:
Miguel Ángel, 23, lives in one of the most populated towns in the country and, as a result, he has better business opportunities.  His two siblings who live with him, Claudia and Cristian, depend on him economically and help in the business.

For more than three years Miguel has had an exhaust and radiator repair shop in a central location.  He is well recommended by his customers for being honest, hardworking, and responsible.  He guarantees all his jobs and for this his customers recommend him to others, and so his list of customers has grown.

Miguel wants to cover the requests they make and for this he needs more materials such as solder, adhesive, polish, aluminum, thinner, and new soldering equipment since what he has now doesn't work well anymore.

He hopes to count on the help of INTEGRAL so his business can get ahead and to be able to continue helping support his siblings and their studies.

loans.use: to buy materials such as solder, adhesive, polish, aluminum, thinner, and new soldering equipment since what he has now doesn't work well anymore.

loans.name: Kangni

texts.fr:
Kangni est un homme âgé de 33 ans. Il est célibataire et n’a pas d’enfants.
Kangni travaille comme tourneur depuis 2000. Il a une entreprise afin de répondre à la demande de sa clientèle
Kangni a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter et d’installer du moulin à courant.
texts.en:
Kangni is a thirty-three year old man. He is single and has no children.
Kangni has worked as a lathe operator since 2000. He has a business in order to respond to the demands of his clients.
Kangni requested his first loan from WAGES in order to buy and install an electric mill.

loans.use: to buy an electric mill.

loans.name: Mujeres Divinas Y Encantadoras Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son de la cuidad de Caacupé. Las señoras están en el ciclo numero uno y tiene 15 integrantes. Todas ellas desean salir adelante por medio del trabajo en conjunto, ya que saben que la unión hace la fuerza. Tienen el deseo de darle a sus familias lo mejor para que no pasen privaciones. 
Una de ellas es la señora Juana, ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo como ser: remeras, pantalones, blusas. Gracias a su trabajo y a su esfuerzo ella ha podido salir adelante y ayudar a su familia. Le gustaría poder seguir con su negocio y es por ello que solicita el crédito, para la compra de todo tipo de prendas, como ser camisas, pantalones, remeras y demás. 
Ella al igual que sus amigas del comité está muy alegre dentro del programa de la fundación y desean llegar al máximo nivel.
texts.en:
The women of this communal bank are from the city of Caacupé. The women are taking their first loan and they have 15 members. All of them wish to get ahead through their work in the group, because they know unity is strength. They want to provide more for their families so that they don't experience hardship.

One of them is Juana. She works selling clothes of all types such as: t-shirts, pants and blouses. Thanks to her work and her efforts she has been able to get ahead and help her family. She would like to continue with her business, and for this reason she is seeking the loan to buy all types of clothes like shirts, pants, t-shirts and more. 

She, like her friends in the communal bank, is very happy within the foundation's program and wishes to reach the highest level.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Mergin

texts.en: Mergin works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling vegetables and fruits in the Philippines. Mergin requested a loan of PHP 28,000 from Kiva's partner, NWTF, to buy more spices, vegetables and fruits to sell from her stall. Mergin has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more spices, vegetables and fruits to sell from her stall

loans.name: Siyaya

texts.es:
Siyaya sigue participando en el banco comunal “Choquequirao” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco y sigue dedicándose a la venta de productos de belleza en diferentes instituciones y sigue estudiando la carrera de contabilidad en una de la universidad particulares de la ciudad del Cusco. 

Siyaya con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien y pudo obtener buenos beneficios y por ese motivo desea otro préstamo pues le ayuda mucho en los estudios.

Siyaya requiere el préstamo para invertir en sus mensualidades de la universidad. 

Siyaya se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Siyaya continues to participate in the Communal Bank “Choquequirao”, which is part of Asociación Araiwa in the city of Cusco. She continues to sell beauty products to different institutions and is still studying for a degree in Accounting at one of the private universities in the city of Cusco.

Siyaya did very well with her previous loan and was able to obtain good benefits. For this reason she wants another loan, which will be a great help with her studies. Siyaya is requesting this loan so that she can invest in her monthly tuition at the university.

She is grateful for the opportunity being given to her and promises to complete her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to pay for her monthly tuition at the university.

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es: Agustin de 46 años es un hombre que vive con su cónyuge y tiene 5 hijos en las edades de 2 a 26 años; él tiene un negocio a través del cual vende  y teje mecedoras  y jarrones  en mimbre, como sus líneas principales de productos. Su desempeño en este arte, es producto de una tradición familiar que trae desde  el departamento de Tolima, lugar ubicado en la región Andina, en el centro-occidente de Colombia,  y que  perfeccionó en la ciudad de Barranquilla donde trabajó como empleado de un amplio taller, que en el pasado cerró sus puertas y desde este momento, potencializó la apertura del suyo propio;  Agustín  distribuye sus productos  por toda la ciudad de Barranquilla en pequeños negocios y a la comunidad en general. Su meta de crecimiento depende de tener el capital de trabajo suficiente,  para invertir en materiales en mayor volumen y ganar buenos descuentos , y esto es justamente su razón para acceder a un  credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materia prima e insumos para tejer y fabricar muebles y jarrones, aprovechando que se acerca la temporada de gran despliegue comercial, época en la cual sus clientes se provisionan y compran sus productos,  porque en el ambiente familiar reciben  primas y bonificaciones, y estos  la aprovecharán,  para darle curso libre a sus deseos e intereses familiares.  Su sueño es organizar su taller y generar empleos, además de tener  un almacén o punto de venta, donde exhiba el producto de su creatividad convertido en confort para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Agustín, 46, is a man living with his spouse; he has five children whose ages range from 2 to 26.  He has a business where he sells and weaves rocking chairs and wicker urns which are his main product lines.  His work in this type of craft is a family tradition that he brings from the Department of Tolima a place located in the Andean part of Colombia and that he perfected in the city of Barranquilla where he was an employee in a large workshop which shut down operations some time ago and since then he opened up his own.

Agustín sells his wares throughout the city of Barranquilla to small businesses and to the community in general.  His growth goal depends on having sufficient working capital to invest in materials in larger amounts in order to qualify for discounts and this is precisely why he’s accessing a Kiva loan, the first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, that he’ll use to buy raw materials and supplies to weave his furniture and urns taking advantage of the fact that the season when his customers stock up on merchandise and buy his products because families receive their bonuses and allowances that they use to let their family wishes and interests fly free.  

His dream is to organize his workshop and generate jobs as well as to have a warehouse or sales point to display the products of his creativity that are converted into comfort for his customers.

loans.use: to buy raw materials.

loans.name: Reslie

texts.en:
Reslie is married and has 1 kid. Reslie lives and works in Sto. Thomas. He, like many of his fellow villagers, grows early crops such as corn and rice. He has been farming rice and corn for ten years. At this point he has P 10,000 invested in his business.

Reslie plans to invest the P 10,000 loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for the next agricultural season. Reslie hopes to meet the demand of buyers, effectively sell his products, and generate additional revenue from the sale of rice. He plans to further develop his business as it not only allows him to support his family, but also gives him enormous gratification.

loans.use: to purchase seed and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Srorng

texts.en: Srorng, 26 years-old, is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She raises ducks at home. Her husband is a TUK TUK (three-wheel vehicle) driver who carries garment workers to the factory. Srorng is requesting a loan of USD 600 in order to purchase a new TUK TUK for her husband to run asa  taxi to generate income to support the family. By doing so, her husband would have a TUK TUK to attract more customers. In the future, she would like to expand her business of duck raising by purchasing more ducks to raise and also to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase a new TUK TUK for her husband to run as a taxi.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a 55 year old woman, she is married to loving husband for a long time, long enough to see two of their children grow onto grown up adults who have got families of their own. Cecilia and her husband have 4 children, 2 of them still economically relay on them and are currently attending to the local university, the other two have been mentioned previously.
Cecilia makes a living by selling nutritional breakfasts and milkshakes, she owns a stand, this stand is the main support for her family, her husband provides different services for a construction site.
Cecilia is looking for a 21,053.00 MXN loan which will allow her to buy fix assets such as tables and chairs, she will also be looking for raw material to resell as food later.
Cecilia enjoys spending time with her family and working her business, she works every day of the week around 7 hours per day.

loans.use: to stock up her business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
I sell small food stuffs like beans, rice, and flour outside my house in Manyatta, Kisumu.
I am married with 2 children. I wish to get a loan to pay for an annual license and purchase more cereals.

loans.use: I will purchase an annual license and broaden my stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Rice Farming

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Mrs. Rita K., 50 years old, is a tailor in the town of  Kalanki in Kathmandu.  She opened her tailoring shop 25 years ago. Her specialty is making custom-fitted ladies dresses like Kurta Sulwar, Blouse, Ladies long dress, Makhshi, and others. 
Before starting her own business, Mrs K. took a 6 month training course in tailoring near her town. Several years ago, her husband, Uttam K., died and now she has sole responsibility for her 5 children.
She plans to use the loan to buy raw materials for her tailoring work. Her economic condition is very low to fulfill the basic need for her family. So she need loan to expand her business to earn more profit to fulfill her family basic need.
She has two sons and three daughters. All  four children have completed SLC level and the youngest son is in grade 7.

loans.use: To buy raw material for tailoring shop

loans.name: Bun

texts.en: Mrs. Bun N. is 42 years old and a widow. She works at a garment factory where she earns about $3 a day. She has 7 children, 2 of which are construction workers and 3 who are students. The other 2 sell eggs to people in the province. She would like to take out a loan to purchase a motorcycle so that her children can travel further and therefore sell more eggs.

loans.use: To purchase a motor cycle for her children to sell eggs to people in the province

loans.name: Nga

texts.en: The parents have 7 children. All their children are still going to school. They also had some land and sold it to provide food and education for their children by buying a motorbike for the father's work and using the remainder for the mother's business. They earn about 75 USD per month. They want to borrow $75 to add to the mother’s capital. She will use the profits to support the cost of schooling for the children. She will pay the loan back in 5 months.

loans.use: Groceries

loans.name: Felix Gaspar

texts.pt:
Feliz Gaspar T. is married and father of 5. He is 48 years old and studied until the 4th grade. He started working in 1974 in the district of Moamba in a company called Kodamo. In 1975 he started working as a mechanic.

He was introduced to hluvuku-Adsema micro-credit program through co-workers. He requested a loan of 15.000mt. In the future he wants to request another loan to buy a mini-bus.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localizacao: Boane Valor de empréstimo: 15.000,00mzm ( 600usd) Aplicação: Compra de material de construção Início: 12/09/2007 Fim: 05/12/2008 Feliz Gaspar T., casado maritalmente, tem 5 filhos e 48 anos de idade. Estudou ate 4ª classe do antigo sistema tendo depois começado a trabalhar em 1974 no Distrito da Moamba numa empresa de nome kodamo. Em 1975, começou a trabalhar na lomaco como mecânico ate então, com a categoria de chefe das oficinas. Conheceu a hluvuku-Adsema através de uma conversa com os colegas. Depois teve a curiosidade de ca chegar para melhor informar se sobre os serviços da instituição. Teve o seu primeiro contacto com o credito na hluvuku , onde auferiu o valor de15.000,00MT.Pensa em pedir outro empréstimo mais tarde para recondiccionar a sua viatura de tipo mini-bus.

loans.use: To buy material to build his house

loans.name: Akou Alougba

texts.fr:
Born in 1977, Mrs. Akou Alougba A. is married and has 4 people under her care. The creation of cakes and doughnuts is her main daily activity. A woman adored by children for her fine quality goods, she has succeeded in seducing everyone through her delicious tasting sweets. Today, because of high demand, she is asking for a loan of $300 in order to purchase sugar, oil and wheat flour, all of the necessary ingredients for her confections. Her earnings will help her to support the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Née en 1977, Madame A. Akou Alougba est mariée et compte à sa charge quatre (4) personnes. La production de gâteaux et de beignets est son activité quotidienne. Femme adorée des enfants pour la qualité de son met, elle a réussi à séduire tout le monde pour le bon goût de son produit. Aujourd’hui, face à l’importance de la demande, elle sollicite $300 pour acheter du sucre, de l’huile, de la farine de blé, tous les intrants pour sa production. Le revenu peut le servir à mieux contribuer aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of wheat flour.

loans.name: Hawa's Tujikomboke Group

texts.en:
Hawa, age 41, is married and has five children (23, 21, 17, 14, and 11 years old). Together with her husband, she also takes care of her 80-year-old father. Hawa is a food vendor and works from 7am to 3 pm daily, making and selling food dishes and snacks. She started this business in 2006 and now makes a monthly profit of about US$90.

Hawa is asking for a loan in order to be able to increase her sales. She will share the loan with three other businesswomen who earn income selling food, timber, and poultry.

loans.use: Purchase of food items for sale

loans.name: Heang

texts.en: Mrs. Heang S., 40, is a mother of three and works as a housewife cooking food for her family. Her husband is a soldier earning less than 1 USD each day. Two of her children work at a construction site and generally earn $2 each day and one of her children is married and lives outside the family home. Mrs. Heang S. hopes to use this loan to repair the roof on her house in order to prevent leaking during the rainy season which will help her save money and better her and her family’s lives.

loans.use: to repair her house roof in order to prevent from leaking during a rainy season.

loans.name: Rodolfo De Jesus

texts.es:
Don Rodolfo is 47 years old. He lives with his family in the settlement Memorial Sandino, which is a poor neighborhood, which lacks basic services such as water, sewerage, and paved streets. The population lacks financial resources. This man works as a security guard, and with his job he takes care of the household expenses of his family. His wife helps out, washing and ironing other people's clothes, and it is so that these parents support their three children who are still studying. The greatest wish of this father is to accommodate their humble home, which currently lacks an adequate infrastructure. Mr. Rodolfo requests a loan to improve the kitchen in her home, which is constructed with sheets of zinc and plycem boards. With the future income, fruit of the hard work of both parents, they hope to offer their children a prettier and more dignified home.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer

Don Rodolfo tiene 47 años de edad, habita con su familia en el asentamiento Memorial Sandino, el cual es un barrio pobre, en donde existe escasez de servicios básicos como agua, no cuentan con servicios fluviales, no hay calles pavimentadas, la población es de escasos recursos económicos. El señor trabaja como guarda de seguridad, es con su trabajo que se encarga de los gastos de su familia, su esposa lo ayuda, la cual lava y plancha ropa ajena, es así como estos padres mantienen a sus 3 hijos, los cuales se encuentran estudiando. El mayor deseo de este padre es de ir acondicionando su humilde vivienda, la cual no presenta una adecuada infraestructura. El señor solicita un préstamo para mejorar la cocina de su hogar, el cual esta construida con laminas de zinc y plycem. Con el ingreso fruto del duro trabajo de ambos sueñan brindarle a sus hijos un hogar mas digno y bonito.

loans.use: Buying bricks, cement, and iron (Comprar bloques, cemento y hierro)

loans.name: Arshad's Group

texts.en: Arshad B. is the wife of Jalal Din.  She resides with her family in Lahore, a big city in Pakistan.  She has two daughters and two sons. Both of her sons could not attend school due to various financial problems.  However,  she has now managed to send her daughters to school. Her husband works at a convenience store and both her sons work at a business that sells construction supplies. Arshad is joined in her group by Sabra J. (who wants to buy CDs for her video centre), Shabana I. (who will invest in her business), Azra M. (who needs to buy a new horse for her horse cart) and Sadia B. (whose husband deals in spare parts).

loans.use: to expand a construction supplies business

loans.name: Adigozal

texts.en:
Adigozal S., 41, is a farmer who has been running his business since 1985 and is very experienced in this field. He is married and has 3 sons, They live in Bilasuvar Internally Displaced People Settlement. Selling milk is their main source of income, but Adigozal also works driving tractors during the harvest season, late summer and autumn.

As dairy sales are their main financial resource, he would like to expand this activity and purchase two more milch cows to raise at an estimated cost of US$ 500 each.

loans.use: to purchase two more milch cows

loans.name: Maxa's Group

texts.en:
Maxa baji is the wife of H. M.. (Baji is an Urdu term meaning "eldest sister".) They have lived in the small city of Burewala in Pakistan for the last seven years. The family lives in a two-room brick house. There are four children; one daughter and three sons.

Her husband runs a grocery store. Maxa is requesting a loan for her husband so that he is able to diversify the products he offers in his store and increase the profits.

She has four other women in her loan group.Fozia baji wants a loan for embroidery business; Rubina baji would like a loan for her crockery store; Nasreen baji wants to buy an auto-rickshaw and Sughran baji is requesting a loan for her vegetable business.

The loan will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To diversify the products offered in a grocery store and increase profits

loans.name: Yrma Edit

texts.es:
Yrma is a member of the "Solidarity" Communal Bank. She lives at Jr. Maya de Brito Nº 651 in the Calleria District of the Ucayali area. She is a 47-year-old mother with 4 children, 3 of whom are older in age and 1 younger in age. She is married, and her husband works as a carrier. With her first loan from Kiva field partner Manuela Ramos, Yrma invested in a small store.

Yrma rises at 6:00am in order to buy perishable products to be sold that day. She waits on customers at the same time she does chores around the house. Yrma's store is open until 9:00pm each night.

With a loan of S/. 1,800 to be re-paid in 5 months, Yrma will buy 3 sacks of rice, 3 sacks of sugar, 2 oil buckets, 3 packages of hygienic paper, 1 box of milk, 21 packages of detergent, 2 boxes of eggs, 1 soda water box, and treats; in this way, she will be able to increase sales in her store.

Yrma is very happy. She started her business little by little. Her greatest wish is that her 15-year-old daughter will be able to become a working professional. Thanks to Manuela Ramos, her business has grown. She has more clients and economic stability than she had dreamed of for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Yrma pertenece al Banco Comunal “Solidaridad”, su domicilio esta ubicado en el Jr. Maya de Brito Nº 651 del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 47 años y es madre de 4 hijos 3 mayores y 1 menor de edad, es casada, su esposo trabaja como Transportista. Con el primer préstamo de Manuela Ramos decide invertir en una pequeña bodega.

En la actualidad Yrma tiene que se levantarse a las 6.00 am. para salir a comprar sus productos comestibles para su venta del día y pueda atender a sus clientes al mismo tiempo que se dedica a los quehaceres de su casa. Yrma cierra su negocio a las 9:00pm.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,800 soles, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 3 sacos de arroz, 3 sacos de azúcar, 2 baldes de aceite, 3 paquetes de papel higiénico, 1 caja de leche, 21 paquete de detergente, 2 jabas de huevo, 1 caja de gaseosa y golosinas, así podrá aumentar sus ventas en su bodega.

Yrma está muy contenta, empezó poco a poco y su mas grande deseo es que su hija de 15 años pueda ser una gran profesional, gracias a Manuela Ramos su negocio ha crecido, tiene mas clientes y estabilidad económica que tanto anhelaba para su familia.

loans.use:
Wholesale purchase of groceries
Compra al por mayor de diversos productos (abarrotes)

loans.name: Debora S.

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 35-year-old Debora Leonard. She is married and has three children ages two, seven, and thirteen. In 2005, Debora established her small grocery shack (or genge) business. Working six days a week, and nine to twelve hours a day, she earns about 30 USD every month from this business. Debora requires a loan in order to purchase more sugar, salt, cooking oil and home appliances in bulk. In the future, Debora plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

The Swahili word for this type of outside shop, or stall, is "genge." A genge is usually a very basic structure made of wood, with a tin roof, which sells general items such as onions, tomatoes, chiles, oil, rice, and dried fish. It is the kind of place local people usually send their children running to fetch something when they are in the middle of cooking the evening meal and discover they are short an ingredient or two.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The organization is devoted to the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microfinance as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets; because of this, they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services. When a client needs working capital to buy a specific item, SELFINA buys the equipment for said client and extends a loan to her. The same equipment is then leased back to the client so they can use it while in process of paying back their loan, a process called a sale-and-leaseback arrangement. Once the loan has been repaid, SELFINA transfers the ownership of the equipment to the client. The advantage of microleasing over traditional microfinance loans is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more sugar, salt, cooking oil and home appliances in bulk

loans.name: Ni Wayan Subeg

texts.id: Tinggal di pedesaan tentunya hanya bertani saja yang bisa ditekuni Wayan Subeg bersama suaminya. Hasil dari mengolah ladang yang tidak menentu dan tidak mencukupi kebutuhan keluarga membuat Wayan meningkatkan usaha ternak babinya sebagai pekerjaan sampingan. Wayan memutuskan untuk bekerja sama dengan DINARI dan masuk anggota kelompok ternak babi Kembang Mekar yang merupakan program dari DINARI sendiri. Pinjaman pertama yang diperoleh Wayan digunakan untuk membeli 1 ekor induk babi serta pakannya. Pemeliharaan yang dilakukan sangat sederhana dengan kandang yang seadanya saja. Setelah 5 bulan dipelihara, induk babi tersebut menghasilkan 8 ekor anak babi yang kemudian dijual menghasilkan keuntungan bersih sebesar Rp. 1000.000,-. Dari hasil ini Wayan melanjutkan ke pinjaman kedua dengan besar Rp. 1.500.000,- dalam jangka waktu 6 bulan pengembalian yang kemudian dibelikannya 1 ekor induk babi lagi serta pakan yang lebih bermutu dari sebelumnya. Oleh sebab itu Wayan berharap keuntungan yang diperoleh pun akan meningkat. Program DINARI ini menurut Wayan sangat baik untuk peningkatan penghasilan keluarganya yang dulunya pas-pasan sekarang menjadi lebih mapan. Karena Wayan masih harus menyekolahkan anaknya di bangku SD serta memenuhi kebutuhan anak keduanya yang masih bayi.
texts.en:
Ni Wayan Subeg and her husband are farmers living in the village. However, the uncertain income is often not enough to fulfill all her family's needs. This motivated her to farm pigs to supplement her income. Wayan decided to seek financial and technicla assistance from DINARI through Kembang Mekar farming group. She used the first loan to purchase 1 breeder pig and required feeds. She used simple farming techniques. After 5 months, the pigs produced 8 piglets that brought her $100 profit. This encouraging result made Wayan apply for second loan for $175 with 6 months tenor. She plans to use the fund to purchase an additional breeder pig and higher quality feeds. She hopes that her earnings will increase. She thinks that this DINARI progrma is very useful in increasing her family's income and improve her family's quality of life. Wayan still need to pay her kid's tuition money and fulfill the needs of her second infant child.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Pigs and Feeds

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en: Aurelia T. Gómez is 36 years old and lives in Ayacucho with her husband and 5 year old son. Aurelia is a member of community bank, Musuq Rumi. She travels two times a month, by 10-hour bus ride, to Lima to gather goods for her grocery business. Her loan of 1000 soles will be invested into her business to purchase sodas, crackers, chocolates and corn. The savings she is currently accumulating will be used for the purchase of her own home, to send her son to school and in case of a medical or health emergency in the family. Aurelia dreams of having a larger store and of having her son be successful.

loans.use: To purchase sodas, crackers, chocolates and corn for her grocery business

loans.name: Juana Danila

texts.es:
La señora Juana Danila tiene 50 años de edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Emprendedoras y vive en la calle Desamparados 204 del balneario Buenos Aires Norte del distrito Víctor Larco de la provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió secundaria completa y a pesar de la falta de apoyo paterno continuo su preparación como modista.
Tiene su pareja, el señor Víctor Isarsaburo Camacho, con quien tienen 3 hijos, que todavía son estudiantes.
Juana se dedica a la costura ya que es su profesión, pero como es una mujer emprendedora, los domingos hace tamales. Su negocio lo realiza en su casa.
Con el primer préstamo que fue de 300 soles devueltos en 4 meses  compró, material para confeccionar mandiles.
Con este crédito de 300 soles que será cancelado  en 4 cuotas, ampliará su negocio de tamales, completará para comprar un molino eléctrico.
Juana sueña  con tener una boutique de alquiler y venta.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana Danila is 50 years old and is a member of the Entrepreneurial Women Village Bank. She lives on Desamparados 204 Street of the Buenos Aires Norte resort in the Victor Larco district in the Trujillo province in the La Libertad department of Peru. She completed her secondary studies, and despite the lack of parental support, she continued her training to be a dressmaker. She has a partner, Mr. Víctor Isarsaburo Camacho, with whom she has three children, who are still students. Juana’s main profession is sewing, but like the entrepreneurial woman she is, she also makes tamales on Sunday. She conducts her business in her home. With the first loan of 300 soles, which she repaid in four installments, she bought material for making aprons. With this loan of 300 soles, which she will repay in four installments, she plans to expand her tamales business and purchase an electric mill. Juana dreams of having a boutique for rent and sale.

Translated from Spanish by Larissa Kravanja, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of machinery for milling (electric mill) to grow new business.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn thought of opening a community-based variety store because the people in her village still go to the town to buy their basic items and other commodities.  

Her store is open from six o’clock in the morning until eight o’clock in the evening. She usually goes to the town’s public market twice a week to purchase commodities, but Marilyn wants to cut her transportation cost and maximize her time, especially when the road conditions are rough. She wants to go to the public market only once a week and buy in bulk, but she does not have enough capital to do this. 

She expects that a loan of P5,000 will give her more income. As such, she will be able to grow her business and help her husband, who is engaged in farming.  With their combined income, it is possible for them to reach their dreams of sending her children to school and be elevated from poverty.  

Marilyn shared her three priorities in life: to have good health, good family relationships, and faithfulness to God all the time.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Susana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Susana  inició su negocio porque con el ingreso que recibía como empleada no era  posible cubrir  sus gastos, junto a su hermano decidieron poner una pequeña tienda de abarrotes para cubrir las necesidades básicas de la familia.  Comenzó el negocio en enero del 2003, empezaron en el local en el que están ahora, originalmente solo vendían refrescos y botanas, con un poco de abarrotes. Ahora la venta principal son los abarrotes, y desean agregar la venta de  salchichonería y lácteos. Desde que inicio la tienda a la fecha ha ido incrementando los  clientes gracias la buen servicio que brindan.


Ella necesita un préstamo por MXN $4,500 que pagara en 6 meses para  adquirir más mercancía que le permitirá abarcar otro tipo de mercado o clientes, lo cual incrementara los ingresos y mejorara la imagen de la tienda.
texts.en:
Susana started her business because the money she earned as a domestic worker wasn’t enough to cover her living expenses. Together with her brother, she decided to set up a small grocery store to pay for their family’s basic needs. They began the store in January of 2003, in the same location it is in today, originally selling only soda, snacks, and a few grocery items. They now sell mostly groceries and wish to add a delicatessen and dairy products to the store. Since opening, the grocery store has attracted more and more customers thanks to good customer service. Susana needs a loan of 4,500 MXN, which she will pay back in 6 months, to buy merchandise that will meet all of her customers’ needs. These additional sales will both increase income and improve the store’s reputation.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Steffanie

texts.es: Steffanie tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera, vive con sus padres quienes la incentivan a seguir adelante en su negocio. Es una joven con muchas metas, por eso se esfuerza mucho en su trabajo, se dedica a la venta de ropa de modelos variados para todas la edades, vender puerta a puerta por los diferentes lugares de su localidad, dejando al contado o al crédito. En sus momentos libres elabora joyería, tales como argollas, aretes, collares, etc. Le gusta su trabajo porque se relacionarse con muchas personas, y le es rentable porque solo trabaja en base a  pedidos y como sus clientes no tienen donde comprar ropa, siempre esperan la llegada de Steffanie con sus pedidos. Este es su 3er crédito con MFP, con el dinero que ha solicitado quiere comprar más ropa para su negocio, además adquirirá una moto lineal de segunda mano para movilizarse y evitar estar pagando varios pasajes en transporte público cuando se visita a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Steffanie is 19 years old, single, and lives with her parents, who encourage her in her business. She is a young lady with many goals, so she works hard at her job selling various styles of clothing for all ages. She sells door-to-door around her town and accepts cash or credit. In her free time she makes jewelry like rings, earrings, necklaces, etc. She likes her job because she interacts with many people, and it's profitable because she only sells by taking orders. Since her customers do not have anywhere to buy clothing, they always look forward to Steffanie's clothing deliveries. This is her 3rd loan with MFP. With the money she has requested, she wants to buy more clothing for her business and a second-hand motor scooter for travel to avoid paying fares on public trasportation when she visits her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom M. is 57 years old and lives with his wife in Bati district, Takeo province. He has been operating a moto-taxi business to earn a living and is able to make US$10 in revenue every day. His wife has a business selling Khmer cakes and makes US$12 in revenue per day. This couple has two children, one who is a construction worker.

Mr. Mom M. would like to take out a loan to purchase a motorbike to continue running his moto-taxi business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Enhbold

texts.en:
Enhbold G. is 38 years old and has a family of four, including his wife, a son and a daughter. His 16-year-old son is a 9th-grade student in high school and his daughter is four years old and goes to a kindergarten.

Since 1998, he has been renting a small room located under a staircase in an apartment, where he runs a bike repair, rental and accessories business. As of today, he is still running his small bike business. Most of his customers are 10- to 15-year-olds and those people who use a bike as the main transportation means for their daily lives, such as for work.

The bike business does quite well during warm seasons. In 2008, he bought a small car with profits from his bike business and used it as a taxi in the city. He said that his life has improved since he started the taxi business.

His wife has also started contributing to the family business by continuing the bike business. As the warm season is approaching soon, they requested a loan to buy bike accessories for the bike shop. Enhbold and his wife's hopes are to live without economic dependence on anyone and to live every day to the fullest.

loans.use: To buy bike accessories for the bike shop

loans.name: Ruqaiya Asghar Ali Group

texts.en:
My name is Ruqaiya and I’m a citizen of a city named Kot Radha Kishan in Pakistan. I own a two-room brick house and have been living in it with my family for the last nine years. I am the mother of two sons. Both of my sons work in a factory on a monthly wage. My husband has a dairy business. My husband and I get milk from the buffalo and sell to the community and milk shops. Presently, we have one buffalo and I’m applying for a loan to buy another buffalo for my husband’s dairy business.

I’m the group leader for two other women from my locality. Sugran baji and Shakeela baji each want a loan to buy buffalos for their dairy business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for the dairy business

loans.name: María Estela

texts.es:
La señora María Z. actualmente se dedica a atender su negocio de venta de bebidas en su propia casa de habitación donde a diario ofrece las bebidas gaseosas y jugos de todo sabor.

Hoy en día ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de las bebidas y así ofertarlas en su establecimiento que ha logrado desarrollar grandemente por lo que ha adquirido mesas y sillas para los clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Z. sells drinks from her home. Every day she offers soft drinks and juices of all flavors. She has asked Ceprodel for a loan to buy drinks in order to offer them for sale. She has been able to greatly expand her establishment by getting tables and chairs for her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soft drinks and juice

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi B. is forty years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, one son and two daughters.  Her children are all out of school and currently learning trades. Her husband is a cocoa farmer. Esi lives with her husband and the children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town named Takorase, which is near Akim Oda in the eastern region of Ghana.
 
Esi is a trader. She trades smoked fish. She procures the fish from nearby towns and sells on a table top in the market square. Esi also sells palm nuts to food vendors. She has been in this business for five years and desires to expand her business. She is hopeful to improve her standard of living and give her children the support they need.

loans.use: To procure smoked fish in bulk.

loans.name: Flor

texts.en: Flor R., 26, is single and a business woman in her own right. According to her, she is happy to know that, with her own struggle and perseverance, she has been able to come up with a good business that earns enough to provide all her needs. With her variety store, Flor is striving to make it more stable. She's doing this to extend help to her family and also to prepare for her future. To make her store more profitable, she is applying for her 3rd cycle loan of PHP 11,000 with HSPFI, a Kiva partner.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her variety store

location.town: Tuburan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Gabic Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Gabic, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Hilmer Torres”, vive en el Jr. Alfonso Ugarte Nº 560, Distrito de Morales, Provincia San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 38 años, 02 hijos que aun depende de ella.

Es una mujer capaz, se dedica al servicio de Fotocopias, implemento su negocio que se encuentra ubicado en su misma casa, donde atiende diariamente con muy buena demanda de clientes,  por lo que se siente muy contenta ya que es la única fotocopia en el barrio y al frente de un Colegio.
Nos cuenta también que para iniciarse, tuvo que haber pasado por muchos retos, empezaron con una impresora multifuncional, viendo que el procedimiento era muy lento, decidió comprarse una fotocopiadora mas grande, para poder atender a sus clientes y atenderlos mas rápido.
 En la actualidad ya es conocida por sus clientes, mayormente alumnos, amigos, vecinos y clientes fijos, cuenta con un personal que la apoya.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, desea invertirlo comprando millares de papel bond y frascos de toner para contar con todo el material necesario y no le falte el  momento mas oportuno.

Gabic, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy capaz, con más ganas de seguir adelante y hacer realidad sus sueños. Esta muy agradecida, con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos que le ayudo a iniciarse como una mujer empresaria.
texts.en:
Ms. Gabic Z. is a member of the “Hilmer Torres” Microfinance Institute. She is a 38-year-old married mother with two dependent children.

She is a competent woman who offers photocopy services in her business, which she runs from home. She serves a sizeable amount of customers, which is why she feels happy to be the only copy center in the neighborhood across the street from a school.

She also states that in order to get settled, she had to overcome many challenges. She started out with just a multifunction printer, but upon seeing that it was too slow, she decided to purchase a bigger copy machine so that she could offer her customers speedy services.

She is now well-known by her customers, who are mostly students, friends, neighbors, and steady customers. She also has supportive personnel.

She would like to invest this 1,000.00 PEN loan in purchasing reams of bond paper and toner cartridges so that she can have the necessary supplies and not run out when she most needs them.

Gabic now feels like a capable woman with a stronger desire to get ahead in life and realize her dreams. She is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her to get started as a businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase copy machine supplies (paper and toner)

loans.name: White Teeth And Black Hearts Group

texts.en:
Watta is a 20-year-old business woman who has a stand in one of the large markets in Liberia.  Watta has a business selling “small, small things,” which means a small stand carrying some variety of small spicy peppers, onions, garlic, small bags of spices, salt, cans of tomato paste, bottles of vegetable oil, bottles of palm oil, etc.  She has been doing this business for 3 years.    

Watta has one children who is now 2 years old.  The child goes to day care while Watta is at work.     Watta says that her business is successful because of the way that she talks to people.  She is able to attract people to come to her stand by making friends in the market place.  She hopes that because of this good strategy, her business will expand, and that because of this expansion her brothers and sisters will be able to go to college.     

Today, Watta is getting a loan to introduce clothing sales into her business.  She believes that this business will be more profitable.

loans.use: To buy clothes to start a clothing business

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita Q. is from the village of Corrales, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old. Perlita is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Perlita owns and operates a food market. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling vegetables and spices in the local community. Perlita has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 30,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Perlita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Perlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Perlita is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Perlita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ludy

texts.en:
Ludy Q. is from the village of Banadero, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old. Ludy is married and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Ludy owns and operates a business venture in the transportation sector. The main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcab services to local community members. Ludy has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Ludy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ludy has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Ludy is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Ludy from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Alejandra es socia del Banco Comunal Bonanza.
Alejandra es viuda, tiene 54 años y 5 hijos, Alejandra viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compra cereales, productos que vende en el mercado Nery García, además Alejandra tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa negocio que ayuda con la ayuda de su hija.
Alejandra necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, fideo y arroz.
Los sueños de Alejandra son surtir su tienda y educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Alejandra is a member of Bonanza community bank. She is a widow, 54 years old, and has 5 children. Alejandra travels to different street markets in the region where she buys grains, then sells the products in the Nery García market. She also has a grocery store in her house that she runs with the help of her daughter. Alejandra needs a loan of 1,050 PEN, which will be invested in the purchase of sugar, pasta, and rice. Her dream is to better stock her store and bring up her children well.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, pasta, and rice.

loans.name: Lonimar

texts.en:
Lonimar L. is from the village of Lao Proper. He is 45 years old. Lonimar is married and has three grown children. To make a living, Lonimar owns and operates a business selling baked goods in the local community. Lonimar has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately $315 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Lonimar joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Lonimar is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be Lonimar's first loan from Lonimar from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Siwema

texts.en:
Siwema is a member of the  Gangilonga borrower group in Kinayanambo, Iringa. She is married and a mother of 2 children. Her children are 9, and 2 years old.

Siwema has owned a food business selling local beer for 3 years, she works 12 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Siwema`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 100,000 Tsh in order to buy more maize for making local beer.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Siwema hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more maize for local beer

loans.name: Venancia

texts.en:
Venancia G. is from the village of Bocator Tangub City. She is 57 years old. Venancia is married and has one adult child. To make a living, Venancia owns & operates a fishing business selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Venancia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Venancia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Venancia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Venancia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Venancia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units with offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia is 44 years old, married and a mother to four children. She has been engaged in the hog raising business for six years and this has been a great help in sending her children to school.  Aside from raising her hogs, she is also helping her husband in managing their farm and occasionally she works on other farmers land to earn PHP100.00 a day in additional income.  

Aurelia lacks business capital for the maintenance of her business.  In this regard, she would like to borrow a loan from the KIVA lenders in the amount of PHP3,000 that will be used to purchase sufficient supplies of feed for her hogs.  She hopes that her business will continue to grow for the benefit of  her family.

loans.use: Additional capital to purchase supplies of feed.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora, together with her husband, is engaged in manufacturing furniture in their village. It has been their main source of income for two years and, according to her, their business is doing better. Their income is being used to support the educational needs of their three children.

She is requesting a loan of PHP 4,000 for the development of their business. She will need the loan to purchase more materials needed for her manufacturing business, such as various kinds of wood. Nora dreams of expanding her business in order to generate more income to provide the needs of her family. Nora is 36 years old. She is married to Rolando, who is also a farmer. They own farmland and it is an additional source of income for their family. The couple has four children, three of whom are presently studying. They live in the village of Ballacong, Ilagan, Isabela.

loans.use: Development of her furniture manufacturing business

loans.name: James Elly

texts.en:
James is 37 years and married to Loice Kadzo. The couple has six children, aged between 13 years and six months.

James has been in farming for the last 10 years and earns a monthly profit of Kshs 2000. He was introduced to Kadet by one of the members in his group. Through this loan, he hopes to expand his farming business and employ others. He will use the loan specifically to buy seeds, pesticides, petrol, fertilizers and labor for his business.

James describes himself as a progressive client who always seeks ways to move forward. His ambition is to save and educate his children to university level and build rental houses to increase his income.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke.

loans.use: To buy seeds (Kshs 6000), labour (Kshs 2800), pesticide (Kshs 1200), petrol (Kshs 10000), and fertilizers (Kshs 2500)

loans.name: Tas-Try Group

texts.en:
These are members of the Tas-Try group. They are small-scale entrepreneurs in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. They have applied for a loan of SLL 500,000 each to enable them to strengthen their businesses. In this way, they can better provide for their children in terms of feeding, clothing, and educating them.

The leader of the group is Fatmata K., on the left. Fatmata was born in Masongbo village, about three miles from Makeni city. Fatmata is approximately forty-two years of age. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a driver and her children are attending secondary schools.

Fatmata sells rice and palm-oil, i.e., the country’s most popular cooking oil. She has had over fifteen years of experience in this business. With her share of the loan, Fatmata will buy more bags of rice and more gallons of palm-oil to add to her business inventory.

loans.use: Buy gallons of palm-oil and bags of rice

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina sells medicine to make a living. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to own a maternity home in the future. She is a LAPO client. She is 38 years old and married and she has four children. Her husband is a commercial driver and he also supports their home. She has been in this business for a long time.

She is requesting for a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more medicines to sell. She says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders

The Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and throughtout Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Virgen del Carmen, se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad D. Huanupampa, distrito D. Totos, provincia D. Cangallo, departamento D. Ayacucho. Esta comunidad se ubica a 3,800 msnm y se caracteriza por su dedicación  a la ganadería y la agricultura.

Melania es casada y tiene 02 hijos. Melania se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes, los cuales adquiere en la ciudad y venD. en su comunidad, negocio que comparte con su esposo. Melania requiere D. un préstamo, el cual invertirá en su negocio adquiriendo mercadería. Melania tiene como meta el adquirir un carro, para lo cual ya trabaja arduo.

Gregoria es casada y tiene 03 hijos. Gregoria se dedica a la venta D. quesos y algunas frutas, los cuales venD. en la comunidad D. Totos, negocio en el cual es ayudada  por sus hijos y esposo. Gregoria, requiere D. un préstamo, con el cual abastecerá su negocio. Gregoria, se encuentra ahorrando para poder pagar los estudios D. sus hijos, ya que quiere que ellos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The “Virgen del Carmen” Communal Bank is located in the Huanupampa community in the District of Totos, Cangallo Province, Department of Ayacucho. This community is located 3800 meters above sea level and is known for being a center for raising livestock and farming.

Melania is married and has two children. She sells groceries, which she acquires in the city and then sells in her community. Her husband helps with managing the business. Melania is requesting a loan to acquire merchandise for her business. Her goal is to purchase a car to help with her hard work.

Gregoria is married and has three children. She sells cheeses and fruit in the community of Totos. Her husband and children help her with the business. Gregoria is requesting a loan so that she can restock her business. She is saving money to pay for her children’s education because she want them to become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their businesses

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites started managing her sari-sari (variety) store in 2008.  Now with all her efforts to make it bigger, she has been able to better provide for the financial needs of her family.  She is 40 years old living in Norala, South Cotabato.

Marites plans to use this 12,000 Philippine peso loan from Kiva field partner Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to buy groceries for her store and make it more productive.

loans.use: groceries

loans.name: Monday

texts.en:
Monday F. sells various items in a retail shop and is requesting a loan to stock bags of rice and beans to sell.  Monday is 35 years-old and is married with a husband that is a soldier. She has two children and both go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a car that will be used as a taxi.

Kiva partner BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.  BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 female members.

loans.use: To purchase rice and beans.

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah is a 42-year-old married woman with four children between the ages of 24 and 18. All her children go to school, the first two at the university and the other two in senior six and five. 

Norah owns and lives in a six-room house with six people, and she takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity and piped water and gets three meals a day. Norah incurs transportation costs to and from buying secondhand clothes from Owino market. She works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala. 

She owns a shop in Ntinda Bukoto 11 Parish where she sells all types of secondhand clothes. She sells both retail and wholesale. Norah works seven days a week, receiving an average of thirty customers a day. Her major business challenges include the ever-increasing cost of secondhand clothes. Her monthly expenses include feeding the family and medication.  

Norah has been in this business for over eighteen years and with MCDT for ten years, now servicing her twenty-first loan and working with the same group mates. Norah joined MCDT because it was near her home and also because she likes working in groups. She wants to use this loan to buy more secondhand clothes to sell. She hopes to see her business grow bigger so that she can start selling on a wholesale basis only.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second hand clothes

loans.name: Mildred's Group

texts.en:
Mildred P. is from the village of Dalig Viejo. She is 51 years old. Mildred is the group leader of an eight-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Mildred P.'s Group.

Mildred is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Mildred owns & operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Mildred has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Mildred joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mildred has successfully repaid a previous loan of 23,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Mildred is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the 10th loan taken out by Mildred from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new products to sell

loans.name: Ye's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Vannak N. is a group leader of four people who all live in Chrouy Ampil village in Kandal province and they will use the loan in different purposes. She is a clothe seller.
