Maria Virginia is 44 years old and she belongs to the Community Group 'Las Empresaias de Exito II'. She lives on Manuel Cox 107 road in the settlement of Aurora Diaz in the Port of Salaverry in the province of Trujillo, in the department of La Libertad, Peru.

Maria finished primary education but she did not like studying, and always preferred business so she decided to stop studying. She got married when she was 15 years old and she has 2 kids, each one with a serious commitment, and she currently looks after her grandson. Maria works making lunches to sell, which is normally called 'menu', as well as selling fizzy drinks. This business runs from her house.

With the first loan of 300 soles, that she repaid in 4 installments, she bought rice, sugar and oil. With this credit of 800 soles, which she will repay in 6 installments, she will buy rice, sugar, fizzy drinks and beer for the Saturday and Sunday picnics.

Maria Virginia has a house that is not yet finished due to lack of funds. She dreams of finishing it and doing it up nicely, so that she can house her kids and grandkids.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, fizzy drinks and beer in bulk/Compra de azucar, arroz, bebidas gaseosas, cerveza al por mayor.

loans.name: Sien's Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan for four borrowers. Mrs. Sien P., 30, is the group leader. She makes a living raising pigs as well as growing vegetables such as cabbage, morning glory, and water lilies to sell. She has two children, both of whom are still young and attend school. Her husband, Mr. Mao Sitha, 37, is a motorcycle taxi driver. Sien is applying for a $50 loan to purchase more piglets to raise.

The other three members of the group are: Mrs. Dong P., 50, is a Khmer wine distiller. She seeks a loan of $50 to buy a cart. Mrs. Sam C., 25, is a local construction worker who needs a loan of $50 to buy a piglet to raise. Mrs. Moeut P., 25, raises pigs for a living. She is requesting a $50 loan to purchase zinc to decorate her house.

The borrowers live in the Leangdaiy Commune in Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: to purchase more piglets to raise

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es:
La Señora Maria Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras”, vive en la región San Martín, provincia y distrito de Moyobamba, se dedica a la venta de productos de pan llevar como plátanos, menestras, yuca verduras, Mani y su negocio está ubicado en el mercado central de la ciudad,  lugar donde acuden diariamente a comprar sus clientes que son los visitantes del mercado.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará plátanos en racimos, yuca en sacos, frijoles en sacos de diferentes variedades así como maní en sacos y otros productos que necesita para surtir su negocio y atender las exigencias de sus clientes. 

María Victoria tiene 66 años, es madre de 12 hijos de los cuales solo 4 viven, ya todos son independientes. Ahora vive con su esposo y con uno de sus hijos quien la apoya en su negocio y acompaña a sus padres. Está agradecida por el apoyo brindado por Manuela Ramos que le permite crecer, tanto a ella como también a las demás mujeres trabajadoras, en sus respectivos negocios.
texts.en:
Maria Victoria is a member of the community bank “Mujeres Emprendedoras” (‘Women Entrepreneurs’) and lives in the San Martín region of the Moyobamba district and province. She sells bread as well as bananas, vegetable stew, yucca, and peanuts at the city’s central market everyday. With this loan of 2,000 PEN, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy bananas in bulk, sacks of yucca, peanuts and different types of beans, and other products to supply her business and meet her customers’ needs. Maria Victoria is 66-years old, mother of 12 children, only 4 of which are living and now independent. She currently lives with her husband and a son, who helps his parents and supports Maria Victoria in her work. She is grateful for the support provided by the Manuela Ramos microfinance program, CrediMUJER, which has made it possible for her, as well as so many other working women, to improve business.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bananas, yucca, beans, peanuts, and other products in bulk

loans.name: Teat

texts.en:
Teat V., 52, works as farmer and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Since 1990, she has owned a plot of land on which she grows rice for a living and is able to make US$2 per day. Her husband, Rot Him, 56, pictured here, runs a business recharging batteries and normally makes US$8 per day. The has five children, of which two are employed and two are students.

Teat V. told a loan officer that she spends US$40 on food and US$15 on her children’s education every month. In her village, people depend heavily on batteries to power their lights, TV, radio and other appliances, so the battery-recharging business is a profitable one. Teat V. is requesting a loan of US$1,000 to purchase charging tools, a generator and a motorbike to help her husband in this business activity.

loans.use: To purchase charging tools, generator and a motorbike.

loans.name: Mobin

texts.en:
This is Mobin A. who is 45 years old, marred and the father of five children. He lives in Behsood in Nangarhar province. Mobin is an educated man but he is working as a farmer on his own land. He has been involved in this business more than 10 years but now he wants to enlarge his business. For that he needs for money (loans).
Therefore Mobin has requested an individual loan of 50,000 Afghanis with a term of 20 months to enlarge his business  and buy more seeds for the income season. He wants to be a good farmer in the future.

Mobin is happy about this process of small loans in Jalalabad Afghanistan.  He wants to say that without this loan would be impossible to get his business to be its best. Mobin thanks all lenders, Kiva and AFSG in Jalalabad Afghanistan.

loans.use: To buy more seeds to help enlarge his business

loans.name: Vitalie

texts.en: This is Vitalie C. and he is 36 years old. He sells all varieties of vegetables and fruits in the district. He has been doing this for the past two years, and has already seen that the sale of these products is very profitable as people need to buy them. Vitalie is a very diligent man in business and he is always willing to extend his activity. Now he wants to increase the sales of vegetables on the market and has bought 10 more hectares of arable land. He wants to develop the business and to increase his working capital with materials like digging tools, a plough, fuel, and seeds.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies to increase the sales of vegetables on the market

loans.name: Galilaya Group

texts.en:
Grace, a livestock keeper in the Tengeru neighborhood of Arusha for the past three years, currently earns an average monthly profit of $90. She works at her business for six hours each day.  Grace is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania to purchase more animals in order to increase her current stock. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to enlarge her business.  

Grace, 43, is the married mother of five children, ages 23, 20, 17, 13 and 9. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Sion and Aikande, each of whom has her own small business in Arusha.

loans.use: To buy more animals in order to increase her current stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy abandoned cars in order to recycle metal.

loans.name: Boubacar

texts.fr:
Bouba B. vend des produits forestiers tels que les rôniers, les crintins qui servent de clôture et toiture dans les sites touristiques.
Grâce à cette activité, ce pére de famille de 7 enfants, arrive à subvenir à ses besoins
Il sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer ses activités.
texts.en:
Boubacar B. sells woodland products such as palm fronds and bamboo which serve to build fences and roofing in touristic sites. Thanks to this business, this father of a family of 7 children, manages to make a living. He is requesting this loan to reinforce his business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of woodland products

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia N. and her family live in Villa Marzo Cordon. Lydia is 50 years old and married to Ernesto N.. She is thankful for the blessings she has received from God: having married such a supportive husband, having such good children and being able to run a small enterprise.

Lydia has been a hog raiser for three years and is requesting additional working capital of PHP 8,000 to expand her business. She also helps her husband maintain their rice farm, which is their largest source of income. The couple is grateful because they have been blessed with three children; Jerry is 32 years old, followed by Jerwin who is 31 years old and the youngest is Jermaya who is 24 years old. Unfortunately, Jermaya did not finish her college education due to lack of financial support.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
La señora Nelly, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Shatojinas Laboriosas”, vive en la Calle Comercio s/nº, Distrito Banda D. Shatoja, Provincia El Dorado, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, y tiene 02 hijos, los 02 que aun dependen D. ella.

Nelly, es una mujer joven, con ganas D. seguir adelante, se considera una mujer luchadora y eficiente.
Comenzó vendiendo sus anticuchos y juanes, como vio que le genera buenos ingresos, decidió abrirse mas en el campo D. venta D. alimentos, así que con su esfuerzo estableció su propio restaurant, ubicada en su misma casa, un local muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes; con ese carisma y alegría que tiene.
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio y nos cuenta que le va muy bien, ya que es muy conocida y tiene buena acogida.

Con el préstamo D. S/ 500.00, lo invertirá comprando insumos para preparar sus alimentos  como: kilos D. arroz, azúcar y papas, racimos D. plátanos, pollos vivos en javas. Y algunas herramientas cocina, para remplazar a los antiguos.

Nelly, se siente una mujer tranquila y contenta con lo logrado, y desea asegurarse una vejez tranquila por lo que agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a cumplir sueños y metas, así como a otras   mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Nelly is a young woman with a strong desire to make a better life for herself and her family. She is hardworking and efficient with her time. She started her business by selling typical Peruvian foods like "anticuchos" and "juanes". She was able to earn a good profit by selling these items and she decided to start selling more food items. With hard work and dedication she started her own restaurant that she runs out of her own house. It is nicely set-up and she is able to serve her clients well. She is a very charismatic and happy person and this helps her to attract and keep customers. Her business is doing very well and has a good reputation for being a nice place to eat at. With the loan of $175 she will invest in ingredients to prepare her foods, like large quantities of rice, sugar, potatoes, bananas and chicken. She will also invest in new tools for her kitchen so that she can replace the old ones.

(Translated by Alexis of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to prepare her foods, like large quantities of rice, sugar, potatoes, bananas and chicken.

loans.name: Mr. Vanseng Sok Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank, which consists of fourteen members, is located in Thma Kor village in Kandal province and they plan to use the loan for different purposes.

Mr. Vanseng S. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. He is a farmer who owns a small piece of land near his house which he uses grow vegetables and fruits. Now he is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer and pesticide to support his growing. His wife, Mrs. S. SaR., makes Chinese noodles to earn an income to support the family.

Mr. Vanseng S. is the 59-year-old father of eight childR.: three are laborers; another is a seller who helps his mother’s business; three are enrolled in the local school; and the youngest one is too young to work or study. 

Four members in this group loans are end-of-term (EoT) loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Those with EoT loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. EoT  loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pesticide to support his farm

loans.name: Hoeurng

texts.en:
Hoeurng T. is a 44-year-old married mother of three children, two of whom are students and the other one was not so long in school and now works as a garment worker for the industry in Phnom Penh town.

Hoeurng T. currently stays at home to weave baskets to earn a living. She can weave over five sets of baskets a day for her husband to sell in retail door-to-door around the community. He can sell them for the price of $0.70 per set. Besides their current work, this family has always had a farming business.

Hoeurng T. has used all the raw materials from her stock and that is why she has applied for a loan from Kiva in order to acquire materials to weave more baskets.

loans.use: To acquire materials to weave more baskets

loans.name: Bimunira

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan
      Бимунире - 30 лет. Замужем и мать 3-х детей. Бимунира занимается переработкой козьей шерсти и производства шерстяной нити. Она этим занимается вместе со своей свекровью. Они домохозяйки, нигде не работают и дома занимается этой деятельностью. Их мужья занимаются скотоводством. Они перепродают скот, откармливают крупно-рогатый скот.  Бимунира и её свекровь помогают мужчинам в увеличении их семейного бюджета. Бимунира кредитуется в нашей организации более 2-х лет. Она успешно закончила свой предыдущий займ и хочет взять новый.
texts.en:
Bimunira is 30 years old. She is married and is a mother of 3 children. Bimunira is involved in processing goat wool and making wool yarn. She is involved in this together with her mother-in-law. They are both homemakers, not employed and do this business at home. Their husbands are involved in animal husbandry. They resell livestock and raise cattle. Bimunira and her mother-in-law help the men with increasing their family budgets. Bimunira has been a client of our organization for over 2 years. She successfully repaid her previous loan and wants to obtain a new one.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
El señor Raúl M.  vive con su esposa la señora Imelda Soto en la propiedad ubicada en nuestra ciudad, el trabaja en Estados Unidos en la Aduana desde hace 15 años, su esposa se hace cargo del hogar y de la familia. 
Ellos como una familia unida están tramitando este crédito para la construcción de una barda en la parte trasera de su casa ya que meses atrás unos pandilleros se metieron a robar y por medio de este proyecto sentirán una mayor seguridad y tranquilidad en su hogar.

loans.use: Construccion de una barda en la parte trasera de su vivienda

loans.name: Meyeh

texts.fr: Marié et mère d’un enfant cette dame exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de boissons alcoolisées. Elle dresse son étalage de marchandises non loin du marché local d’akodessewa. La situation géographique de son activité lui permet de faire de bonne recette. Voulant augmenter son stock de marchandises en prévision des fêtes de fin d’année qui approche pour bien vendre. Elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 10 cartons de boissons alcoolisées de différentes marques.
texts.en:
A married mother of one child, this lady operates a revenue-generating business selling alcoholic drinks.  She sets up her display of merchandise not far from the local marketplace of Akodessewa.  Her location enables her to make a good income.  Ahead of the year-end holidays approaching, and wanting to augment her stock of merchandise to do well in her sales, she's requesting a WAGES loan to buy 10 boxes of alcoholic beverages of different brands.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy drinks

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia B. is currently in the business of selling beer and soda and is requesting a loan to purchase more crates of beer and some wines to sell.  

Julia is 35 years old and is Married with a husband that is a business man. She has 5 children and her children go to school.  

With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a hotel.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase more crates of beer and some wines to sell

loans.name: Claudia Georgina

texts.es: Claudia Georgina L. C. de 34 años de edad reside en el departamento de Ahuachapán vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos. Claudia ha sabido explotar sus habilidades, ella se destaca mucho en la cocina y es así como se lanza a poner su propio comedor el cual ahora es el favorito de muchos, que degustan de los platillos hechos en el comedor de Claudia, ahora ella solita de un crédito para comprar mayor cantidad de insumos para la producción de su platillos.

loans.use: compra de materia prima

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida M. lives in the village of Malagana, Claveria, Misamis Oriental. She is 39 years old, married and has two school-aged children. She makes a living by cooking and selling food, particularly snacks and delicacies popular in her community. She has been in this business for more than four years, and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from her work.

In June 2009, Zenaida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and her business. She has successfully repaid two previous loans from HSPFI, and has applied for a new loan to buy the ingredients she needs to make new items to cook and sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by this loan to continue to expand and improve her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy ingredients needed to made food items she sells to her customers

loans.name: Leoniza

texts.en:
Leoniza B. is from the village of Labo, Ozamiz City. She is 44 years old. Leoniza is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Leoniza owns and operates food business. Leoniza has been engaged in her business for more than 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Leoniza joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials for her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for business

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Danaya sont tous des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 28 ans, 3 enfants et vivant dans des familles conjugales nucléaires avec leurs enfants et époux. Ces femmes résident dans le quartier Dialanikoro de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des relations de mariage et font le commerce  d’articles d’occasion (habits, chaussures, sacs etc).
Dans le souci d’acheter assez de balles de friperie pour augmenter leurs stocks, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de groupe et les précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Avec ce nouveau  prêt elles comptent acheter, 9 balles de friperie sur le marché de Bamako pour ensuite les revendre dans le marché de Bougouni à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Les produits sont vendus en détail au comptant ou à crédit. 
Avec ce prêt les femmes comptent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel de 45 000 FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé pour subvenir aux frais d’éducation des enfants.
texts.en:
The members of the group Danaya are married women averaging 28 years of age and 3 children each living in conjugal nuclear families with their children and husbands. These women reside in the Dialanikoro district of the city of  Bougouni (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of marriage, and they do commerce in second-hand goods (clothing, shoes, bags, etc.)  Concerned about buying enough bales of used items to augment their stocks, the group members decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their fifth group loan.  The preceding ones have been properly repaid.  With this new loan, they intend to buy 9 bales of used clothing and the like at the Bamako market.  And then they will sell them at the Bougouni market to customers composed of women and men.  The goods are sold retail in cash transactions or on credit. With this loan, the group members each plan on realizing a profit of 45,000 francs CFA per month that will be used to cover the costs of educating the children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Second-hand clothing

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells sarongs of various colors and shapes. She hawks (sells door-to-door) her sarongs within her community. She has been in this business for 5 years. She Josephine is 47 years old and married with 5 children. 

Josephine is a client of Lift above Poverty Organization (LAPO). LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and throughout Africa. She hopes for a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says "thank you" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia es natural de la ciudad de Urcos de la provincia de Quispicanchis del departamento del Cusco y pertenece al Banco Comunal “Qori Orcco” de la Asociación Arariwa. El nombre del banco es de origen de la lengua Quechua que traducido al español significa “Cerro de Oro”. 

Nuestra socia JUANA tiene 60 años, es conviviente y tiene cinco hijos que ya no depende de ella. La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el negocio de venta de pollos y pescado. La socia tiene su propia puesto de trabajo en el mercado “Unidos de Urcos”. Ella compra el pollo de los mayoristas de la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son 28 años que tiene el negocio y le ha ido muy bien, gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que a los años que tiene sigue trabajando. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar pollo y pavo para estas fiestas navideñas ya que por estas épocas es donde se vende más. 
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

La ciudad de Urcos se encuentra ubicada a 45 km del Cusco siguiendo la carretera asfaltada a Puno, es un pequeño poblado con una hermosa laguna donde, según la leyenda, Huascar lanzó una enorme cadena de oro para evitar que los españoles se la llevaran.
texts.en:
Juana is native to Urcos, Quispicanchis, in the Cusco Region of Peru. She belongs to the community bank Qori Orcco, which is part of the Arariwa Association. The bank’s name comes from the Quechua language; it means “hill of gold.” Juana is 60 years old and lives with her five children, though they no longer depend on her. She balances her household responsibilities with her business: selling chicken and fish at the Unidos de Urcos market. She buys her chicken wholesale in Cusco. She has been in business for 28 years, and because of her work ethic, she has done very well for herself. Juana is a hard-working, enterprising woman who doesn’t let her age stand in the way of her job. This loan will help her be able to buy chickens and turkeys in time for the holiday season, when they’re in high demand. Juana is grateful for the opportunity this loan provides, and she pledges to repay it on schedule. Urcos City is located 45 km from Cusco, on the way to Puno. It’s a small town with a beautiful lagoon. According to legend, Huascar threw a huge gold chain into the lagoon to prevent the Spanish from taking it.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying chickens and turkeys wholesale

loans.name: Yani Flor

texts.es:
Yani es socia del Banco Comunal Alborada.
Yani es soltera, tiene 22 años y vive con sus padres, Yani junto a su mama tienen una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, actividad que realiza por las tardes porque en la mañana estudia contabilidad en un instituto.
Yani necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de fideos, galletas, gaseosas.
Los sueños de Yani son terminar su carrera y tener un negocio propio.
texts.en:
Yani is a member of the Alborada Communal Bank. She is 22 years old, single, and lives with her parents. She and her mother have a store in the home, selling groceries, produce, and meat. She runs the business in the afternoon, because in the morning she studies accounting in an institute. Yani needs a loan of 1,050 soles, to purchase pasta, cookies, and soft drinks. Yani’s dream is to finish her studies and have her own business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pasta, cookies, soft drinks

loans.name: Sor

texts.en: Mr. Sor S. is 46 years old and he lives in Krang Touch village, Takeo province. He is a duck breeder who earns income by selling eggs. Since his poultry business is doing well, he would like to expand it. Thus, Sor S. is requesting a loan to buy more ducklings for breeding to increase his income. His wife, Mrs. Satt Yorng, is a farmer who owns 1-hectare field to cultivate rice. They have four children, two of whom are employed in the garment factory, while the others attend the local school. His wife is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more ducklings

loans.name: Akimana

texts.en:
H. is 34 years old and married. She cares for three children, ages 1, 11 and 13. H. and her family live in the Kicukiro District, in the capital of Rwanda.

H. works as businesswoman, as does her husband. H. owns a small shop where she sells different kinds of shoes in the Kigali. Her husband has a small restaurant. They both work to support their family. H.'s business is actually very organized and well-known. It requires two employees to run her her business. H. has two years of experience. The hours of her shop are from 6:00 AM to 9:00 PM every day except on the weekend.

H. is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to expand her business by purchasing more and different styles of shoes, especially shoes for children. With the profits she plans to earn, H. will be able to get all of the basic needs of her family, save money for her family, especially for her children, build her own house, and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: Purchasing more shoes for sale

loans.name: Deonata

texts.en:
Deonata A. is a loving and compassionate person.  Despite being single and having no child, she expresses her love, care and kindness to her niece and nephew.  She also supports their education and treats them as her own children. 

To sustain their education until they graduate from college, Deonata is requesting a loan to grow her small “sari-sari” (variety) store, so that its profits will grow as well.  Deonata also wishes to satisfy her customers by offering a wide variety of goods for their convenience.

loans.use: Purcahse variety of goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Mrs. Consolacion G. is from the village of Dalumpinas, Sapang Dalaga. She is married and blessed with nine children. 

Her primary source of income is from buying and selling bananas. She makes a monthly income of PHP 1,500. She also owns a banana plantation as an additional source of income. 

In 2008, she joined PMPC to access the programs and services of the cooperative. This will be her third loan and she is requesting PHP 5,000 which will be used to buy fertilizer for her banana plantation.


About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for her banana plantation

loans.name: Eugene

texts.en:
Eugene is 32 years old and he is still single.  Eugene is known in the business of selling a variety of clothes, mainly jeans, and this is his fifteenth successful year in this business.  The hours of his business are from 6 am to 7 pm every day.

Eugene is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to expand his business by adding a variety of styles such as shirts and some other attractive styles.  With this additional business, Eugene will hopefully earn more profits than his previous business.  With these profits, one portion will be used to build a secure future for his future family as he is in the process of getting engaged to be married. The other portion of his profits will be reinvested in his business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes especially jeans for sale

loans.name: Arnolio

texts.en:
Arnolio C. is from the village of Olango. He is 35 years old, married, and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Arnolio plants and harvests rice for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over 13 years and earns approximately $980 every harvest season.

In 2008, Arnolio joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 28,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. 

Arnolio is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which again will be used to purchase fertilizers. This will be his 5th loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Ma. Linda

texts.en: The family of Ma. Linda, 42, is entirely dependent on the rice farm she and her husband till. While she is happy that their last harvest was good, she still hopes to increase its size.  Now preparing the farm for the next planting, she is applying to CEVI for a loan of Php 8,000 to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Afua Enyonena Ehia

texts.en: Afua Enyonena Ehia Amozou sells beauty products in Adidogome, Togo. Her business has been open since 2002. She sells different kinds of beauty products and goods out of her home. She is married with two children. Her husband is an employee of Ecobank. She requests 200,000 CFA to purchase beauty products for her business.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products

loans.name: Denison

texts.en:
In the past, Denison worked for a commercial cleaning company. He was unsatisfied being unable to take charge of his own work while not being compensated for his value. This inspired him to take charge and start his own commercial cleaning business.  

Due to the tough economic environment, it was difficult finding the capital needed to purchase the equipment necessary to run his small business.  Luckily, the little help he has received from his family was enough to jump start his business.  Proof that he is business savvy, he has been able to find work during the economic recession and has been able to keep his clients very satisfied.  

Being approved for the ACCION USA loan will facilitate his business growth by purchasing more equipment and cleaners, allowing him to expand services to his current and future clients.

About U.S. Microfinance and ACCION USA

Have you ever thought about how the new café on your corner and the delivery service that brings the fresh baked goods acquired the financial resources to start their business? Chances are, they drummed up support from their friends and family, dipped into their personal savings, used a high-interest credit card, or all of the above. An estimated 10 million small businesses in the U.S. face difficulty obtaining loans from traditional banks, even prior to the current “credit crisis.” Microfinance institutions, like ACCION USA, support these “unbanked” small businesses by giving them access to fairly-priced capital and business education. 

Small businesses also help stabilize low- to moderate-income neighborhoods and rebuild our economy through income growth and job creation. Self-employment provides workers with a way to increase their incomes, support their families, and strengthen their communities. As unemployment rises in the U.S., more and more people are turning to self-employment and start-up enterprises as a way to take control of their economic futures and provide employment opportunities in their communities. The need for support of small businesses in the U.S. is great, and it is one that ACCION USA has been striving to meet since 1991.

loans.use: To purchase equipment and cleaning supplies

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora K. is currently in the business of selling scholastic materials such as boxes of chalk, text books, exercise books, pens, etc. and is requesting a loan to stock more books and boxes of chalk to sell.  She is 34 years old and is married to a teacher. She has three children and they all go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her family.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more books and boxes of chalk to sell

loans.name: Komil

texts.en:
N. Komil is married and the father of three children. He is a farmer and since his marriage he has demonstrated that he can support his family with hard work and dedication. Because of this, he is always in the fields, growing wheat and vegetables. Komil leaves early in the morning to water the fields, then fertilizes and fumigates the crops. This work is satisfying, and it enables him to purchase goods for his home. 

Komil would like to request a loan of 8500 Somoni which he will use to buy necessary farm materials like seeds and fertilizers since they are very expensive. He is very optimistic that this loan will improve his yield and he hopes to have a continuous partnership with the lenders. Komil always makes sure that he respects the people around him since he believes that respect begets respect.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en: Mariama M. operates a provisions shop in Abura. She is a single parent taking care of one child. She has been in this business for three years. She is able to take care of her self and her child with the profit she makes from her sales. Her loan will be used to buy extra provisions. Her thinking is that her loan (which she hopes will yield great profit) will be used to buy land.

loans.use: To buy extra provisions for sale in the market

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo F. is from the village of Pinoma, Cauayan City, Isabela. He is 54 years-old and married with two adult children. To make a living, Danilo owns and operates a business raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising ducks and hogs for sale. Danilo is in the second year of his business and makes 2,000 php per month.

In 2009, Danilo joined Kiva partner ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Danilo is requesting a second loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase breeding livestock.  He plans to use the additional revenue generated to supplement his family income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock.

loans.name: Rey

texts.en:
Rey Y. is a 40-year-old farmer from the town of Banga. He has been farming for over 15 years. He also grows chickens. Rey works hard to improve his business and make it grow. He is happy that he is able to help his family financially. He also dreams to have his own family someday and he is saving for it now.

Rey joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rey has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Rey is requesting a new loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure and feed for his chickens. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Rey from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his business and save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: purchasing fertilizer and chicken feed

loans.name: Foday

texts.en: Foday is 34 years old. He is married to a trader, and has one child who is six years old. He has nine additional dependents who live with him because they need assistance from him. In 1990, Foday established his alcoholic drinks business. He began his business because he could not further his education after high school. Working six days a week and eight hours a day, he earns about 1,812,400 SLL every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. Foday requires a loan in order to increase his stock. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 571,860 SLL.  In the future, Foday plans to educate his child to university level and buy a piece of land. He also plans to rent a shop and sell wholesale. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more assorted drinks to sell in his shop

loans.name: Abahujimbaraga A Group

texts.fr:
Ndayambaje Theoneste, née à Ruhuha l’Est du Rwanda, il a 30 ans, il est marié et il a 3 enfants, son ainé a 8 ans et son cadet a 5 ans, son niveau d’étude est primaire. Il vit avec sa famille à Ruhuha Bugesera. 1 enfant va à l’école.
Il appartient dans un groupe solidaire appelé ABAHUJUMUTIMA A cultivateurs de riz,  qui est un groupe dont les membres sont  agriculteurs de riz et ils se garantissent mutuellement, Theoneste et son groupe travaillent pour faire vivre leurs familles en améliorant leurs conditions de vie et en payant les minervals pour leurs enfants. Le groupe a contracté un prêt au sein d’Amasezerano Community Banking pour acheter les engrais chimique pour felitiliser leur champ. Quand le groupe récolte, une partie de la récolte est vendue et une autre est utilisée pour la survie des familles des membres.
texts.en:
Théoneste Ndayambaje was born in Ruhuha, in Eastern Rwanda. He is 30 years old and married with three children. The eldest is 8 years old, and the youngest is 5. He attended primary school. He and his family live in Ruhuha-Bugesera. One of the children goes to school. He is a member of ABAHUJUMUTIMA A, a solidarity group of rice farmers who guarantee each other’s loans. Théoneste and his group work to support their families, to improve their living conditions, and to pay for the children’s tuition fees. The group took out a loan with Amasezerano Community Banking to buy the chemical fertilizers needed for their fields. After the harvest, part of the crop will be sold, and another portion will be used to support the members’ families.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy urea and N.P.K, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Kevin Arturo

texts.es: El señor M. F. kevin Arturo, tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero vive en casa de sus padres, con direccion Av. Los Tunos 1137 La Tinguiña, casa de material noble de una planta. Se dedica a brindar servicios de transporte, en vehiculo alquilado por su madre, se dedica a este rubro hace mas de un año.El señor tiene metas  trazadas y obejetivos, en futuro quiere tener su propio auto tico, con el credito piensa invertir en sus gastos personales.
texts.en: Sr. Kevin Arturo M. F., 22, is single and lives with his parents at Av. Los Tunos 1137 La Tinguina, in a well-constructed, one-story house.  He makes a living driving a cab, in a vehicle that he rents from his mother.  He has been working as a driver for a year.  Sr. Kevin has well-defined goals in mind.  He wants to own his own Daewoo Tico.  He will use the loan to pay personal expenses.

loans.use: Personal expenses.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley S. is from the town of Banga. She is 41 years old. Shirley is married and has two children, aged 13 and 18. To make a living, she plants and harvests rice to sell. Shirley also allotted part of her land for growing vegetables. She plants bitter gourd and other kinds of vegetables. She also sells her harvest to the market.

Shirley joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. 

Shirley is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 55-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is the father of five children, two of whom are still attending school. He is the main income provider for his family. He has twenty years of experience working as a farmer. He has been running his own farm since 1995. He is specialized in cultivating bananas and citrus fruits. He uses plastic tents to grow his products. These tents also allow him to better monitor product quality as well as grow his products for more months during the year. He works independently in his business. 

Today, he is requesting a loan of $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to perform maintenance for the irrigation system on his land. In the future, he is planning to add other type of vegetables and fruits to his farming.

loans.use: To perform maintenance for the irrigation system on his land.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine Ghazaryan lives in the Shirak region of Armenia in the village of Gharibjanyan.  She has a high school education and dreams of her three children attending university.  Her two daughters are eleven and thirteen years old and her son is four years old.  Together with her husband she has been working on the family farm for the past twenty two years. 

 Microfinance loans have enabled her to grow the business.  She would like a loan to purchase wheat and potato seeds and calves.  According to Marine’s business plan, the investment will increase her income by twenty percent.  She was born in the village of Voskehask and after her marriage moved to Gharibjanyan. She enjoys village life.  Mariam also helps nearby relatives with produce grown on the family farm.

loans.use: purchase wheat and potato seeds and calves

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza B. is from the village of Binakalan, Gingoog City. She is 29 years old. Riza is a widow and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Riza owns and operates sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods and junk foods in the local community. She also buys and sells electronic loads from several networks like SMART & GLOBE. Riza has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Riza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Riza is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products like breads and biscuits. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like breads & biscuits

loans.name: Marcos Antonio

texts.es: El señor Marcos Antonio F. P., tiene la edad de 39 años, es casado y habitante del barrio Medardo Andino, con su esposa y sus 3 hijos adolecentes, mayores de edad, que le apoyan a su padre en las tareas del negocio, Don Marcos es Ebanista desde hace mas de 15 años, el alza de los precios del combustible les ha ocasionado múltiples problemas que le obstaculizan el desarrollo optimo de su empresa, es para su negocio que el solicita un préstamo para la compra de materia prima y poder enfrentar la demanda que ha observado ha crecido en los últimos días, esta inversión les aumentara el capital de trabajo y mejorara las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Marcos Antonio F. P. is 39 years old.  He is married and lives in Medardo Andino neighborhood with his wife and three grown-up children who support their father with the work in his business.  Marcos has been a cabinet maker for more than 15 years.  The rising price of fuel has caused him multiple problems which have placed obstacles in the way of him optimally developing his business.  He is requesting this loan for his business as he would like to buy raw materials so that he can fulfil the demand that he has noticed has been growing recently.  This investment will increase his working capital and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for his business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more new DVD and VCD discs

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida A. is from the village of Mapuroc, San Mateo. She is 55 years old, married, and has four adult children. To make a living, Zenaida  raises crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Zenaida has been engaged in her business for over 34 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Zenaida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Zenaida is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. This loan will be the Zenaida's first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherpeople, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise

loans.name: Topista

texts.en:
Topista N. is 56 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is widowed and has three children, none of whom are currently in school. Topista has a poultry business, which she has run for ten years.
To help expand her business, Topista has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more chickens for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Topista hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family. In the future, she hopes to expand her business further.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens for resale

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia O. is from Gango, Ozamiz City. She is 45 years old and still single. She is a dealer of Avon products like perfume, lotion, beauty products and other cosmetics supplies. She sells to her neighbors and friends. She has been engaged in this business for thirteen years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Delia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC.

Delia is now requesting a new loan of 35,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase more Avon products to sell. This will be her 8th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the living standard for her family.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics products to sell

loans.name: Deici Vicenta

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Soraya  se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

La señora Deici es socia fundadora de éste banco Comunal y le gusta por las comodidades para los pagos. Tiene  55 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene siete hijos, seis de los cuales ya son mayores de edad y el menor de 14 años, tres de sus hijos aun viven con ella y el menor estudia en el colegio. Su esposo es maestro de una escuela de la localidad.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo en su casa donde tiene un pequeño local, nos cuenta que la mayor parte de sus ventas son a través de pedidos que sus clientes realizan con anticipación. Trabaja todos los días, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería se la traen desde Perú o Colombia y nos cuenta que son 15 años que se dedica a esta actividad.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisetas, blusas, ropa de niños, interiores, entre otras prendas. Sus sueños son tener un gran almacén.
texts.en:
The Soraya Microfinance Group gets together every two weeks in the Montecristi canton, known for its rich, pre-colonial culture and for its world renowned handicrafts, such as the famous toquilla straw (Panama) hats.
Ms. Deici is a founding member of the group, and she likes it for the ease with which one can make payments. She is a 55-year-old married mother of seven children, six of whom are grown up, and one is 14 years old. Three of her children still live with her, while the youngest is currently in school. Her husband is a teacher at a local school. 
She sells all types of apparel from home, where she has a small business space. She states that most of her sales are done by special pre-order. She works every day, accepting credit from her customers and billing them bi-weekly. Her merchandise is brought over from Peru or Colombia, and she states that she has been in the business for 15 years. 
This loan will be used to purchase pants, shirts, blouses, children's apparel, underwear, and other garments. She dreams of owning a big warehouse.

loans.use: To purchase pants, shirts, blouses, children's apparel, and undergarmets

loans.name: Santiago Antonio

texts.es:
Don Santiago, reside en Santa María departamento de Usulután, vive con esposa, un hermano, tiene 46 años de edad, se dedica a la administración de una tienda de productos de primera necesidad, cuenta con la ayuda de su esposa y su hermano para atender a los clientes; este negocio inicio con la ayuda de su madre, el horario de venta es de 6:00am a 6:00pm, su dificultad es que por el momento no cuenta con suficiente mercadería para los clientes, por lo que solicita un préstamo para realizar la inversión.

Su propósito es adquirir de aquella mercadería que tiene mayor demanda, productos como: arroz, pastas, aceite, condimentos, frijoles y detergentes. Esto le ayudara al crecimiento y ha brindar una mejor atención y servicio a los clientes.

Las aspiraciones de Don Santiago es aumentar su clientela, que sus ventas sean mejores y vivir en adecuadamente  con su familia
texts.en:
Don Santiago lives in the Santa María division of Usulután department.  He lives with his wife and his brother, and is 46 years old.   He works managing a store that sells staples, and his wife and his brother help to serve customers.  The business was started with the help of his mother.  The store is open from 6:00 am to 6:00 pm.

His difficulty at the moment is that he does not have enough merchandise for his customers, so he is applying for a loan for investment.  The purpose is to acquire goods that have the highest demand; products such as rice, pasta, oil, spices, beans and detergents. This will help the business grow and provide better care and service for his customers.

Don Santiago's aspirations are to increase his customer base so that his sales will grow and he can live well with his family.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, pasta, oil, spices, beans and detergents

loans.name: Yoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Yoeun was born in 1967.  She is a mother of six children, one of whom is a seamstress in garment factory, one is a barber, three are studying in the local public school, and the youngest one is 4 years old.  She and her husband, Mr. Bou, are farmers who own a small piece of land where they grow rice to feed themselves.  Mr. Bou is a construction worker and a basket maker. 

Although they try to work hard, they can earn only a small income.  To improve their condition, Mrs. Yoeun is applying for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business.

loans.use: buy a cow

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is 46 years old and married with two children.  She has been selling knitting threads for four years.  With her income, she is able to help her husband with the household expenses.  

She has been motivated to work hard since she joined Faulu Kenya, because she has to pay weekly dues with her group in Faulu Kenya.  She hopes to open an outlet for her business in the future.   She has requested for 30,000 kes to buy knitting threads.

loans.use: to buy knitting threads

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en:
Immaculee, age 45, owns and operates a well-organized general store business where she sells goods such as lotions, soap, rice, bread, and sugar. She has 15 years of experience in her business and works from 7 a.m. until 9 p.m. every day except Saturday. Immaculee currently employs two people to help her. She and her husband have five children between the ages of three and 22 years old .

Immaculee has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand the inventory of her boutique. She will be purchasing different goods to sell, such as salt, beans, soft drinks, and radios. With the profit, Immaculee will reinvest in her business, pay school fees for her children, and save for her future.

loans.use: to expand her store inventory with such items as salt, beans, and soft drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase materials for building a security wall around his home.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 38 years of age and married with three children. She owns a business planting and harvesting bananas for sale.  She has three years of experience in this business. Julie needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to financially support members of her immediate family.

In 2011, Julie joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Julie's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Kasatwa

texts.en:
Kasatwa has been practicing farming in Narok town for the past 16 years. He is 36 years old, married and supports six family members.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his third loan. He has repaid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use this loan to buy maize seeds and fertilizer, and also to hire temporary field workers to assist him with planting.

His dreams are to educate his children to a higher level and to live a better future. He is a hardworking man who can do more if funded.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Ngome

texts.en:
Ngome is a married man with 11 children, 7 attend school while 4 are still too young for school. He owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For over 30 years, he has operated a goat selling business, selling at the market to butcher shop operators. He faces a challenge of seasonality in his business. His major challenge is price fluctuations in the market. He dreams of operating a butcher shop in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 he wants to purchase cows and goats to sell for meat. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To  purchase cows and goats to sell for meat.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Forty-five-year-old Mariama, a married mother of two children, established her clothing business in 1991 to improve her economic situation and to see her children through their education. Working 6 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 850,000 every month.

Mariama is requesting a loan for Le 5,000,000, Le1,000,000 of which she will use to buy local cotton, Le1,000,000 to buy Brillion and Le2,000,000 to buy wax cotton. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 400,000. In the future, Mariama plans to build a dwelling house and a bigger shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy local cotton, Brillion and wax cotton.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To employ casual laborers to help cultivate her vegetable farm.

loans.name: Lyheng

texts.en:
Lyheng (in the photo) and his wife, Sokhai, live along National Road Number Six about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2005 and have two children--one son and one daughter. One is in school and the other is still young. 

Lyheng and his wife are fish sellers. They buy from Prek Phnao market and sell the fish in a market located in Phnom Penh. They do not have their own shop within the market to sell their fish, and as a result, they must spend a lot of money on rental fees which makes it very difficult to support their family. 

They want to buy their own space at the market, but they do not have enough money. Therefore, Lyheng is asking for a loan of $1,000.

loans.use: To purchase a space for a shop to sell fish.

loans.name: Abduhafiz

texts.ru: Абдухафиз проживает в городе Исфара. Ему 55 лет. Он женат, детей не имеет. Абдухафиз занимается торговлей на рынке. У него имеется торговая точка, где он продает фрукты и овощи. Этим видом деятельности занимается сем лет. Кредит берет для покупки яблок, винограда, груши и персиков.
texts.en: Abduhafiz lives in the city of Isfara.  He is 55 years old, married and has no children.  Abduhafiz is involved in retail sales at the market.  He has a retail outlet, where he sells fruits and vegetables.  He has been involved in this business for seven years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of apples, grapes, pears and peaches.

loans.use: to purchase apples, grapes, pears and peaches

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua is divorced and has 5 children. She sells fruits such as pineapple, water melon and others at Elmina, which she has done for 10 years. The income she makes from the sale of the fruits is used to take care of her children. Efua will use the loan to procure more fruits to sell. With the new profits from her extended business, Efua plans to plough back into her business.

loans.use: buy fruits

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a married woman with six children. Five of her children attend school and one is still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past eight years, she has operated a business selling second hand clothes at retail to her neighbors and passersby. In addition, she has a food stall business, which contributes to her other source of income. Umazi dreams of expanding her business in the future. 

With the KSHS 40,000, she wants to purchase bundles of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shoes and various items to re-sell

loans.name: Mahdya

texts.en:
Mahdya is a 43-year-old woman. She is married and has three sons and two daughters; her husband is employed in a center with a decent salary. 

Mahdya has a project of making packaged food for sale such as cheese, dairy products, olives, etc. She wants to purchase more bottles and wrapping materials to increase her production, but she hasn't enough money , so she needs to take a loan from FATEN. When she gets the loan, which will be repaid on a monthly basis, she will purchase bottles and wrapping materials that she needs to increase her production and increase her sales. This will improve her income and enable her to live in better conditions with her family. Mayada is photographed in the FATEN branch.

loans.use: To purchase bottles and wrapping materials.

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es: El Sr. Paulino es casado tiene 48 años de edad,  vive con su esposa y dos hijos en una casa de interés social que adquirió desde hace doce años y que aun le siguen descontando vía nomina. Cuando Paulino inicio a pagar su casa siempre lo hizo pensando en que era el patrimonio de su esposa e hijos, que si el algún día llegara a faltar no se quedaría desamparados; desde ese entonces el le ha ido haciendo mejoras a su vivienda como los colocación de vitropiso, protecciones en las ventanas, pintura al interior y exterior de su vivenda, levantar barda y algunas otras mejoras que son visibles. El Sr. Paulino solicita el apoyo para compra de herrería y colocar un portón metálico al frente de su domicilio; este portón le dará una bonita fachada a su casa pero lo mas importante ofrecerá seguridad a su familia cuando el no se encuentre en casa.
texts.en: Sr. Paulino is married and is 48 years old. He lives with his wife and two children in a social interest house that he acquired two years ago and that he still pays for at a discounted rate. When Paulino began to pay for his house he always did so thinking that it was also the property of his wife and children, and that if one day something were to happen to him they would not be left homeless. Since then, he has made continual improvements to his home such as putting up flooring, window protection, painting the interior and exterior, putting up fences, and other visible improvements. Sr. Paulino is asking for help to purchase ironworks and put a metal door on the front of his home. It will give a nice outward appearance to the home but the most important is that it will offer security to his family when he is not at home.

loans.use: to put a metal door on his hosue

loans.name: Holger Gonzalo

texts.es:
Holger Gonzalo tiene 51 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene dos hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos de 15 y 25 años de edad en el Cantón Chillanes provincia de Bolívar.
LA VRC SAN JOSE, está conformada por 21 socios y socias se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia San José del Tambo a 60 minutos de la oficina. Esta Ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz, plátano, cacao y naranja.

Holger se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, plátano, cacao las compras y las ventas las realiza en la Parroquia San José del Tambo. Solicita el Crédito para comprar semillas, insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.

El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque podrá mejorar la calidad de vida y el producto.
 Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentes son: la competencia, vías de comunicación y las plagas. El sueño es que los hijos culminen los estudios.
Se considera una persona sencillo, puntual,  colaborador,  muy tranquilo y trabajador.
texts.en: Holger Gonzalo is 51 years old and lives with his common-law wife and two children of 15 and 25 years of age in Chillanes canton in Bolívar province. The San José communal bank is made up of 21 men and women and is located in the San José del Tambo parish, one hour from the Cooperativa San José office. The members of this communal bank do short cycle planting of corn, plantains, cocoa, and oranges. Holger plants corn, plantains and cocoa. He does his buying and selling in the San José del Tambo parish. He requests the loan in order to purchase seeds and agricultural supplies such as urea, herbicide, fertilizers and weedkiller to keep his crops in good condition. The loan will be of much help because he will be able to improve the quality of his life and his produce. The challenges that he often faces are competition, road conditions and pests. His dream is that his children finish their studies. He is considered to be modest, punctual, supportive, very peaceful and hardworking.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and agricultural supplies such as urea, weedkiller, fertilizers and herbicide.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Maricel requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Maricel has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future, Maricel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en:
Jaime's priority in life is to make his family more economically stable. He is 41 years old and widowed. He has two children who are attending school. In the absence of his wife, he serves as both father and mother to his children. To make a living, he plants and harvest rice. He usually earns about PHP 20,000 every six months.

He needs to improve his crop production so he is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy pesticides and insecticides to ensure good crop production. He wants to increase the sales of his crops in order to provide a good education for his two children.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and insecticides to ensure good crop production

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
La señora Ángela  tiene  cincuenta y cuatro años de edad, es una señora trabajadora  desde pequeña empezó a trabajar, lo que más le gusta de su negocio es acodar su ropa, ofrece sus servicios en su casa ya que todavía no cuenta  con un local.
También se dedica a la venta de chichorones, sabritas, refrescos y dulces.
Tiene un hijo es viuda ya que su esposo murió hace  tres años  pero gracias a dios pudo superar su perdida y salir adelante para enfrentar la vida  y aprovechar las cosas buenas.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de  más ropa como es vestido para niñas y vestidos para señoras.
Le da las gracias a fundación por el apoyo que le ha dado para salir adelante y triunfar en el futuro.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ángela, 54, has been a hard worker all her life and started working when she was quite young. What she most enjoys about her business is folding the clothing. She sells from home because she does not have another location yet.
She also sells pork rinds, Sabrita snacks, pop, and candy.
She has one child and is a widow. Her husband died three years ago, but thanks to God she has been able to move past this loss, face life head on, and see the good.
She requested this loan for the purchase of more clothing, especially children's and women's clothing.
She is grateful to the Fundacion for this support so that she can get ahead and triumph in the future.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Keatha

texts.en:
Keatha (pictured here) and his wife, Naren, live in a village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have two young sons.

The couple has been farming for five years. They grow rice and vegetables. In addition, Keatha is a fisherman. 

Keatha is applying for a loan in the amount of $500 to buy seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides to maintain his farm and pay for plowing fees.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides to maintain his rice and vegetable farm and pay for plowing fees

loans.name: Dionicio

texts.en:
Dionicio is 55 years old and married with three children. He is a loving and hardworking person. Dionicio has grown rice for the past 25 years. At first, he found it difficult to work on the land, because it requires a lot of patience, a strong body, and, of course financial resources. But as he began to farm, he gradually got used to the work and added a plot of land to grow rice.

Dionicio is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan to buy seed, fertilizer, and tractor fuel to increase his crop production. He wants to provide a better life for his children and be able to feed them well. He continues to move forward to achieve his dream of having a comfortable life. Dionicio hopes that his loan will result in a more a more productive farm and that he will be able to continue his business and improve his lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizers, and tractor fuel

loans.name: Annabel

texts.en:
Annabel is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with two children. Annabel has a retail shop that sells clothes like shirts and blouses, and also blankets and curtains. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos to buy stock of clothes to sell.

Annabel is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Annabel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of clothes to sell

loans.name: Alcira Del Socorro

texts.es: Alcira es una emprendedora que se dedica  a la venta de comida, es madre de dos hijos, casada, esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace un año. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como plátano, aceite, leña, carne de pollo, papas, zanahoria, queso, ingrediente, vinagre etc.
texts.en: Alcira is an entrepreneur who sells food. She is married, the mother of two children, and has been doing this work for a year. She will use the loan to buy supplies and ingredients such as plantains, cooking oil, firewood, chicken, potatoes, carrots, cheese, vinegar and other ingredients.

loans.use: To buy supplies and ingredients such as plantains, cooking oil, firewood, chicken, potatoes, carrots, cheese, vinegar and other ingredients.

loans.name: Jhonny

texts.es: El Sr. Jhonny tiene 27 años de edad, es de estado civil soltero pero convive con Lucía (en la foto el Sr. Jhonny y su esposa Lucía), tienen dos hijos bajo su dependencia, actualmente se dedica al servicio de taxi trabajando por los alrededores de la ciudad, por esto él no puede ni siquiera ir al medio día a compartir un almuerzo con su familia.   Él quiere ingresar a una línea de taxis, para tener más seguridad en cuanto a los delincuentes, ya que  es bastante peligroso por los lugares en que trabaja, pues así tendrá mejor control y mayores ingresos, ya que la gente que sube a su automóvil se sentirá más segura de que es una línea conocida y así no corren el riesgo de sufrir robos u otros inconvenientes, además que por pertenecer a  estos sindicatos les dan otro tipo de beneficios a los conductores; esas son las razones por la que solicita este crédito y de esta manera pueda aminorar riesgos y mejorar su estatus de vida.
texts.en:
Jhonny is twenty-seven years old and is legally single, although he lives with Lucía (Jhonny and his partner Lucía are pictured in the photo).  They have two children in their care.  He is presently making a living by offering a taxi service in the areas surrounding the city; it is for this reason that he cannot return home at midday to share the lunch meal with his family.

He wants to join an official taxi company in order to have more security in regard to offenders; it is very dangerous in the areas where he works.  In joining, he will have better control and greater income; the people who get into his automobile will feel more safe being in a recognized taxi, thereby not running the risk of suffering robbery or other inconveniences.  Additionally, these companies give other types of benefits to their drivers.

These are the reasons that he is requesting this loan, and in doing this, he will be able to reduce his risks and improve his life status.
