loans.use: to become part of an official taxi service company.

loans.name: Gloria Maribel

texts.es:
Gloria, de 43 años de edad, no pudo estudiar, es madre soltera de tres hijos y vive en casa familiar.

Gloria, desde hace muchos años se dedico a vender frutas, porque el padre de sus hijos la abandonó cuando estaban pequeños ella se ha dedicado a la venta de frutas, el lugar donde vende es en la parada de buses que van a la ciudad, además vende ropa en varios cantones de su domicilio.
 
Gloria, necesita el préstamo para comprar más variedad de ropa, porque en está temporada se vende más, de esa manera lograra tener una mejor calidad de vida.

Gloria, sueña con tener las fuerzas necesarias para seguir apoyando a su madre, porque ella es de avanzada edad.

loans.use: para comprar más variedad de ropa.

loans.name: Karema

texts.en:
Karema is 23 years old and a mother of 7 children,living in District 2 in Kabul, Afghanistan.

She already passed a 1st and 2nd loan cycle and continuing with her 3rd loan cycle she has been able to set up a beauty shop in her home area.

The shop requires stock to cater for customers' needs and to buy hair braids, weaves and wigs. Therefore she decided to take a loan from AFSG who believe that her business will increase and she will be able to pay her children's school fee.

loans.use: To buy hair weaves, braids and cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: VIctor would like to invest in machinery to assist his rice farm

loans.name: Cruz

texts.en:
Mrs. Cruz is the owner of a store in which she sells all sorts of general supplies. She works at her store from 6am to 10pm. Her business has been run out of her home for 12 years. She began her business with some money her husband gave her and she began to buy products little by little, and even though she is located near a market, she has seen a constant increase in business.

Mrs. Cruz needs a loan in order to purchase more supplies, as her store sees rapid sales, furthermore, she would like to be able to sell to certain loyal customers on credit, and she also hopes to attract more customers.

Mrs. Cruz is 60 years old, married and has 9 children, all of whom are indpendent. Her husband is a steel-worker and vender, who helps with the household expenses. She also enjoys the help of her children. Her home is clean, well adapted and made of a variety of construction material. She hopes to work and to grow in all possible ways with us and through which improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

La señora Cruz es propietaria de una tienda ella vende todo tipo de víveres en general. Ella atiende en su negocio desde las 6am a 10pm. Su negocio funciona en su domicilio hace 12 años. Ella atiende desde las 6am a 10pm. Ella inicio su negocio con un dinero que su esposo le dio. y empezó a comprar poco a poco productos y con la constancia que ha tenido a pesar de estar ubicado cerca del mercado su negocio esta en marcha.

Doña Cruz necesita de un préstamo para poder comprar mas víveres, ya que su negocio tiene buen movimiento, además que desea poder veder a crédito a ciertos clientes fieles que ella tiene hace mucho tiempo, adicionalmente quiere captar mas clientes.

La señora Cruz tiene 60 años es casada, tiene 9 hijos, todos son independientes y su esposo es albañil y comerciante quien le ayuda con los gastos del hogar. Ella además recibe la ayuda de sus hijos. La casa en la que vive es propia, la esta adecuando, es de construcción mixta. Ella desea trabajar y crecer en todos los aspectos con nosotros y así mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies.

loans.name: Ochaoy

texts.en:
Ochaoy is a pretty old woman. She has 7 children and 4 grandchildren. She is a pensioner, but she does not want to sit at home. She has her own stall in the Kistakuz market, in Khujand.

Ochaoy sells children's clothes and the national headdress, which she embroiders herself. Her sons help her bring the goods from Istaravshan, Khujand. She has little profit, but she loves her activity. She has many customers, and sells her goods quickly.

In the autumn, she wants to purchase warm children clothes to sell, and she requests $300 for this purpose.

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Segujja

texts.en:
Segujja owns a newspaper sales business. He is a very friendly man and everyone in Kayunga knows who Sequjja is. He has received other loans which have helped him  purchase larger quantities of newspapers.  He has also been able to place his newspapers in various trading centers through out Kayunga. 
Segujja is also a resourceful salesman, as he also collects old newspapers and resells them to a recycler to turn into paper bags.
Over the past two years, Segujja has received several loans and has been able to repay them on time. He would like a new loan so he can expand his business. He plans on opening other locations in neighboring towns.

loans.use: To buy more newspapers, to increase his sales locations.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
One time, when Roberto went out to the streets looking for a job, he found a business in which they made socks and the person in charge let him pick up left over socks. When he took them home and noticed that they had small defects, missing seams. Roberto's wife fixed them and started selling them in a roving market, and using what was left over to stuff pillows they handmade themselves. Little by little they became known as sellers of socks and pillows and he would like to see their business keep growing.

The interesting thing is that he now knows how to make these socks. That is why he is requesting a loan for US $1,150 to be paid in a period of 3 months. With this money he will be able to buy more socks and buy more merchandise to keep making and selling socks and have more variety to offer to his clients. With your help, Roberto will be able to support his family and overcome the hardship they suffered when Roberto didn't have a job.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer

En una ocasión cuando Roberto salía a las calles a buscar trabajo encontró un negocio en dónde hacen calcetas y el encargado le dio oportunidad de levantar los retazos de las calcetas y las llevó a su casa y notó que tenían un pequeño defecto, les faltaban unas costuras, la esposa de Roberto las remendó y empezó a venderlas, en un mercado rodante y con lo que no se puede reparar lo utilizan para el relleno de almohadas que fabrican ellos mismos. Poco a poco se está dando a conocer como un vendedor de calcetines y almohadas, y desea que su negocio siga creciendo.

Lo interesante es que ya aprendió la manera en que se hacen estos calcetines. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $1,150 para pagarlos en un plazo de 3 meses y con este dinero podrá comprar más calcetines y comprar más mercancía para poder seguir haciendo y/o vendiendo calcetines y tener más variedad para su clientela. Con tu ayuda Roberto podrá sacar a su familia adelante y superar las penas que pasaron cuando Roberto no tenía trabajo.

loans.use: Buying more merchandise and raw material to have more variety in his business.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
This is 38 year-old Catherine K..  She is a nurse by profession and a pharmacist by trade.  Earlier this year, she opened her pharmacy in order to supplement her nurse’s salary.  It was a wise decision as she is able to use her knowledge and experience from nursing to efficiently manage stock and provide excellent customer service.  Catherine now requires a loan of $900 to purchase additional stock and continue building her business.  She is married to her husband, Timothy, with whom she has three children - Morice, aged 12, and twins, Tumaini and Neeema, aged 6.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facilities as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing.  Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus, they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets.  This leads to poor financial support, which is turn leads to poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys from and leases equipment to women.  Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from the said client extending a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment – a process called a "sale and leaseback arrangement".

loans.use: To purchase additonal stock for her recently established pharmacy.

loans.name: Romoke

texts.en: "LAPO has been a source of financial strength to my business," says Mrs. Romoke O., who lives in Shibiri in Lagos State, Nigeria. A mother of 4, 35 years old, she sells foodstuffs and has been in business since 1999. She needs a loan of $450 to buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Heydarali

texts.en: Heydarali A. is a 33-year-old trader who sells cloths in Fatalikend village of Saatli region. He started his business in 2005. Heydarali is married and has three children. He has applied for $1200 USD  to diversify the clothes he sells.

loans.use: Going to diversify clothes he sells

loans.name: Zevar

texts.en: U. Zevar has been a client of MicroInvest since 2007 and is engaged in the home business of raising and selling livestock and milk products. She is married and has 9 children who help her take care of the animals. With years of experience, she is applying for a business development loan of $625 for 8 months to purchase a pedigree bull.

loans.use: To purchase a pedigree bull.

loans.name: Shoub

texts.en: Shoub lives in district 17 of Kabul, Afghanistan.He is married and he has a carpentry shop in a busy place In Kabul. He has a good number of clients; people love his work. He need to complete his stock so he has requested an individual loan to complete his carpentry stock so as to make good monthly income for his family.  He is happy to be able to help them better.

loans.use: To complete his carpentry stock

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca F. sells food items at the market in her village in Ghana. She is married and has seven dependents, including her own children.  While her business is doing very well, she sees the opportunity to increase her sales by maintaining a larger inventory of goods.  Therefore, Rebecca is requesting a loan of $275 to purchase more goods for resale.

loans.use: To buy more goods for resale.

loans.name: Las Tres Estrellas/the Three Stars Group

texts.es:
Group composed of 13 people and 100% of them are women. The name of the group is THE THREE STARS, the women live in the zone of Villa Ingenio. The women carry out various activities; some of them are butchers, others have their stores in the street. The women have known one another for 36 months and are very friendly and supportive of eachother. The president of the group, Mrs. Rosario, has two children and she sells lights to carry to the Yungas region, in particular to Chulumani. Her husband’s name is Israel. The treasurer is Mrs Jannette, she sells detergents in zone 16 of Julio, she has 2 children. The secretary, Mrs. Juana has a carpentry where she works together with her husband Esteban. The group is well consolidated with all the women working before with other entities and for that reason they are well known.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva volunteer.

Grupo conformado por 13 personas 100 % son mujeres. El nombre del grupo es LAS TRES ESTRELLAS, las señoras viven en la zona D. Villa Ingenio. Las señoras realizan diferentes actividades algunas son carniceras, otras tienen sus tiendas D. barrio. Las señoras se conocen hace 36 meses ellas son muy compañeras y solidarias. La sra. Rosario es la presidenta del grupo tiene 2 hijos ella venD. focos lleva a los Yungas exactamente a Chulumani, su esposo se llama Israel. La tesorera Dña. Jannette, venD. detergentes en la zona 16 D. Julio, tiene dos niños. La secretaria Dña. Juana tiene su carpintería en el cual trabaja juntamente con su esposo Esteban. El Grupo esta bien consolidado ellas anteriormente trabajaron con otras entidades y por lo cual se conocen muy bien.

loans.use: CAPITAL FOR OPERATIONAL COSTS

loans.name: Violeta

texts.es:
Violeta belongs to the bank Banco Comunal “Solidaridad”, her home is located in Jr: libertad Nº 1182, District of Calleria, Department of Ucayali. She’s 47 years old and is the mother of 4 children, 3 older children, and 1 underage child. She is married and her husband is a teacher. Violeta with the goal of feeling like a sense of accomplishment hopes to take secure a loan from Manuela Ramos in the amount of 300 Soles (Peruvian currency) to sell ice. She currently has 2 refrigerators to sell ice and since she is close to the market, the salespeople are her clients. As additional income she rents out her mini-gym. Violeta wakes up at 5 am to get ready for the day, with her husband, because she also works as advocate for Pronoi, an educational center. She returns at 1 pm to begin work in her business. With this loan of 1,300 Soles, which will be repaid in 5 months, she will buy a thousand bags and will fix her freezer, which is in need of repair due to the high demand. Violeta is very happy because she started slowly, and her biggest wish is to make her business larger and be a great businesswoman. This is why she is very grateful to Manuela Ramos, who has given her the opportunity to secure a credit for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Sandy Juárez, Kiva volunteer.

Violeta pertenece al Banco Comunal “Solidaridad”, su domicilio esta ubicado Jr: libertad Nº 1182, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 47 años y es madre de 4 hijos 3 adultos y 1menor de edad, está casada y su esposo es docente (profesor). Violeta con la finalidad de sentirse realizada decide hacer un préstamo a Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 para vender hielo. En la actualidad cuenta con 2 refrigeradoras para vender sus hielos ya que esta cerca al mercado y los vendedores son sus clientes. Así mismo alquila su mini gimnasio, es otro ingreso más. Violeta tiene que levantarse a las 5.00 a.m. para alistarse juntamente con su esposo porque también trabaja como promotora de Pronoi (Centro educativo), esta de regreso a la 1:00pm lista para atender su negocio. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,300 soles, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 1 millar de bolsas e invirtirá en la reparación de su congelador pues, es necesario darle mantenimiento por la mucha demanda que tiene. Violeta esta muy contenta, por que empezó de poco a poco y su mas grande deseo es ampliar su negocio y ser una gran empresaria, por ello esta muy agradecida a Manuela Ramos que le brindo la oportunidad a un crédito para su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase plastic bags and to fix a freezer.

loans.name: Chien

texts.vi:
Chị Võ Thị Chiên 35 tuổi kinh tế gia đình chị thuộc hộ khá trong địa phương, chồng chị đi xuất khẩu lao động tại Bỉ. Chị ở nhà vừa làm ruộng vừa làm nghề xay xát lúa gạo. Chị tham gia Quỹ năm 2000 vốn vay ban đầu chị vay 2.000.000đ chị đầu tư vốn vào nghề hàng xáo, công việc buôn bán của chị phát triển dần dần chị đã tích lũy được sô tiền tiết kiệm kết hợp với vay vốn của Quỹ chị đã mua máy xát gạo phục vụ nghề hàng sáo của chị và làm dịch vụ xay xát tại địa phương. Thu nhập từ kinh doanh gạo và xay xát hàng tháng là 4.000.000đ. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 10.000.000đ đầu tư vào mua thóc.
Thu nhập bình quân. 5.000.000đ/ tháng.
texts.en:
Ms. V. Thi Chien is 35 years old. Her family's income is considered fair in her local area. Her husband is a laborer in the town of Bi. She stays home to work in the rice field and also in rice milling. She joined TYM fund in 2000. Her first loan was 125.00 USD and she invested in rice milling. Her business expanded gradually. With her own savings and combined with a loan from the fund, she purchased a rice milling machine for her business as well as to start a commercial rice milling business in the local region. Income from her rice sales and rice milling business averages 250 USD per month. For this loan, she wishes to borrow 625.00 USD to invest in buying rice seeds. Her average income is 312.50 USD per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Services

loans.name: Marcelline

texts.fr: Dame S. Marcelline est née le 11 juin 1970 à Adjarra, dans le département de l'Ouémé. Elle est mère de 03 enfants, Isaac 18 ans, Enock 15 ans et Sonia 10 ans, tous scolarisés. Elle vend des produits de beautés et des pâtes dentifrices qu'elle achète du Nigeria un pays voisin. Elle vient solliciter ce prêt de 150 000 pour augmenter son stock de produits de beauté et pour couvrir toute la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Ms. Marcelline S. was born on June 11, 1970 in Adjarra, in the county of Ouémé. She is the mother of three children: Isaac, age 18, Enock, age 15, and Sonia, age 10, who are all in school. She sells beauty products and toothpaste that she buys from Nigeria, a neighboring country. She has come to request this loan of 150,000 francs to increase her stock of beauty products and to meet all the demands of her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 10 boxes of Fair Light lotions and 25 boxes of Coco Butter creams

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.es:
Doña Enriqueta Sèpez P.  se dedica  a la  venta de regalos  y de ropa para niños, asi como sabanas y cubre camas, desde hace 7 años.
Actualmente su negocio  lo tiene en su casa para que ella y su esposo puedan atender el negocio. Ella esta solicitando un crédito para comprar más mercadería; como trastos, ropa para niños y de cama, animalitos de peluche, toallas, etc.  porque ya se acerca la época navideña y es allí ella aprovecha a vender más. También en su negocio se dedica a la venta de papel de china que en esta época tiene bastante demanda en el sector ya que es utilizado para la elaboración de barriletes, y también barriletes ya terminados.


Ella desea que su negocio crezca, y con este capital va incrementar las ventas que ya tiene y podrá cumplir con lo que sus clientes piden.  Ella y  su esposo también se dedican a la agricultura de maíz y fríjol lo cual les ayuda a obtener otros ingresos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Enriqueta Sèpez P. works selling gifts and clothing for children, including selling items like sheets and bedspreads. She has been in this business for 7 years. Currently the business is located in her home so that she and her husband can tend it conveniently. She is asking for credit in order to purchase more merchandise, including things like dishes, stuffed animals, towels, bed covers, and clothing for children, etc. The Christmas season is approaching and Enriqueta would like to take advantage of the opportunity to sell more items. Her business also specializes in selling kites as well as tissue paper which is in high demand during the holidays since it is used for making kites.

Enriqueta wants her business to grow, and with a loan she will increase her sales and provide the products that her clients request. She and her husband also obtain additional income by growing corn and beans.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of toys and gifts for sale

loans.name: Anith

texts.es: Anith tiene 35 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos que cursan estudios primarios y secundarios, vive con su conviviente, quien le brinda su apoyo incondicional. Ella brinda  servicios de costura para niños y adultos en ambos géneros desde hace 5 años atrás. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es quedar bien con sus clientes y que estos se sientan satisfechos de su buena labor. Esta actividad le es rentable porque cuenta con una gama de clientes que aprecian mucho su trabajo, además es una persona que satisface los gustos diversos. Lo difícil, es no contar con un taller adecuado. Es su 7mo préstamo en MFP. Con el dinero que solicita quiere mandar a construir un taller textil, como también quiere comprar vitrinas para exponer sus trabajos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Anith, 35, is the mother of 2 school-aged children. She lives with her partner who supports her unconditionally. She makes clothes for both children and adults, a business she's operated for 5 years. The part of her job that she likes best is proving a good service to her customers and seeing how satisfied they are with her work. The business is profitable because she can depend on a range of customers who fully appreciate her work and because she's a person who can meet various demands. The hard part for her is that she doesn't have adequate workspace for the business. This is her 7th loan from MFP. With the loan that she's requested, she wants to build a workshop and buy display cases so that she show her work to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a workshop.

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Sorn S., 32, is married and lives with her husband and five of her children in Prey Veng, Cambodia. She and her husband are farm workers. They normally hire an individual grower to plow their farmland. On average, this couple earns a combined US$ 2 a day. All of their children are students.

Sorn S. would like to request a loan of US$ 500 to purchase a grinding mill to service the people in the village for additional profit to help support their family. (Sorn S. is pictured with her husband and two children.)

loans.use: To purchase a grinding mill to use to earn extra revenue

loans.name: Mr. Sophat Orm Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Seventeen people in Thnal village in Kampong Chhnang province make up the group that will receive this village bank loan, and all the members will use the loan for different purposes. Mr. Sophat O. is the village bank president. He is a firewood seller in the local village. Since this business is going well, he wants to expand it, so he decided to ask for a loan to buy more firewood to resell. His wife, Mrs. Su Srey, is a farmer who has to 0.5 hectares to cultivate rice to earn a living. Mr. Sophat O. is 34 years old and the father of three children who all attend the local school. Group members Mrs. Sokhen O. and Mrs. KH. O. are not taking a loan themselves, but their husbands are, so their husbands are presented in the picture instead.     

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Fourteen members have end-of-term loans, and the rest have monthly payment loans. Group members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. These allow people to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09%, and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more firewood to resell

loans.name: Oliver Sendiwanyo  ‘S Group

texts.en:
Oliver is the leader of a five member group. She is 40 years old and married with five children, who are between five and twenty. All her children go to school. She takes care of no additional family members. She resides in a rented three-roomed house in which eight people stay. They have electricity but no piped water at home. The family gets three meals a day.

Oliver works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala. She operates a retail shop at her home in Mengo Mackay, which is one of the city suburbs. She works seven days a week and uses public transport to and from shopping. She sells to an average of 20 customers a day and to all categories of people.

She is faced with the challenge of transportation during the rainy season and defaulting her would-be customers. Oliver has been in this business for the last seven years and has been in MCDT for two years, now servicing her tenth loan and working all along with the same group mates. Oliver’s monthly expenses include school fees, feeding her family, and paying rent for the home. She wants to use this loan to buy a refrigerator to sell cold drinks.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Inn

texts.en: Inn L., 33, lives with her husband in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Since 2003, she has been raising pigs and selling them to the market to earn approximately $4 a day. Her husband stays at home and helps her raise the pigs. This couple has five children, three of whom are in school and two who are at home. Mrs. Inn L. is asking for a loan to breed more pigs and purchase feed.

loans.use: Buy pigs and feed

loans.name: Oscar Carlos

texts.es: El Sr. Oscar es un cliente conocido por la institución, hasta ahora ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad en el pago de sus cuotas. Se dedica a la venta de zapatos deportivos, labor que realiza en la ciudad de El Alto, Bolivia; con este trabajo mantiene a su pequeña familia que esta compuesta por él, su señora y sus dos pequeños hijos, quienes aun están en edad escolar. Vive en una humilde casa alejada de la ciudad. Tiene un problema físico, que encara de manera poositiva con el apoyo de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Oscar is well known at this lending institution. In the past he has demonstrated punctuality in repaying his loans. Oscar sells athletic shoes in the city of El Alto, Bolivia. With this business he covers the expenses of his small family, which consists of himself, his wife, and their two small children, who have just become old enough to attend school. He lives in a humble home outside of the city. Oscar has a physical handicap, which he faces with a positive attitude and help from his entire family.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increased capital

loans.name: Botobagnim

texts.fr: Monsieur P. réside dans le quartier de d’agoè assiyéyé, il  est célibataire et lutte fort pour gagner sa vie, ainsi il a ouvert depuis 2007 une boutique de vente de produits d’alimentation générale, il a appelé sa boutique " ETS VENEZ VOIR". Il a une très bonne façon d’accueillir sa clientèle ce qui lui permet d’attirer de jour en jour des clients. Le stock de marchandises dont il dispose actuellement ne lui  permet pas de répondre à la demande de sa clientèle. Il sollicite de WAGES un prêt pour acheter des boîtes de conserve, des cartes de recharges, 10 sacs de riz et 10 bidons d’huile de 25 litres.
texts.en:
Mr. P. lives in the neighbourhood of Agoè Assiyéyé. He is single and works hard to make a living. In 2007 he opened a general food store which he called "Venez voir" ["Come See"]. He has a very good manner with his customers which allows him to gain new customers daily. He does not currently have enough stock to satisfy the demand of his customers. He is asking WAGES for a loan to buy canned goods, prepaid phone cards, 10 bags of rice and 10 25-litre drums of oil.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy general foodstuffs

loans.name: Armando

texts.es: El señor Armando B. ha tenido ya un crédito con FVP el cual fue para poner el piso en su casa, desea nueva mente un préstamo para poder poner las protecciones en las ventas de la vivienda ya que el trabaja casi todo el día y su familia se queda solo y quiere la seguridad para ellos. Planea pagar el crédito con los ingresos de su trabajo como empleado de mantenimiento de un hotel. (Cuando se realizo la visita a la casa del señor Armando el no se encontraba la persona que nos atendió fue su esposa la señora Carmen Patricia Jaime quien ha parece en la foto.)
texts.en:
Mr. Armando B. has had a loan with FVP which was for the purpose of putting a floor in his house. He now wants a loan to be able to put bars on the windows of his living quarters now that he works nearly all day and his family stays there alone, and he wants security for them. He plans to pay the loan with income from his work as a maintenance man at a hotel. (When we made our visit to Mr. Armando’s house we did not we did not find him. The person who attended to us was his wife, Mrs. Carmen Patricia Jaime, who appears in the photograph.)

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Installation of bars on the windows of the house

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es:
El señor Jesús L. ya ha tenido tres créditos con FVP los cuales ha pagado puntual mente. 
Ahora está solicitando nueva mente un préstamo ya que no cuneta con el dinero necesario para pagar la mensualidad de la escuela de su hijo, se la están requiriendo para que puede terminar el ciclo escolar de esté años.
texts.en:
Sr. Jesus Lopez has borrowed from FVP three times before and has repaid each of the loans on time. He's now applying for a new loan because he doesn't have enough money to pay his son's school fees for the coming term, an expense that he has to pay so that his son can finish the school year.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay school fees for coming term.

loans.name: Wiliamo José

texts.pt:
Wiliamo nasceu em Namaacha uma vila na fronteira de Swazilândia,tem 27 anos de idade e vive maritalmente. E pai de uma filha de 6 anos de idade que se encontra a frequentar a 2 classe.

Wiliamo passou momentos de muitas dificuldades devido a falta de condições dos seus progenitores, então a sua irmã mais velha convida lhe para morar com ela na Swazilândia. Após sua chegada ele inicia com os estudos naquele país e quando já fazia a 3ª classe seu pai manda lhe buscar alegando que o filho não podia viver longe do seu irmão gêmio. Chegado a Namaacha ele consegue ingressar na escola e faz a 10ª classe, devido a sua dedicação na escola  ele é solicitado para trabalhar na rádio comunitaria das cascatas situada na escola secundária como locutor no periodo da tarde das 18:00h as 20:00h auferindo um valor de  1.500.00mt mensalmente. Anos depois entra num projecto de exploração de mel local que foi finaciado pelo governo do distrito de Namaacha  um fundo no valor de 125.000.00mt num grupo de 6 pessoas reembolsando em cada 3 meses um valor de 12.000.00mt  num periodo de 11 mesês mas ele não conseguiu alcançar as suas expectativas devido as mas condições climáticas que se faziam centir, entao aproxima se a hluvuku solicitando um emprestimo no valor de 15.000.00mt para iniciar com seu negócio pessoal de venda de mel adquirido em Inhambane e revendido em Namaacha, tem comprado por viagem 80litros de mel a 150 cada, e revende a 120 o litro tendo assim um lucru mensal de 6.000.00mt  para alem da sua filha wiliamo responsabiliza se pela sua mãe que vive com ela em sua casa.

Este é o terceiro empréstimo de wiliamo na hluvuku e primeiro com kiva. Estes os dois primeiros foram usados para comprar produtos de primeira necessidade para revenda e estes 15.000.00mt seram usados para recomeçar um novo negócio de venda de mel nas comunidades locais. Esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo determinado e pedir um novo emprestimo para reforçar o seu negócio.
texts.en:
Wiliamo was born in Namaacha, a town bordering Swaziland. He is a 27-year-old married man and has a 6-year-old daughter who is in the 2nd grade. Wiliamo has passed through some difficult times. When he was a child his older sister invited him to live with her in Swaziland. Upon his arrival he began his studies. While attending the 3rd grade his father sent for him, claiming his son could not live so far from his twin brother. When in Namaacha, he managed to enroll in school and later completed the 10th grade. Due to his hard work in school he is solicited for a job at the local community radio station located in the secondary school building as a radio announcer during the hours of 6-8 where he made 1500.00mt monthly. Years later he became involved with a local honey production venture financed by the Namaacha district government. The funding was valued at 125000.00mt for a group of 6 people who were reimbursed every 3 months at 12000.00mt during a period of 11 months. However he was not able to meet these expectations due to poor weather conditions. For this reason he solicits a loan worth 15000.00mt from Hluvuku in order to begin his own business acquiring honey from Inhambane and reselling it in Namaacha. Each trip he purchases 80 liters of honey and resells each liter at 120, obtaining a monthly profit of 6000.00mt. Along with his daughter, Wiliamo is responsible for the care of his mother with whom he resides. This is Wiliamo's third loan with Hluvuku and his first with Kiva. The first two were used to purchases products for resale. The current loan will be used to start a new business selling honey in local communities. He is very confident that he will pay back his loan before the deadline and that he will ask for a new loan to strengthen his business.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase and resell honey

loans.name: Chhin

texts.en:
Chhin A., age 23, is a villager who lives in Kompong Cham Province. She has given birth to one child who is of school-age.

In 2000, Chhin A. inherited a one-hectare (2.5-acre) farmland from her grandparents. On the farm she grows different kinds of vegetables, which she will cut and sell two months after she plants them. To alleviate her hard physical labor, her husband assists her in the process.

Due to the fact that the water system is far from the farmland, Chhin A. is applying for a loan to buy a pumping machine for irrigation.

loans.use: To buy a pumping machine for irrigation

loans.name: Melania

texts.en:
Melania P. is engaged in a food vending business. She is 51 years old this year and has two children.

Melania cooks and earns reasonable profit from what she sells to the neighborhood. In addition to food, she also raises pigs. The income that she gets from her business is what she uses to buy the basic needs of the family as well as for house repair.

Knowing the various services of Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI), she requests a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase additional ingredients for her food business.

CEVI helps her to better sustain her livelihood. She receives not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Saima Muhammad Manzoor Group

texts.en:
Saima baji is the wife of M. M., who is a driver by profession. They both are a citizens of  Lahore, Pakistan, where they have lived for the past 10 years. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and Punjabi foods. Saima baji is a very hardworking lady. She is a seamstress and sews clothes for her neighbors. She has been involved in this business for more than three years. Her works gives her confidence to lead an independent life. She saves her income in a committee and plans to renovate her house with the committee amount. She is applying for a loan to repair her husband’s vehicle named Shahzore so that he is able to continue his work and earn income.

This group loan consists of three additional people: Sajida baji wants a loan to buy material (colored thread, tools) for a carpet-weaving business. Humaira baji wants a loan to buy clothes to sell. Shazia baji wants a loan to buy scrap for her scrap business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible. 

Note: Saima baji is seated in front of the sewing machine and sewing clothes.

loans.use: To repair a vehicle

loans.name: Bahtiyor

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan
  Наврузову Бахтиеру 41 лет. Имеет семью, четырёх детей. Его жена Эркабоева Замира хозяйничает и помогает мужу по бизнесу. Бахтиёр занимается торговлей на местном базаре в Джабборрасуловском районе. Продаёт продукты питания, закупает товар раз в неделю у поставщиков и фирм в городе по оптовой цене. Бахтиёр   тоже считается оптовиком в своём районе и старается расширить свой товарооборот. Он сотрудничает с Микроинвест несколько лет и получил уже кредит несколько раз, ему понравилось наша услуга и он до сих пор пользуется им. Бахтиёр благодарен Микроинвесту за финансовую поддержку
texts.en:
Bahtiyor N. is 41 years old. He has a family and four children. His wife, Zamira Aerkaboeva, takes care of the household and helps her husband with the business. Bahtiyor is involved in sales at a local market in the Jabbor-Rasulov district. He sells food products and buys his products in the city once per week from suppliers and firms at wholesale prices. Bahtiyor is also considered a wholesaler in his district and tries to increase his product turnover. He has been cooperating with MicroInvest for several years and obtained credit several times already. He liked our service, and he still uses it. Bahtiyor is grateful to MicroInvest for the financial support.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For wholesale purchase of food products

loans.name: Phot

texts.en:
Phot S. N. is thirty-three years old and married with three school-age children. She lives with her husband in Takeo Province. She is engaged in a weaving business, typically earning an income of $3 a day. Her husband also generates income for the family as a farmer, earning $2 a day.

The world's financial crisis has been difficult for businesses in Cambodia this past year. This factor has created a difficult economic year for much of the country, the Phot S. N.'s family included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of Cambodia's economic difficulties, N. is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of $700 to buy cows, a purchase that she sees as a great opportunity to produce maximum income and thus raise their standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase cows

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie V. is 44 years old and the mother of five children. Jasmin, 24, works as a sales lady, as does Adelfa, 22. Daisy, who is 14, is now in her third year of high school. John Carlo, 11, is studying in grade 4 of primary school, while John Vincent is only 4 years old. Rosemarie is married to Rogelio V., 48, who works as a farm laborer. According to Rosemarie, because of poverty her five children have suffered educationally, and some of them did not progress to college level.

When she became a member of Kiva field partner, Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI), Rosemarie hoped that her loan could be used to expand her farming business so that one day it would give her family enough income to cover their expenses. Most importantly she hoped to be able to pay for her children's education. Rosemarie hopes that her children will be able to finish their studies at college and obtain a degree to give them a better future. This is why she never stops finding ways to help her business grow. She is requesting a new loan for use as additional capital for her farming business. She will buy things to improve the farm such as fertilizers, insecticides, binhi or rice seed, and also use the loan to pay the laborers.

Rosemarie’s one hope and goal in life is to alleviate her family's poverty.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, insecticides, binhi or rice seed, and pay farm laborers

loans.name: Yusta

texts.en:
Yusta is a member of the Idope borrower group in Kinyanambo, Iringa. She is single and a mother of 2 children. Her children are 25,20 years old.She also cares for other 1 dependent.

Yusta has owned a shop business for 5 years, she works 10 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 100,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Yusta`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more shop commodities like rice, cooking oil etc.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Yusta hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more shop commodities

loans.name: Jamila's Group

texts.en:
(Jamila in the small photo; is also a part of the group although not in the group photo)
N. Jamila is a hard working and devoted lady with a business of selling nice plastics and sauce pans. She started 10 years ago selling plates, cups and saucepans and although there is a lot of competition, she is able to make 100,000/= a week from Buikwe trading centre. She is moving her path to success because of the loans, good customer care plus having quality products in her stock. Jamila has a dream of becoming a whole sale supplier plus educating all her children to the University level. She is married with 7 children aged 20 – 4 years and all in school as she takes care of her siblings. Jamila needs a loan to be able to add more capital into her business since most of the money she makes goes into school fees payments and food for home consumption.

loans.use: Buying more plastic cups, plates and sauce pans for resale.

loans.name: Zosimo

texts.en:
Zosimo L. is from the village of Tipolohon, Claveria, Misamis Oriental. He is 45 years old. Zosimo is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Zosimo owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Zosimo has been engaged in his business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Zosimo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Zosimo is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Zosimo from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mr. Ngoeurn Suon Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mr. Ngoeurn S. has been selected village bank president by the 13 members of the village bank loan. All the members live in Srel Duoch village in Takeo province and they all will use the loan for different purposes.

Mr. Ngoeurn S. is 43 years old and the father of two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other attends the local school.

He is a farmer who owns 2-hectar field of land to cultivate rice. His wife, Mrs. T. Sear, is a grocer who owns a grocery store. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it.

Thus, Mr. Ngoeurn S. decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery products to support his wife’s business.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products to support his wife’s business.

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Savoeun U. is a villager in Tuol Kandal village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 1.5 hectare field of land to cultivate rice for a living. She faces an obstacle with her plantation because her field has infertile soil; thus, she decided to ask for a loan to bU. fertilizers and pesticides for her crop. Her husband, Mr. Yu Sareourn, makes big pots to sell. This couple has two children: one attends the local school and the younger one is too young to work or study. 
Her husband is present on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for her crop

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en: Jihad has owned an aluminum shop since 2005, with a previous 15 years of experience in this market. He's 30 years old. He is asking for a loan of $1,200 to invest in buying more merchandise and appliances for his shop, to meet the demands of his clients.

loans.use: Buying more merchandise and appliances

loans.name: Saul

texts.es:
Sr.  Saul nacio en Santa Cruz su actividad principal es la agricultura trabaja junto con su familia en la siembra y cosecha y posterior comercializacion de sus productos, el trabaja todo el dia en el cultivo de sus productos.

El destino del crédito es para el cultivo de maíz, arroz y maní, el cliente esta agradecido con la instiyucion  por la oportunidad que se le brinda.
texts.en:
Sr. Saul was born in Santa Cruz. His main business activity is farming and he works with his family planting and harvesting crops to sell at market. He works all day caring for his crops.

Saul will use this loan for growing corn, rice, and peanuts. He is grateful to the Institution for being given this opportunity.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds

loans.name: Claudia Josefina

texts.es:
La señora Claudia Josefina A. ya ha tenido tres créditos con FVP los cuales ha pagado puntual mente.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder elaborar las bardas de su casa ya que tiene miedo que le pueda pasar algo a ella y a su pequeño hijo. 
Doña Claudia Josefina tiene ya más de seis años con su negocio de belleza, esta es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia ya que es madre soltera y quiere lo mejor. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias del negocio. 
La persona que aparece en la foto es una hermana que trabaja con la señora Claudia en el salon de belleza ya que cuando fuimos a la visita doña Claudia se encontraba haciendo las comprar de los productos que necesita para el negocio.
texts.en:
Señora Claudia Josefina A. has had three loans with FVP and repaid all punctually. She is seeking a loan to build a fence around her house because she is afraid that something could happen to her and her little boy. Doña Claudia Josefina has had her beauty salon for more than six years, this is the source of income that she has to support her family, as she is a single mother and she wants the best for her family. She plans to repay this loan with part of the income from her business. This photo is of Claudia's sister who works in the salon, when FVP loan officers went to visit Claudia she was out buying products that she needed for the salon.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building a fence around her house

loans.name: Bibi Gull Group

texts.en:
The Bibi G. group has four members. The group leader, Sha Jan, is 52 years old, and she has five children, two daughters and three sons. Sha Jan is seeking a loan for her husband’s vegetable-selling business.  She packs and cleans the vegetables and her husband sells them in the market. 

Makey wants a loan for her husband's general store, so that he can acquire more merchandise. Nafesa's loan request is for her tailoring business, so that she can buy a new sewing machine and a desk.  Bibi G. wants to take a loan for her husband’s fresh-fruit-selling business, so that he can get a new shop and improve his business. 

The group has requested a loan of 40,000 Afghanis.  They all would like to thank the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To improve a vegetable-selling business.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 30-year-old married man who lives with his parents. Along with his brothers, he contributes to the family income. Ahmad has owned a barber shop in his town for the past 15 years. He caters to a wide range of customers from his village and the surrounding neighborhoods. Today, Ahmad wishes to improve the decor of his barber shop and buy new tools to satisfy the demands of his occupation. In order to do so, Ahmad is requesting a loan of $1,000 USD.

loans.use: To improve the decor of his barber shop and buy new tools

loans.name: Bineba

texts.en:
R. Bineba is the mother of four children. She lives in Ntamulung, Cameroon.  

She has been with GHAPE since 2004 and has demonstrated a credit-worthy character exemplified by her repayments, consistent attendance at meetings, and support of her borrowing group. 

R. never had the opportunity to go to school because her parents could not afford her fees and needs, so she resorted to becoming a farmer in her youth. Sadly, her father finally died in 1990 and monkeys ate all her crops last year. She was financially down, but with the management skills she acquired from GHAPE, she was able to repay her loan. 

With this latest loan, R. is hoping to continue the business supported by her prior loans and add a motorbike business. She has requested a loan to purchase a motorbike and a few seedlings. The seedlings will eventually be farmed during the rainy season. R. is confident that her business will succeed, because her business has been successful for a long time.
  
She hopes to use the profits from her business to provide for the various needs of her family. As the sole provider for her family of four, R. hopes to increase her profits so she has enough to pay for her children’s school fees and provide for her family’s nourishment.  


About GHAPE:

R.'s loan will be provided by Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE), a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle and seedlings for farming

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina T. is from the village of Nangalisan, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 59 years old. Marina is married and has 6 adult-aged children. To make a living, Marina makes & sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Marina has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marina is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it.

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Korn

texts.en:
Korn S., 43, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for fishing and palm products. She is a housewife, while her husband is a motorbike repairman, earning an income of USD 5.20 per day.

S. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase motorbike spare parts for her husband to expand his current business and generate a better income. In the future, she would like to use any additional profits to pay for the children’s schooling. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Josephine Karembo

texts.en:
Josephine is a 35-year-old woman married to Lazarus who is a teacher. Together they have three children aged between five and 12 years. They live in the Gongoni area in Malindi where Josephine runs a tailoring school. She has been in the tailoring business for the last fifteen years and earns a monthly profit of Ksh 8,500. She also practices farming on the side.

Josephine was introduced to KADET by an existing member and has borrowed from the teachers’ SACCO (another micro-finance institute) before and is now on her second loan with KADET. She has applied for a loan of which she will utilize Ksh 30,000 to prepare her land and plant seedlings, buy a sewing machine worth Kshs 7,000, and pay for transport and miscellaneous expenses with Ksh 3,000.

With the extra earnings from this loan Josephine plans to expand her tailoring school and advertise it. Her dream is to see the tailoring school expand and improve the lives of her students.

loans.use: To pay for land preparation and plant seedlings, buy a sewing machine, and pay transport costs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Jacqueline Elizabeth

texts.es:
Jacqueline de 39 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Guasmo de Guayaquil, su esposo trabaja en una empresa de seguridad, ellos tienen tres hijos, empezó como microempresaria con una tienda hace un año atrás, con el fin de ayudar con los gastos familiares y darle una mejor vida a sus hijos. 

Empezó readecuando la sala de su casa y convirtiéndola en un local pequeño para su tienda, compro víveres y papelería para su negocio. Por esa buena decisión ahora ella tiene una tienda mixta con víveres y papelería, trabaja desde las 07h00 hasta las 19h00 todos los días. Quiere que su tienda este mas surtida por lo que con el préstamo quiere comprar vitrinas, laminas y víveres para su tienda. 

En el futuro quiere agrandar su tienda y tener sucursales.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is 39 years old and lives in the urban area of Guasmo in Guayaquil. Her husband works for a security company. They have three children. Jacqueline started her business one year ago so that she could contribute toward the family expenses and provide her children with a better life.

She remodeled the living room of her house and converted it into a small space for her business. This turned out to be a good decision because she now has a general store that offers both groceries and stationery. She works from 7am until 7pm every day. Jacqueline wants her store to be well-stocked, so she will use her loan to buy display cases, printing supplies, and groceries for her store.

In the future, she wants to expand her store and open branches.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase display cases, printing supplies, and groceries

loans.name: Massan Afi Dodji

texts.fr:
Cette dame est une femme très dynamique, elle s’est lancée en 2001 dans le commerce de pagnes. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé, sa clientèle grandit et son stock actuel ne peut répondre à la demande de tous ses  clients, pour rémédier à cela elle sollicite chez wages son premier crédit pour acheter  10  pagnes Holand et 25 pagnes HI target.
Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle contribue avec son revenu aux charges financières de la famille.
texts.en:
This lady is very dynamic and began trading in "pagnes" (West African colourful fabric) in 2001. She gets her supplies at the large market in Lomé. Her customer base is growing and her current stock is not sufficient to meet the demand of all her customers. In order to remedy this she is requesting a first loan from WAGES to buy 10 Holand "pagnes" and 25 HI Target "pagnes". She is married and mother to two children. With her income she contributes to the household expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of "pagnes"

loans.name: Kon

texts.en: Kon C., 36, lives in Chvea village, in Takeo province.  She is a recycler of various items and earns some money to support her family.  Her husband is a farmer who owns a very small piece of land to cultivate rice to sell to support his family.  They support four children, three of whom attend a local public school.  The other is a seamstress in garment factory.  So to improve production, Kon is asking for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business.

loans.use: Buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos, está casado y es padre de una hija a la cual educa y apoya en su educación.

Carlos es un joven muy dedicado a su trabajo, el trabaja como moto taxista en el sindicado “10 de Noviembre” en el trópico de Cochabamba ya como 2 años, el trabaja día a día para que su familia pueda vivir en mejores condiciones, él es una persona muy responsable, el cuenta con su motocicleta para mantener a su familia ya que es la única fuente de ingreso con la que el cuenta. 

El señor Carlos se apersono a las oficinas en busca de un crédito para la compra de una motocicleta para así poder trabajar con su propia motocicleta y no simplemente como chofer y así poder tener más ingresos para el bienestar de su familia y poder brindarles un futuro mejor a ellos.
texts.en:
Carlos is married and the father of a daughter he is educating. Carlos is a young man who is very dedicated to his work. He has worked as a motorcycle taxi driver with a group called "10 de Noviembre" in the tropic of Cochabamba for two years. He works day after day so his family can have better living conditions. He is a very responsible person who counts on his motorcycle to support his family since it is the only source of income he has. Mr. Carlos came in person to our office searching for a loan to buy a motorcycle so he can have his own motorcycle for work and not just be a driver. This will be a way to earn more money for the good of his family and to provide them with a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to work as a Taxi driver.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Home repairs

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca M. is from the city of Hinagdong, Ozamiz City. She is 40 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. Rebecca owns and operates a farming business, planting and harvesting bananas for sale. Rebecca has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Rebecca joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rebecca has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Rebecca is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Rebecca from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna G. is from the town of Banga. She is 25 years old and is married with a 7-year-old child.

Lorna owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over three years.

Lorna joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.

Lorna is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs. This loan will be her second from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia tiene 56 años, vive con sus hermanas en su casa que es propia. Desde su niñez se ha dedicado a las diversas tareas del campo sembrando papa, olluco, trigo entre otros productos más y para realizar estas tareas recibe el apoyo de sus hermanas, pero cuando requiere de hacer un trabajo más arduo, contrata el servicio de mano de obra de peones.  Cada día verifica las tierras que ha cultivado, asimismo se va a pastear sus ovejas al campo mientras espera que maduren los productos sembrados para que pueda cosecharlos y ser llevados al mercado de abastos de la ciudad mas cercana para su respectiva comercialización. Los recursos económicos que le genera esta actividad le ha motivado a seguir esforzándose, es por ello que desea intensificarse en esta actividad. Es su séptimo crédito con MFP, esta muy contento de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de semillas de papa y sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Lucia is 56 years old and lives with her sisters in her own house. Since her childhood she has worked at different jobs in the countryside sowing potatoes, olluco [a tuber] and wheat among other products, and to carry out these tasks she receives her sisters' support, but when she needs to do a more arduous job, she hires laborers. Each day she checks over the lands she has farmed. She also goes to graze her sheep in the countryside while she waits for the planted products to mature so she can harvest them and take them to the suppliers' market in the nearest city so they can be sold. The economic resources that this activity generates for her have motivated her to keep trying. For this reason she wants to increase this activity. It is Lucia's seventh loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she has financial support because she has always shown that she is responsible with her payments. She is also grateful to be part of her communal bank because all its members are responsible people and are very united. She thanks those people who will be managers of the loan she is requesting, and it will be very useful to her in the progress of her business. With the loan she is requesting, she will buy potato seeds and sacks of fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Maria Estela

texts.es:
María de 42 años, tiene un centro medico, vive en una zona periurbana llamada “Duran” este lugar esta caracterizado por su ecología en disolución.  

Ella estudio enfermería y como vio la necesidad de un dispensario de salud comenzó a readecuar un lugar para atender a las personas de el sector donde vive. Trabaja todas las tarde atendiendo a las personas. Para obtener mas dinero ella y así solventar los gastos de la clínica de salud tiene una pequeña tienda que la atiende su hija. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar medicinas, productos para la tienda como enlatados, granos. En el futuro quiere tener ya un establecimiento medico bien construido y así ayudar a mas gente.
texts.en:
Maria is 42 years old and has a medical clinic. She lives in a zone called Duran on the fringe of the city, a location known for its deteriorating ecology. Maria studied nursing and, seeing the need for a health dispensary, she began to develop a place where she could attend to people from the sector where she lives. Maria works every afternoon, caring for clients. To obtain more money, and thus cover the costs of the health clinic, she has a small store that her daughter runs. With this loan Maria wants to buy medicines for her clinic and products for the store, such as canned goods and grains. In the future she wants to have an well-constructed medical establishment, in order to help more people.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING MEDICATIONS FOR HER CLINIC AND CANNED GOODS FOR THE STORE THAT SUPPORTS IT

loans.name: Nelfa

texts.en:
Nelfa is part of the communal bank “Vida Nueva” (New life) and resides in the commune of Longaví. For the past five years, Nelfa has sold firewood and charcoal with her husband's help. Prior to this business, Nelfa operated a restaurant for 15 years from her house, the same space she now uses for her merchandise sales. 

With this loan, Nelfa plans to purchase more firewood and charcoal. Nelfa's dreams are to operate a grocery store, selling confections, fruit and vegetables. Her short-term goal is to fix her storefront, as it was damaged by the past earthquake on February 27. 

For Nelfa, the loan services provided by Kiva partner Fondo Esperanza have helped to keep her business afloat; she especially enjoys the lessons on business administration. 
  
Longaví is a commune in the Maule Region, central Chile. Its name in Mapudungun (the Mapuche language) stands for “snake head.” It's primarily a farming community situated between mountains, foothills and more mountains of lush natural beauty. Its highest point is Mount Longaví, with 3,242 meters of altitude.

loans.use: Firewood and charcoal

loans.name: Cleopatra

texts.es: Cleopatra tiene 38 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 1 año posee una librería, negocio que tiene instalado en su mismo domicilio. Desde entonces atiende todos los días, además procura que éste bien implementado su negocio con variedades de productos y artículos de oficina y escolar. Par ella este actividad le ha resultado muy rentable, puesto que la zona donde vive no hay un negocio de este rubro. En ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus hijos, quienes atienden a la clientela que son varios los que acuden en el establecimiento. En todo este tiempo ha visto como su negocio se ha establecido y eso la anima a seguir trabajando y plantearse nuevos proyectos, como el de ampliar más el espacio de su librería e implementarlo de más productos. Este es su crédito número 2 que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, afirma además que le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Asimismo agradece  a todas las personas que son gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería en útiles de escritorio como papeles metálicos y otra calidad de papel.
texts.en: Cleopatra is 38 years old. She lives with her husband and two children in their own house. For a year, she has owned a book store, which is located in her home. She works there every day and it is stocked with a variety of school and office supplies. This has been very profitable for her, since it is located in an area where there are not other businesses of this type. At times, her children help her; they work with the various customers who come to the store. During all this time, she has seen how her business has become established. This encourages her to continue working and to plan new projects, like increasing the size of her store and adding more products. This is her second loan with MFP. She is very pleased to know she has financial support. She also states that she is grateful to be a part of her community bank because all of the members are very supportive and responsible. She is also grateful for those who help to provide this loan; it will be very useful in her business’ progress. With this loan, she will invest in the purchase of more desk items and accessories like foil paper and other types of paper.

loans.use: to buy more products like foil paper and other types of paper

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose D. is currently in the business of selling beans, fish, simsim and millet along Maridi road. She is requesting a loan to stock more bags of millet and beans to sell. Rose is 30 years old and is married to a mechanic. She has 4 children; 2 of which go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a new type of business of selling clothes.

loans.use: To stock more bags of millet and beans to sell

loans.name: Aysel

texts.ru:
Aysel A. 20 let. Ona ne zamujem i jivet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Aysel uchitsya v kolledje i v toje vremya rabotayet chtobi oplatit uchebu.

Aysel uje 2 qoda kak zanimayetsya prodajey produktov. Aysel etomu biznessu nauchilas u teti. Ona prodayet pishiviye produkti , no seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit moyushiye sredstva dlya prodaji i razvitiya svoyeqo biznessa.
texts.en:
Aysel A. is 20 years old. She is not married and lives in the Absheron region together with her family. Aysel is studying in college and at the same time works to pay for her tuition.

Aysel has been selling food for more than two years. She has learned this business from her aunt. She sells groceries and now needs 2000 AZN to buy cleaning products for resale and expansion of her business.

loans.use: To buy products for resale

loans.name: Eliud

texts.en:
Eliud is 42 years old and in business. He operates a transport business in Kiambu, where he transports goods for people for a fee. His main customers are the residents of the town. He is requesting a loan of 60,000 Kes to repair his vehicle. Eliud is a member of Bidii Umoja SHG and the group has guaranteed his loan. 

Eliud also practices dairy farming for extra income. He is married and a father to three children who are in school. His hopes are to excel in the transport business and have a fleet of lorries.

loans.use: To repair his vehicle

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: La señora  Rosa María López Madriz, cuenta con 40 años de edad, casada desde hace 24 años con el señor Francisco que se dedica a la albañilería, ellos tienen 5 hijos, Erika de 22 años, Cristian de 20 años, Pablo que tiene 16 años quien le ayuda con los gastos de la casa, Dulce María de 8 años de edad y Francisco de 6 años ambos estudiantes de primaria, ella es originaria de la localidad de San Jose Purua ubicado en el estado de Michoacán. Doña Rosa pidió su préstamo para invertir en su taller de costura como son hilos, telas, estambres, pinturas para tela, pinceles, sierres etc. Ella hace bolsas, bordados en servilletas, punto de cruz en servilletas y almohadones, blusas de manta, después las decora con dibujos y las colorea. Doña Rosa vende las costuras con sus conocidas, lleva con su negocio hace 5 meses, comenta que le satisface su trabajo, sus clientas dicen que es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora con ganas de salir adelante, sus metas en la vida es sacar a sus hijos adelante que sigan estudiando, y comenta que en un futuro quisiera tener un negocio fijo y con sus ganancias podrá comprarle a sus hijos útiles escolares y los uniformes para el nuevo ciclo escolar y los medicamentos de su suegra.
texts.en: Rosa Maria L. Madriz is 40 years old, and she has been married with Francisco, a construction worker, for 24 years. they have 5 children, Erika who is 22 years old, Cristian is 20 years old, Pablo is 16 years old and he contributes to the household finances, Dulce Maria is 8 years old, and Francisco is 6 years old. The two youngest are in primary school. She is originally from San Jose Purua which is located in the state of Michoacan. Rosa requested this loan to invest in her tailoring shop by purchasing threads, fabrics, yarns, fabric paints, paint brushes, zippers etc. She makes purses, decorated handkerchiefs, decorative pillows, and linen blouses. She decorates and colors the items prior to resale. Rosa sells her products to her acquaintances, a business she has had for the past 5 months. She is very happy with the business. Her clients say that she is a very hardworking and enterprising person with a great will to come out ahead. Her goal in life is to keep her kids in school. In the future she would like to have a steady business from where she will be able to provide her kids with the school supplies and uniforms they need. She also wants to buy medicine for her mother-in-law.

loans.use: To purchase threads and fabrics.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos vive con su pareja y sus dos hijos en el distrito D. Wanchaq. El distrito D. Wanchaq se encuentra ubicado en L. provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco, llamada el distrito D. las flores y localizándose a 5 minutos D. L. plaza D. armas D. L. capital arqueológica D. América del Sur (Cusco). Cusco es una ciudad encantadora que se remonta a los tiempos D. los Incas, L. ciudad del Cusco está construida en L. base D. L. antigua ciudadeL. Inca.

Carlos tiene un pequeño taller D. automotriz donD. brinda servicios D. mantenimiento D. carros, él en sus horas libres se dedica a brindar servicios D. transporte públicos en su propio taxi. Hace varios años que se dedica a brindar servicios D. transportes y le va regular. Con su próximo préstamo, Carlos que espera recibir S/.800 nuevos soles es para comprar materiales para el taller como por ejemplo aceites D. carros, lubricantes, etc.

Carlos pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Esperanza” D. L. Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal esta en el segundo año D. funcionamiento y está bien administrado por L. junta directiva.
texts.en:
Carlos lives with his partner and two children in Wanchaq district.  Wanchaq district is located in Cusco province, in Cusco department.  It is called "The Flower District" and is located 5 minutes from the Plaza D. Armas, in the archaeological capital of South America (Cusco).  Cusco is an enchanting city which dates back to Inca times.  The city of Cusco is built on the site of the ancient Incan citadel.

Carlos has a small auto repair shop where he provides a car repair service.  In his free time he provides public transport services in his own taxi.  He has been providing public transport services for several years and his business is doing ok.  He hopes to receive a loan for 800 Peruvian soles to buy materials for his auto repair shop such as, for example, car oil, lubricants, etc.

Carlos is a member of Asociación Arariwa's "Nueva Esperanza" (New Hope) community bank which is in its second year and well run by a board of directors.

loans.use: To buy materials for his auto repair shop such as car oil, lubricants, etc.

loans.name: Ken

texts.en:
Ken K., 43, is a widowed farmer who lives her two daughters. Living in the Takeo province, she typically makes $1 every day and is aided by her daughters, who work in a garment factory. 

Ken K. is asking for a loan of $1,200 to finish her construction and purchase fertilizer.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and finish construction

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia pertenece al Banco comunal “Amigo”, perteneciente a la comuna de Recoleta. Ella se dedica a la confección y venta de uniformes escolares hace 17 años y desde  hace 3 años tiene un taller que acomodó en el patio de su casa. Su familia le ayuda en el corte y confección de los uniformes escolares; su hija borda y su marido después de su trabajo le ayuda a cortar las telas. 
Tiene como clientes frecuentes a 2 colegios, a los cuales entrega uniformes escolares (faldas, pantalones, buzos), durante el periodo de noviembre a abril. Además Sonia tiene clientes particulares, a los que les confecciona buzos y parkas en temporada de invierno.
Con este préstamo, Sonia comprará telas y cuellos para poleras. 
Su sueño es aumentar el número de clientes; es decir incluir como un cliente frecuente a un colegio más y también aumentar sus clientes particulares, de esta manera aumentar su producción y por ende sus ingresos. Sumado a esto ser reconocida.
Para Sonia los préstamos de Fondo Esperanza han sido fundamentales en su negocio, ya que le han permitido financiar y aumentar su producción. Gracias a los ingresos de su negocio Sonia ha podido financiar  los estudios superiores de su hija.
Recoleta es una de las 34 comunas de Santiago (capital de Chile) y se encuentra ubicada en el sector centro-norte del Santiago, región metropolitana. Cuenta con un activo comercio, destacando el barrio comercial de Patronato que ha acogido principalmente a comerciantes árabes (en un principio) y coreanos (en la actualidad).
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the “Amigo” communal bank in Recoleta.  She has been manufacturing and selling school uniforms for the past 17 years.  For the past three years she’s had a workshop installed in her patio.  Her family helps her cut and assemble the school uniforms; her daughter embroiders and her husband helps her cut after he gets home from work.

Two schools are her frequent buyers.  She delivers school uniforms to them (skirts, pants and sweatshirts) from November through April.  Sonia also has individual customers for whom she makes sweatshirts and parkas for winter.  With this loan Sonia will buy fabric and collars for t-shirts.

Her dream is to increase her number of customers; in other words, include an additional school as a regular customer as well as increase her individual customers so that production will increase and thus her profits as well.  And in addition to this, she wants to be well known.

For Sonia, loans from Fondo Esperanza have been fundamental for her business because they have made it possible to finance and increase production.  Thanks to income from her business Sonia has been able to pay for her daughter’s higher education.

Recoleta is one of the 34 communes in Santiago (capital of Chile) and is located in the north-central part of Santiago’s metropolitan area.  It has active commerce, a notable neighborhood being Patronato which has welcomed principally Arab merchants (at the beginning) and Koreans (now).

loans.use: For fabric and shirt collars.

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Sem S., 31, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia, an area known as one of the largest rice producing regions in Cambodia.
